Reviews.Title: “Yes, you can find a good deal in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: miller40
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend at Orchard Hotel. I had a warm welcome from the front desk upon arrival. Our room may have been recently renovated as it looked brand new. Lots of activity in the lobby of the hotel at night--it must be the great bar and band! I paid $200 USD per night through agoda.com and it included breakfast and 2 movie theater tickets. They have a nice pool and I enjoyed sitting outside watching my kids play and swim while I drink my pina coladas and mojitos (thanks Donalde)! Breakfast was of good quality and I enjoyed the Indian food in the morning. Don't worry: there are Western and Chinese options as well! I got an excellent rate at an excellent hotel. For $22 Sing you can arrange a child's check-in: it includes ice cream, a teddy from Hamley's (a British FAO Schwarz-like toy store) and lots of little extras. It must be booked in advance and I wish I knew about this before I came as it looked like something my nine yr. old would have loved.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and service”
Reviews.Author: Bjorn975
Reviews.Content: Living at the Signature Club life was very easy and rooms are very nice. On a business travel the Orchard hotel is excellent in all ways. Not to forget the service minded staff that makes life easy, especially Mavis that take very well care of her Signature customers. My third stay and will return. Kind Regards Bjørn

Reviews.Title: “Location in the heart of the Prchard shopping area”
Reviews.Author: Mikecoss
Reviews.Content: It is a really great and good valued hotel right in the CBD and just off Orchard St. Opposite the Orchard Towers (Bar/shopping/entertainment complex. great service, great value, and great nearby nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but quality of room is so-so”
Reviews.Author: Candace L
Reviews.Content: Singapore is an Asian city with comparatively less quality hotels for the price you are paying, so I was not expecting much. Orchard feels rather old, and lobby is dim. But compared to other business hotels I have stayed in Singapore, it wasn't any worse. The location of the hotel is good if you fancy a morning run around the hotel area, and to a nearby park and through some very nice residential area. Hotel is also on popular Orchard Road, so you can go out on a nice stroll to the shops and restaurants in the evening. Service is also good. Great friendly staff and efficient service. I would recommend this hotel for probably business rather than a hotel to stay on a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: Tony H
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip and took my wife and son. They looked after us very well and made us feel verrr welcome. Daisy and Aimee in the Executive club were really great and made us feel at home

Reviews.Title: “A true 5 star”
Reviews.Author: vickidfenton
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel, good location, nice room and great service. halls are pretty dark ( likely green reason) I liked that there was only a little carpet around the bed made the room feel very clean. Hotel service was awesome as was the Easter Brunch (too bad very few attended). I'm very picky and I would stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Neat...I liked it”
Reviews.Author: Mike H
Reviews.Content: I didn't know what to expect when I was told I'd been booked at the Orchard Hotel as the price was rather reasonable as opposed to what I've been paying at the Intercon. Check in was easy although if there are many in front of you checking in as well, you'll have to be prepared to wait since at the time I arrived there was only one person at reception. Got a non smoking room, called down and was quickly moved to a smoking floor. Room was tidy and well thought out with universal sockets, USB charging port, HDMI & VGA ports all laid out. Free internet as well. Shame I was spending more time meeting friends than enjoying the room. Oh, but the safe in the room was rather small. Breakfast was ok with the standard fare which was fine by me as I'm not big on breakfast. The proximity of the hotel with the shopping centers around was a boon. All in, I pretty much enjoyed my stay there. Staff was quick to attend to my requests and thats important to me.

Reviews.Title: “Good and can be improved for more”
Reviews.Author: Toa_Apple
Reviews.Content: The pro of this hotel is good location. There is no obvious con; however, it can be improved especially at old-looking lobby and improper ceiling condition. The room I stayed is newly renovated in traditional chinese style. The black colour interior makes the room quite dark. Also, at least one universal electrical socket should be provided in every room as a norm for business hotels.

Reviews.Title: “stop over”
Reviews.Author: Julie M
Reviews.Content: not to bad checking in was very slow and the bar is smal friendly service breakfast buffet was ok

Reviews.Title: “Another average Singapore Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UkBaggieBird
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after being slightly disappointed by the Traders Hotel. Not much better, although by no means bad. Friendly service, adequate cafe for breakfast and lunch, small bar with some pretty poor "entertainment" and small, nothing special, rooms. The hotel is also very busy and checking in and checking out can take an age. I'll keep looking for that better Singapore experience...

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel.”
Reviews.Author: John P
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended. Excellent hotel on orchard road. Walk able to everywhere. Busy breakfast buffet but workable

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Julie H
Reviews.Content: You can't get better, this hotel was everything we wanted and more, we first stayed here a week ago for a night on our way to Kota Kinabalu, on our return we have stayed for 4 nights. It was really nice the first time in a deluxe room but for our longer stay I decided to book a club room, as my mother and I are sharing a twin bedroom, the club room is a bit bigger. It was well worth booking this club room, it gives you access to free wifi, access to the executive club romm where exclusive breakfast is served and you can have free drinks and snacks anytime including free delicious nesspresso coffee. These things alone covered the extra cost. The staff are wonderful and friendly, going out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. Rooms are spotless although the bathroom could do with with an update. The beds are extreamly comfortable, and the rooms are well soundproofed so you can get an in disturbed nights sleep. I highly recommend a stay here especially if you need some retail therapy on orchard road.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: Linzy T
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Orchard Hotel in a few occassions, be it leisue with family or business trip; I always enjoy the good service from the staff; they recognise me and remember my preferences. Cafe staff were wonderful although they are very busy yet able to greet & serve us well. Kudos and keep up the good service. the hotel is at good location, near to shopping mall and walking to train station.

Reviews.Title: “Stay again,again and again”
Reviews.Author: BrettandFamily
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several hotels in Singapore but have now found my home away from home. In the past 6 months I have stayed at the Orchard Hotel on 7 seperate occasions and have found the hotel staff, rooms and facilities outstanding. I cannot fault anything at the Orchard that would change my mind or stop me from recommending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and courtesy employees”
Reviews.Author: sanadiba4
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Orchard Hotel several times since December 2010 and I like to stay here because of the service and the courtesy showed by the employees especially in the club floor. The last twice I stayed here, the following employees i.e. Daisy and Carolyn were extremely friendly and guest oriented. Nevertheless the other staffs at the club floor also have the same approach but I am not sure of their names. They are doing a great job. Keep it up! Thank You

Reviews.Title: “Signature club”
Reviews.Author: Daniel S
Reviews.Content: All personal very freindly. They helpn you out very good. And are always there to help you as much as they could.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!! Love the location!!”
Reviews.Author: Frequentflyer005
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and cordial. Breakfast room had a lot of variety. Room size was ok. They gave us a free baby cot which was very useful. Location of the hotel is its greatest advantage. A bus stop is by its side and an MRT Station is within 5-7 minutes walk. All attractions are close by which was important for us since we were carrying a baby in a stroller. Housekeeping was good. We got a nice view and a room on the 12th level. They have a small kids area and a good size swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “On the up”
Reviews.Author: Pete E
Reviews.Content: This hotel has changed its management team over the last several months. They are determined to improve any weaknesses that the hotel may have suffered from in the past. I have noticed significant changes being implemented that have increased my satisfaction levels, particularly in regards to the service being provided. Staff here are cheerful, polite and always willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: merc8989
Reviews.Content: Located just off the main shopping street, ie Orchard Road. Major shopping malls are within walking distance including MRT station. Rooms are decent size, clean and well equiped. Staff are friendly and helpful. Breakfast and lunch at the coffee house is excellent with good buffet spread. This hotel is at the ideal location, at the quieter side of a busy chaotic area.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: beefy1805
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days over Xmas en route to Oz. Very busy because of Xmas but service was impeccable and friendly. Nice restaurant and bar and good pool and spa facilities. Good position at top of Orchard Street with a short stroll to fantastic shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “More attention to cleaning needed”
Reviews.Author: ExpatBren
Reviews.Content: The checkin and service is very good at the lobby, and its just a shame the hall carpets, and the general room cleanliness is not up to the mark on this type of hotel. The location is great, with easy access to everything, and the hotel steak restaurant is good. Breakfast is not to the level of many other hotels in this proce range, and seems to squashed into the space, with it very busy at peak times.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, but terrible service and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Nicodem
Reviews.Content: I would put it this way: the hotel as such is average for Singapore; the service, however, is among the worst I have ever experienced. The front office in particular is in desperate need of a new manager. I attended a conference in this hotel in late November and stayed a total of 8 nights. We were a group of about 25 people and had booked the hotel well in advance. It all started when I was told upon arrival that my reservation could not be found. Instead I was offered a room rate that was considerably higher than the pre-booked one. Throughout my stay I had various managers attend to my problem and a day before my departure I was assured that everything had been clarified and that I would be billed according to my confirmed booking. The next day when we tried to check out: pandemonium. The front office had no clue who should be paying which rate and who was part of the group booking and not. As a result, people were asked to pay higher rates for their room and internet. When I complained to the manager, the mistakes were corrected. The final invoice, however, which our employer received sometime later, was again incorrect and charged a much higher rate than originally agreed. I understand that our finance department is still arguing with the hotel over this issue.

Reviews.Title: “Anything can happen here”
Reviews.Author: beryu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks and I am just amazed by how inconsistent services are delivered here. Despite the stinky lobby, the room by itself is good - newly renovated and things seemed to be new. What I didn't like though is the bathroom. The shower leaks and when you pull open the shower door, it pushes the mattress away - it just shows that things are just not well thought-out and planned. What really disappointed me is housekeeping. One day I have 2 towels on the counter, one day I had only one left, one day I had no towels, and one day the room wasn't even cleaned when I clearly had the "need housekeeping" light on! It's just CRAZY. If this is the hotel's approach of making their customer happy, then sorry, I find it hard to appreciate.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Business - just watch your bill when checking out”
Reviews.Author: CliffyCarr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Orchard Hotel while in Business in Singapore/Indonesia. Location is fantastic, Hotel is modern, clean and the staff were attentive and efficient. I would have easily given the Hotel a 4 star rating except the fright I got when I checked out... A SGD$22/night "service fee" which was not included in the room rate. I thought this was particularly misleading as after a lifetime of traveling I have never come across it before. If this is factored into the room rate at the start and you still decide to stay here then you shouldn't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not too impressed”
Reviews.Author: Raj b
Reviews.Content: not to impressed with the hotel. The rooms were pretty good very modern. The service in hotel left me very unsatisfied, the staff was quite inhosspitable and rude. I would nit reccomend this hotel or go back there again

Reviews.Title: “Faulty room keys a real letdown”
Reviews.Author: BastiAina
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location on Orchard Road. The new rooms are well appointed. The defective room keys are a real bother, though. During our three-night stay, we must have had to change keys five times. We weren't the only ones. Staff confessed these keys to be repetitive problems. The breakfast buffet got a bit tiring after the second day. The hotel would do good to inject some some variety here. Our son got sick and soiled the bed a couple of times at late hours and housekeeping were quick to address these issues. Overall, not a bad stay.

Reviews.Title: “The newly renovated room was fabulous”
Reviews.Author: jemapohexplorer
Reviews.Content: After a business meeting at the Marina Sands, Orchard Road and Orchard Hotel were so third world, relatively speaking that was. But it was more real, more Singapore. I was initially skeptical about the name, Orchard Hotel, for fear that it was in Orchard Tower where seedy Singapore is centred. Orchard Tower was a block away. The first impression you got as you enter the spacious but busy lobby was that it was a 3 star South East Asian Hotel. To the left was the reception and cafe and to the right was the bar. There was a 3 piece outfit belting out some tired old numbers accompanied by synthetic third rate music. Not a good introduction but the room was a game changer. It was newly renovated. A hotel with timber flooring will score well in my review, it does not matter that it was laminated timber. The study table and the big flat screen were welcoming although its relative position will allow watching while you are in bed. The bed and linen was so comfy. I slept soundly. The toilet and shower were clean and well stuffed. I did not have time to have breakfast or to patronize the outlets. Contacts with the staff were minimal. If you want a nice room with a nice bed to rest on, close to the malls then this is a reasonable choice.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Hugbell
Reviews.Content: This hotel appears to be two hotels in one. One for those who have and one for those who haven't. I think we came into the latter but as my title says you get what you pay for. This hotel is situated right at the top of Orchard Road very close to all of the shopping malls and only a 5-10 minute walk to the nearest MRT station but quite a distance from most of the attractions, The Singapore Flyer, Clark Quay, Marina Bay etc We arrived early in the morning well before check in and the receptionist could not have been more welcoming or more helpful. She explained that the room was not ready yet but checked us in and told us where we could get changed and have a shower if we wished (towels were provided) and what time the room would be ready. We used this facility then left our cases and went out for a coffee and a snack. When we returned the receptionist smiled and said she had been looking for us as our room was ready. How is that for service. We were disappointed with our room as it did look a little "tired" and in need of a make over but it was clean, the bed appeared to be King size and the sheets were soft and clean, but the bathroom like the bedroom was in need of renovation. Once you look around you can see how the hotel is split, even the lifts take you to different floors. I didn't realise this until I took the lift from the pool area (on the 4th floor) and realised it did not take me to my floor. Like a lot of people there appears to be a problem with the key cards as ours failed to open the room door and we had to have it re-programmed, and yes it may have been with my mobile phone but I have never had this problem before so maybe the hotel should look into this problem. We did not eat in the hotel so cannot comment on the food, but yes the alcoholic drinks in the bar are expensive but if you come to Singapore you have to expect that. One big minus as far as we were concerned was the "ladies of the night" on Claymore Street which is on one side the hotel leading off Orchard Road right where the pedestrian crossing is. I doubt if the hotel can do anything about this as it is a governmental problem (it would be interesting to hear what the hotel has to say about it as it is not the image any hotel would want to portray) (By the way we are not prudes, we lived in Singapore when there were more brothels than hotels) Did we enjoy our stay at the Orchard Hotel, yes, but it would have been much better if all the rooms in the hotel had been renovated not just those in the Cleworth wing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GolfersWairarapaNZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel for 6 nights in Feb, location is perfect, for restaurants bars, shopping! Staff are wonderful, nothing is to much trouble, best stay I have ever had at a Hotel (no Joke) it was a flawless Hotel, we were in the new Cleworth wing is is beautiful beds are huge, pool is lovely, cant say enough about this Hotel you wont regret staying here ticks all the boxes!

Reviews.Title: “Will not use again”
Reviews.Author: APS37
Reviews.Content: Terrible room with no bathroom as such, a sink by the side of the bed with a shower behind a glass screen. Taps on the sink had broken too. Took over an hour to check out on Saturday lunchtime as only 2 people on the desk were dealing with lots of frustrated guests. I actually checked out to change hotels. Travel to SG regularly with work and will not use again. Certainly does not seem a 4 star hotel to me.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel With Well Trained Staff”
Reviews.Author: joabil
Reviews.Content: Rooms are spacious and comfortable and the large walk-in shower is worthy of special mention. Service throughout the hotel was excellent and staff were friendly and helpful. We normally enjoy eating and drinking in the hotel but prices were expensive so ate out instead. There is a good choice of restaurants within a 5 minute walk of the hotel. Breakfast offered a good choice of Asian and English dishes but the dining area is not large enough for the size of the hotel with the result that at peak periods some guests had to sit at tables in the main concourse. The hotel is located at the end of Orchard Road but there is a bus stance outside the hotel and the excellent MRT is only a 5 minute walk. It is very easy and inexpensive to get around on Public Transport. All in all a very enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for a Shopper”
Reviews.Author: YardleyYoung
Reviews.Content: The room is kind of small, clean enough but the carpet is a bit sticky. They have a fitness center with 4 treadmills and 2 elliptical equipment. But the cleanliness of the fitness equipment is questioned, I can see some spots like drying sweats. And don't use the Yoga mat, it's so dirty that I think it has to be thrown away. The fitness center is open at 7am but we can ask them to unlock it earlier. To reach Ion Mall, it needs 5 minutes walk. The hair dryer is the kind that gets too hot easier so we need to wait for couple of minutes to cool down before we continue using it.but they have iron, suitable for business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, okay rooms, sleazy surrounds”
Reviews.Author: Jake23_8
Reviews.Content: Just back from extended stay here. Location is at the top of Orchard Road, handy for consumption madness of mall after mall after mall, if that floats your boat. How they all stay open I don't know, I guess there are enough rich Singaporeans to spread the materialistic sunshine around. But, it is also close to the MRT station and taxis are right outside (and relatively very cheap), so it is easy to escape to more interesting parts of town if desired. The hotel staff were very welcoming, and while they couldn't solve every problem, they certainly didn't skimp on trying. Some staff shone even above the others with the friendliness of their greetings each morning at breakfast. Rooms... Fine, just about every hotel room I've stayed in has something to quibble about, so I never expect perfection. In this case the most obvious thing was that the shower temperature varied from cold to boiling in response to a handle movement of approx 0.00001" (or 0.0000067cm in new money). The bathroom sink was also curious, as at times I got hot water from both taps, which was a novelty when teeth brushing. Air con also seemed to have no in-room override, so one was stuck with the temperature set centrally or perhaps by the cleaner. The hotel is next to the Orchard Towers, which has a sleazy reputation. When out and about with my partner I didn't notice anything, but one evening briefly ventured out on my own. Now, I may well be a more than averagely sexy babe magnet (or,er, not), but getting propositioned by beautiful young Asian women 5 times in about 50 feet right outside the hotel was good going even for me with my lived-in-but-still-got-it looks. Ahem. The place is ex-pat central, and seeing the dismal taxi queues of elderly white blokes, beerguts-a-hanging, holding hands and avoiding eye contact with wee Asian women the age of their daughters, was saddening. Cooling off was possible in the 4th floor open air pool, where you may also have to jockey for a lounger with the vast numbers of overlaying Lufthansa staff (the hotel seems to have a contract deal with das airline). Food and drink not cheap, but then little is for the visitor to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, tatty room”
Reviews.Author: kaspiraitus11
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in this hotel Feb '12 whilst visiting our Singapore plant for 2 days. This is a very well located hotel with exit directly onto the fantastic Ochard Road. There are a large number of staff (some of which it is difficult to figure what they actully do?) so the level of service is generally very good. My colleague got a free upgrade to an exec room, he was lucky. My room was quite shabby to be honest. The carpet had several pulls in it, the furniture had worn paint patches and one of the plug sockets had a pin stuck in the live terminal, meaning it obviously could not be used, but was also potentially dangerous. The room "keys" are completely useless. I had to have mine reprogrammed 3 time in one day. "Have you had it anywhere near a mobile phone or credit card?" was the question from the young lady on reception. "Yes.........." . Probably 90% plus of all their customers have both of those offending items, so as a system it is not a very robust one. We had the buffet breakfast, in which the hotel has abviously tried to cater for as many tastes as possible. This was not completely successful from my point of view, as the "egg chef" did not recognise what constituted a properly cooked egg. Did not go hungry, but did not really enjoy it either. As with most places in Singapore the bar prices are ridiculous - over £7 for a pint of Heineken!!

Reviews.Title: “This Orchard Bears No Fruit!”
Reviews.Author: StuckinBangers
Reviews.Content: Ever stayed in a hotel where the reception desk is slow and constantly 3 or 4 deep in frustrated customers? How about where the lifts seemingly take an eternity to arrive? Or how about when you get through all of that and your room key doesn't work and have to go back and start again! By now you can probably guess this was not a great experience. The rooms have been renovated and are quite nice for this grade of hotel. Underwhelming at best. Pluses are location and value as anything under $300 in Singapore is a blessing. I see other people rate this hotel highly so perhaps I got it at a bad moment (although a lot of people seemed to be complaining at the reception!).

Reviews.Title: “Goood Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Varunz
Reviews.Content: Simply loved the Hotel . I stayed there for 2 nights at their signature club room, the rooms were bit small but very clean and very upmarket . The approach to hotel is its USP , situated right on the orchard road . The staff of the hotel is very good , though lil slow .

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Glyn E
Reviews.Content: Our Christmas was spent in Singapore. Last minute booking at the Orchard Hotel was carried out in an excellent and efficient way. Our twin room had the additional third bed (cot) provided . The hotel was completely full but the staff were so helpfull under the conditions , well maintained as one would expect for a four/five star hotel. One drawback was the crowded reception and the dining room being filled to capacity at breakfast. However they provided additional breakfast facilities on he first floor to cope with the capacity. The orchard hotel for those who dont know is reasonable cost wise but has the great advantage of being at th top end of Orchard Rd and Tangling Rd. Excellent location for the "shopaholics" Sentosa Island can be reached easily within 20minutes (Taxi) or by Cable car which is a must do experience. Not failing to mention the world famous Singapore Zoo , and Night safari we actually spent 12 hours there with my children all very enjoyable even in the rain but...be warned exhausting !!! Universal studios also a must see but avoid any holiday period it is far too crowded often a wait of one hour for the attractions...advised to get "fast track passes (at 50$S)

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: raffa p
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been partly renovated so be sure to book a room in the new Claymore wing or one of the club rooms. It is a fairly standard four star business hotel, the lobby has seen better days and so the bar on ground floor. We book a room on the Claymore floor and it was new and it had all the amenities you would expect. Also it comes with free wireless Internet connection which is nice. The location is very convenient but honestly I do expect more in terms of service from an Hotel of the Millennium chain or generally from an hotel in this price range. I booked online stating our arrival time and that we needed a cot traveling with a child, we arrived around 9pm at the hotel, I asked for the cot during the check in and I was told the cot was there, when we arrived in the room there was no cot and we had to wait almost 1 h for housekeeping to send someone... Staff is nice but most of them have basic English or /and seem very inexperienced. If you complain with them or ask for something they will smile at you very kindly but no one will do anything about it. There are many hotels in the same location as this one, I was unimpressed by their service and we so many options nearby I think I will try another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on the "seedier" end of Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: MacGrumpy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. I was pleasantly surprised to find that the refurbished hotel was actually pleasant and large, when we checked in. Apart from the location and the large rooms, there was nothing else special about the hotel. Pros: - Great location - Big room - Good service from the bell boys at the taxi stand Cons: - Air con was too loud - Air con kept fluctuating to be VERY COLD or just blowing normal air - Pillow barely had any contents to have a good night sleep - Standard blanket barely had any contents to have a good night sleep - Wifi was not free - I am not sure if the entire floor is non-smoking, but we had a non-smoking room but our neighbors were all chimney smokers. So we could smell it in the corridors and also if we are inside our room, standing near the door. Would I come back? Only if they had an internet special for under $200 a night. Otherwise, there are better places out there.

Reviews.Title: “Picked the wrong Wing”
Reviews.Author: eriskorp
Reviews.Content: Being "on the road" for nearly three weeks, it was about time to look for central, but budget level, hotels. I ended up being "cheesy" selecting "superior" room in the hotel, not paying too much attention to the "newly renowated" "other wing"; hence ending up in the "wrong wing". Anyway, I ended up with two rooms for my family of 5; at a cost of S$ 276/room - that´s nearly S$ 550/night. Location is excellent, particularly if on business or shopping spree - hence rating three, but cleanliness, size and quality of breakfast is really poor. I am safe at home now, so no need to worry - but if you want to "pull" - pick another hotel. If you want prime location, but is not too worried about the rest - it is a good choice. Good advice; If you "normally" need two taxi´s for the airport - ask the concierge to book "minibus" - rate as of 6th Jan 2012 - S$ 50 for the whole lot. That´s a bargain. I won´t make it to the airport in Stavanger by bus for that price. E

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Property”
Reviews.Author: LPL33
Reviews.Content: All were great! Definitely will be back. Staff were friendly and nice rooms. Location very convenient too.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel we have stayed at before but the Executive Service (Signature Lounge) has been excellent!”
Reviews.Author: buston
Reviews.Content: Singapore is our favorite destination for Holidays sand we are delighted so far at the orchard.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, with free upgrade”
Reviews.Author: mortalmerlin
Reviews.Content: After reading some other reviews we decided to opt for a deluxe club room for our stay in the Orchard. I was traveling with my wife and we flew in on seperate flights. She was due to arrive first and as a supprise I asked the hotel to arrange a merc S class to collect her. Nothing was too much toruble for the concierge and there was a driver waiting for her in the airport. The check in was swift as if you're in a club room you can go straight up to the club lounge. To our supprise we recieved a free upgrade to a club suite. The suite although compact had a full range of features and the bathroom was out of this world. There was a rain shower big enough for 4 and a reasonable sized bath with a large TV built into the wall at the end. The club lounge was relaxing and had a good buffet available. The club floor it's self could do with a coat of paint but on the whole our stay was excellent and we look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: gerrycullen
Reviews.Content: Singapore is not cheap in any sense of the word but the Orchard Hotel represented relatively good value, We had 3 rooms and upgraded to executive rooms and found it good value, afternoon tea, wifi, cocktails all included. A word of caution the street outside the hotel has many hookers plying their trade so if you are easily offended, find another hotel. Rooms were adequate and met our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Location is a winner”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneAbertawe
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, the rooms were small but the decor was nice if a little worn. The staff were great and nothing seemed a problem, the concierge during the day had excellent local knowledge.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably good”
Reviews.Author: traveladict_del
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located with easy access to public transport.Every other place is closeby and Orchard Road in itself is hip and happening.The rooms are clean and fresh. The housekeeping does a wonderful job and with a smile.Compliments to the young men and women for doing a great job.Rooms would be cleaned by the time we returned from our outings.Room service is reasonably good(S$5/= for extra cutlery per set isnt justified though) The breakfast is sumptuous.We were there on the year end and so it got crowded during breakfast time.But the hotel arranged to cater to the rush by setting up a stall in the ball room on the first day of the new year and all was well.The fixed lunch and dinner at the hotel restaurants is pricey.In room dining is predominatly south asian with limited continental/no indian options.Pricey again(A la carte dinner for 4 @ over S$80/=) The staff at the reception and cafe are efficient but could try and be a little more friendly.I believe they are stressed because of the constant flow of guests but thats their job, isnt it? 5 nights were nice.The a.c works well.No disturbance at the upper floors.A reasonably good stay. ****************************************************************************************************************** A few things about Singapore i'd like to share : 1)Cabs , shopping and restaurants are costly , avoid if you can 2)Dont order for seafood which doesnt have a listed price on the menu.There is a likelihood of a ripoff there 3) Purchase an 'Express' pass for Universal Studios esp during the holiday season/weekends.It saves time and energy by helping beat the long queues , waiting time at the popular rides upto 90 minutes 4) Its a long wait for a cab at the Jurong Bird park at closing time.Try and leave a bit early.Not many cabs go that way in the evening 5) Indian food is available in the adjacent mall."D Indian Restaurant" is a nice place to have 'pratas'(paranthas for the uninitiated) and curry.Ask for Shaikk .He is friendly and helpful.Prices are reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Your real estate on Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: XmasKid
Reviews.Content: The Copthorne Millenium is generally a chain of 4 star hotels that provide value for money and synonymous with a good standard, especially in the Australasian region. The Orchard Singapore lived up to this expectations and we enjoyed our recent stay in their renovated Claymore wing. We chose the hotel as it offered a competitive price during a peak travel season, is on Orchard Road and has interconnecting rooms. Travelling as a family of four with two teenagers in tow, we took two rooms in the Executive wing. Checking-in was slightly slow at the lobby as reception appeared to be understaffed despite there being an "express" lane for Executive Club guests. After some time in queue, we were whisked to the Club Lounge for guest registration which was completed in a quickly and efficiently. Our interconnecting rooms, king and twin bedding, on the 14th floor were welcoming and clean. The beds were comfortable but request for firmer pillows if needed. Lighting in the rooms could be improved, as the air conditioning system which seemed to turn itself down during the wee hours of the morning thus warming the environment up enough to cause slightly frustration. Included in the room price was breakfast, snacks and cocktails in the Club lounge, internet connection, complimentary local calls around Singapore and a $20 laundry credit per room per day. The buffet breakfast offering at the Lounge was adequate with a range of cold and cooked dishes and fruits. The Executive Club team are attentive and helpful with bookings and advice. Aside from breakfast, we had in-dinning service one evening. The room service menu was surpisingly extensive with choices from all the restaurants in the hotel. Although on the pricey side (average main was SG22.00 ++) our experience was good. Meals arrived within 30 minutes at peak hour even though we were warned that service could take between 45 minutes to 1 hour. Quantities were generous and the quality was good. The hotel frontage is off Orchard Road towards the Clemenceau end. The hotel is connected to the Orchard Plaza which offers a shortcut to Orchard Road. The nearest shopping centers are Tangs and the Forum across the road with a short walk to Wisma Atria and Ion. The hotel lobby setting is reasonably formal with limited seating. A pianist is featured in the evenings in the main area while a live band played in the bar. The hotel restaurants were geared up for the Chinese New Year celebrations which suggests a good local patronage. Each of our rooms were $420++ per night but prices are generally around $380++ during the low season. Would we return? Most likely as the hotel offers value (especially at the low season prices), a good location anas friendly staff. Just as important for a family group, is that the Orchard Hotel is one of the few in Singapore with interconnecting rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Money for what it is worth”
Reviews.Author: KellieJ71
Reviews.Content: The staff were extremely helpful. They went out of their way to accomodate me with a new room, after the last room they gave me had a smoking person in it. Please! If you are a smoker, please ask for a smoking room! Don't smoke on a non smoking room! The breakfast was fine, but it is the same thing every morning! Get up early, it gets very busy! If you don't have the breakfast included, don't bother paying the $16. You can get breakfast elswhere! The hotel is walking distance to the MTR, and it is not overally far from the shopping district. It is everywhere! The room's are clean, but can be cleaned rather late at night. It's not a problem, if you come back late I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and Nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Sleepingoldfish
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at this hotel with Children during school holiday. Good location, easy to access to anywhere, near Botanic Garden, nice walk after Dinner, manmade lake, with swans I think. Back hotel, the room is clean and concierge are very infomatic. We will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Singapore Christmas at Orchard Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ms_RTG
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel due to its location (Orchard Road) and because there was some sort of special deal for staying more than 3 nights. On check-in date, the affable duty manager Mr. Quam immediately attended to me when he saw that the normal check-in queues were getting very long, being Dec. 23 and very close to the peak day of the year. In addition, most of my room-related requests were all accommodated. Our rooms were done in very classy taste- one in ming blue, and the other in celadon green. Very comfortable and pleasing to the eye. Warning, however: if you stay on the 17th floor, make sure you DO NOT get a room right below the Signature Lounge. One of our rooms was unfortunately located below the lounge (on the 18th) so I, being a light sleeper, would be awakened as early as 6am by footsteps clack-clacking on the wooden floor above my ceiling. If only the lounge floor were carpetted, this would not be a problem; however, I was told that the design of the lounge calls for a carpet-free flooring. I was also told that other guests have complained about the noise as well. Other bad things: they charge a "service fee" of SGD 5.00 if you ask for a bucket of ice. On Dec. 26, they forgot to replace my bath towels and I had to call 4 times before they finally brought new ones. On Dec. 27, we waited 1 hour for our luggage to be brought down to the lobby. This is very undesirable; one could actually be late for his/her flight with this kind of slow service. One of the Filipino bellhops at the driveway had an irritating air and pretentious accent but the other Filipino bellhop was very pleasant and amiable so he was the one who got a generous tip from us upon checkout. Other than these, we had a nice stay (overall). Location is very convenient and in a quiet area of Orchard Road, but is beside restaurants, drugstores and groceries.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel off Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: KhimLee
Reviews.Content: Was in Singapore for business and stayed here for 2 nights - this a very average hotel located near one end of the shopping belt and off the main road. The lobby, pick-up/drop-off areas and elevators all look rather old and tired but the room itself was pretty well-appointed and looked recently refurbished. I checked in pretty late but there were still local crowd hanging around the lobby area and the music (from the bar?) was quite loud. Given the choices available would probably not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: catzultr
Reviews.Content: definitely a must stay in Singapore. Very accessible to Singapore downtown. Excellent service. Warm people (many Filipinos are work in this hotel) Yummy breakfast (international cuisines available)

Reviews.Title: “good location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: DrFanta
Reviews.Content: If you need a hotel closed for shopping places. This is a good choice with good services and nice breakfast. Hotel staffs are very helpful and good in English. There is a free shuttle bus stop at this hotel and take you to Universal studio all day. Very convenient. Also, you can leave the bag after checked out for go shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CrewJoe
Reviews.Content: First time in Singapore, wasn't too impressed. There were a lot of locals in the lobby waiting to eat in the restaurant, because of this the lobby was quite loud. The room was adequate but not as nice as I expected. I was to stay here for 7 nights but checked out after 2 nights. This hotel is located at the end of Orchard Road which has a lot going on. It felt like a seedy area as well . I was able to get a much nicer hotel in Chinatown which was superb

Reviews.Title: “Suit business traveller with non working partner”
Reviews.Author: zizzle14
Reviews.Content: For business, the hotel offered good service all round, wide variety of buffet breakfast items from 6.30, and good restaurant - Chinese upmarket. Suit business entertaining but on pricey side. The club floor rooms are extremely comfortable, with marble bathrooms and nice quality toiletries, my room had a rainforest shower with body jets. wifi worked well in the room, desk reasonable size and small stationery items provided. Taxis easy to obtain unless peak hour- at theses times definitely book one ahead to be sure you depart when required and allow extra time for slow moving traffic. For a non working partner, The hotel is located at one end of the major shopping strip and also close to the botanic gardens. Taxi anywhere else such as Chinatown in Singapore is cheap, reliable and haven't found a driver that doesn't speak good English. The gym is larger than most with good range, and pool area is spacious. Overall clean quiet on club floor, bar had live entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Ryanjoh
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Orchard for many years now The service is consistent and the staff especially in the Signature Club are fantastic They have looked after me and my family over them years

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: HoffmannM
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel,executive club was fantastic.specially mention Mr.Richard!!Stunning!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in somewhat shady neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Uetzi-Team
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard hotel for a week on a business trip. The hotel was chosen by our travel department, and I would not have selected it myself due to it's location (it's on the somewhat slower/quieter end of Orchard Street, the big shopping district). The interior was fine, reasonably new but somewhat "neutral" and, if at all, tacky in ambiente. It seemed as if it didn't try to make any particular "shiny" apperance like one is used to in most bigger hotels in Singapore. There is live music in the lobby bar most night of the week which might add entertainment value for some. The breakfast service was efficient with a large through-put in their dining area. The restaurant/dining area seemed busy for most meals. Still only an overall poor rating (for price) for the hotel also due to it's surroundings: As most taxi drivers will tell you with a smirk the building behind the hotel is one of the places where prostitution - which is legal in Singapore - is a significant business. Even without the taxi driver's relevation it is fairly obvious when walking outside after 9 PM in the direction of Orchard Road that there are many lonely women or men that want to appear like women waiting. So, despite the fact that many business people and international airline crews use the hotel, and that it cannot police it's surroundings, I would give it a poor rating, especially if you are on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Always a good stay”
Reviews.Author: william820
Reviews.Content: The Orchard is a very good hotel located right in the centre of Singapore at the end of the main street, Orchard Road. Rooms are very nice and the staff are very helpful. Food is ok however the room service menu could do with a little bit of work. All in all a very good stay and strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: neelu40
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very centrally.The staff is polite and helpful.The place is surrounded with malls .Very easy to go grab a bite, iam glad we did not have included breakfast as every morning my husband and i would walk down to the food plaza nearby and try different homemade goodies -very yum.The rooms are clean too.Over all a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “very decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Uwe V
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orchard hotel for 3 nights, looks like the room was recently refurbished. Very nice design and comfortable bed. Breakfast is good and tasty, big selection for all nationalities. Maybe the lobby, restaurant and bar area needs some refurbishing too, looks outdated especially compared to the rooms....

Reviews.Title: “2nd. visit and not dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: littlemass
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orchard some 3 years ago, upgraded to a de lux room and was not dissapointed, also included breakfast which was very good. Hotel is relaxed and deserves its 4 * status. Situated on Orchard Road within easy reach of shops, restaurants and the MTR station which is an excellent way to get around Singapore. Nice swimming pool and leisure facility with bar in reception area (although no live entertainment as last time which is dissapointing). A good hotel and would not hesitate to return Singapore is now very expensive so if visiting make sure you have enough holiday money !!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with very helpful polite staff”
Reviews.Author: Aebaird
Reviews.Content: Lovely Centrally located hotel. Even better if you have the pleasure of using the 17th floor executive lounge club. The staff there, Richard, Mavis and Cheryl are fantastic. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing for price paid”
Reviews.Author: VivaciousNewcastle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the Singapore Grand Prix in 2011 as my husband was working at the race, while my toddler daughter and I amused ourselves. The room rate was reasonable compared with other similar hotels during this period but we felt ripped off by the end of our stay. The room was very small and dark, didn't have a fresh feel and looked onto the side of another building. There was an overwhelming feeling of disappointment as we walked in. The porter that brought the case in did not lift it onto the rack for me, even though it is obvious that I am pregnant, then hung around for a tip - needless to say he didn't get one. The cot requested for our toddler was in the room, however this left no room down one side of the bed due to the cramped size of the room. There was also no blanket provided for the cot or additional towels for the baby. When I requested these things from room service there was a long delay before they were brought, and the staff who spoke virtually no English brought wrong items before they understood what I was asking for (and I consider myself as a good communicator with non-English speakers as a teacher of ESL). The location is a 20-minute walk away from the station past a building on a notorious street corner full of prostitutes and I felt uncomfortable although not totally unsafe as a woman walking home alone at 10pm. The swimming pool was dull and was not suitable for families. The children's room advertised on the website was a bare room with the shell of some sort of wendy house and no toys or facilities for children. Also, be warned that taxi drivers know this as the Orchard Hotel, NOT the Millenium Orchard, which is what our emailed booking form called it. I realise that hotels charge a premium during peak seasons such as the GP, but we felt ripped off and did not enjoy anything about our stay here. I would never stay her again nor recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Property”
Reviews.Author: abvb21
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent property located on the starting of Orchard Road. The rooms are very nice. But the sizes are slightly small. Buffet breakfast is very good. The room rates are quite expensive. As compared to other properties in Singapore it is moderately priced, as hotels in Singapore are quite expensive. Would definately stay at this property again in my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Experience”
Reviews.Author: wombleflier
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel approximately 6pm after a 12 hour flight from London. Although the check-in time is 2pm and we had guaranteed our arrival with a credit card we were told the room was not ready. The receptionist was extremely polite and apologetic, and gave us a voucher for a complimentary drink while we waited. We were told it would be ready within 45 minutes. For a hotel of this quality this is totally unacceptable at this time of day and there is really no excuse not to have a room ready. We returned after 45 minutes to be told it would be a further 15 minute wait. At this point we expressed our dissatisfaction and were then allocated a room on the executive level. It was nicely decorated but looking at the hotel plans it was one of the smallest rooms in the hotel with only one bed. We had booked a twin bedded room and were not advised the substitute was a double room but as we just wanted to shower after such a long day we just accepted it. So, not a good start. On the plus side all the staff that we dealt with were exceptionally polite and friendly and as helpful as possible. It is ideally located in Orchard Road. On the negative side the long delay for our room was not acceptable and the standard of the room was only satisfactory. Had we paid for an executive room we would have been extremely disappointed with the one allocated and would not have stayed. All in all I feel there are better hotels to stay in this area and this price range - rather disappointing

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: ADEWONG
Reviews.Content: It is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in Singapore. The service staff are not well trained - knocked your door when DND sign was on; slow response to your request; poor breakfast buffet...will never come back!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs updating”
Reviews.Author: 17Dec1903
Reviews.Content: The first room I was assigned to hadn't been used in a while and some things weren't working (lights, switches) and very dusty. After moving me to another room, I found other problems (no hot water in the shower). Service was excellent (very attentive), but for the price, the things in my room should have been working.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible phone system -- cannot get through for service”
Reviews.Author: Edinaglobetrotter
Reviews.Content: The worst phone system I have encountered in any hotel in the world, and I always thought Singapore hotels would deliver amazing service. You cannot get connected to anyone -- concierge, front desk, room service, guest --- for several minutes -- as the meaningless voice when you dial keeps saying "Thank you for calling the Orchard hotel...to return to the operator, press zero" and then goes into a loop doing this whether you press zero or not. This is true whether you are calling for service from the room or calling from outside (in my case, from overseas). We chacked out 5 days early because of this. Simply infuriating...

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: rohit28788
Reviews.Content: Located at the Shopping freak Orchard Road, this star property was excellent. The employees were very courteous and helpful. Signature room was where stayed those three beautiful nights and as per Singapore standards, the room Took My Breath Away - it was marvelous. Elegant bedding and a great restroom. House keeping was remarkable too. When you are staying at Signature room, your complimentary breakfast is at the top floor of this sumptuous hotel unlike other rooms which have their Buffet breakfast at Lobby. Buffet Breakfast had something for everybody and coffee machine put up there deserves lot of accolades. All in all the stay at Orchard Hotel along with the warmth of Singaporeans made my trip a real pleasurable one.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: Dyet92
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights on business, November 2011. The hotel is well located at the top end of Orchard Road which is the main shopping street in Singapore. Check in was hassle free, breakfast was included in my room rate and every room and public area had free wifi, what's not to like? My room was decently spacious, the bed was comfortable and there was a good sized bathroom with decent toiletries, a bath and separate shower cubicle. Mini bar and tea and coffee making facilities are all in room. The choice at breakfast was just fine, something for everyone at the buffet, regardless of nationality. The foyer had a nice sized bar area and a decent ambience. Price wise, the hotel was a little better priced than other surrounding hotels (by Singapore standards anyway) and I found the service to be good. This was my first trip to Singapore and was I was warned by my host about Orchard Towers a 2 minute walk from the hotel. Orchard Towers is essentially a multi level shopping mall by day, but at night it becomes a different place when the bars open. Lots of "working" girls who aren't shy in getting your attention. That said, they do accept a polite no thank you and just move along to look for someone else. As long as you are not worried by this type of thing then you'll be fine staying at the hotel, Singapore is a very safe city and I didn't once feel uneasy.

Reviews.Title: “Lootera”
Reviews.Author: hi2n
Reviews.Content: this hotel though claims to be five star but is not more than 4 star , it is less value for money. service is pathetic . you have to wait for 30 mins for billing and check in and no body bothers abt this. but location is very good . I think it is best.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but not value for money”
Reviews.Author: prakdora
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two weeks in Nov/Dec 2010 that was booked by our company. Rooms are of standard quality and not so great about it. It is understood that the front block is an old one while the other side has been refurbished. Anyway the location is very good on the Orchard road, a relaxed shopping area. But the hotel lobby is most of the time is very crowded, hence at the time of check out one must approach the reception at least half an hour before your estimated time or else chances ofmissing one's flight is always there. In the evening crew of an airline comes in for check in and check out after few hours. Hence in the evening it is so crowded I alwyas avoided the main entrance but rather always made side entry. Rather than business travellers, this hotel is a good one for tourists and families.

Reviews.Title: “Orchard Hotel Singapore.”
Reviews.Author: Sean C
Reviews.Content: Clean and modern hotel. Internet will cost you S$15 per hr which you must use in one session. There are free bottles of water in your room but there are bottles that cost S$25 for two also in your room so be sure which is which. The breakfast is not bad starts from 6.30am. The food in general was good. Laundry is a complete rip off and by far the most expensive I have come across. If your there for a while there is a cheaper place in the mall oppisite the hotel.Allow two days for this service. This hotel is not for a backpacker.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but dont use the dry cleaning service!!!”
Reviews.Author: CloudAngel
Reviews.Content: I would like to say I couldn't fault this hotel as we did have a lovely time on our honeymoon, but I put my Karen Millen dress in for dry cleaning as we had just arrived on the orient express & had my favourite dresses with me after a week of decadence on the train! Normally I would have waited until we got home to get it cleaned, but as we were away for a month I thought it best to get it cleaned and we were in a 4 star hotel so what could go wrong ... Right? Wrong!! I got woken up by a local lady knocking at my door (not hotel staff) the next morning speaking to me in another language all excited & pointing at the dress! I was so tired & could not understand her so I assumed she was asking me about what the watermark was from so I nodded my head saying yes I want to get the champagne mark out of the dress! When I got it back it had a long line down the front like someone had burnt it with an iron! When I complained about this to the manager he was not interested saying that they send the dresses out to a local company and it was not their responsibility if the dress was damaged! He offered some compensation in the form of knocking the use of the business room faculities off our bill, a total of £60, but this was not even half what I had paid for this dress!!! He asked me to leave the dress with him & he would look into it, but I did not trust he would follow up on this and I wanted to see if any uk dry cleaners could remove this mark they had left! I was correct in my thinking as when I got home I could not get a reply from him at all as I emailed him quite a few times which he just ignored! The hotel itself was lovely & location was good but their lack of professionalism tainted this leg of our honeymoon & I will never get dry cleaning done in any hotel again because of this... As no one would take ownership of their mistake!!

Reviews.Title: “Tortured in Orchard....slightly”
Reviews.Author: summerskye3
Reviews.Content: We descended upon Singapore for a girls' weekend. Needless to say, spirits were high and to some extent, expectations were riding high too. Upon arriving at the Orchard Hotel past 6pm due to a delay in our flights (and to make matters worse, a quasi turbulent flight) we were looking forward to getting to the hotel, chuck our luggage, freshen up and head out. However, we were thwarted by our rooms being not ready. The queue at the reception area was long and from what we could gather, there were also many other irate customers whose rooms were not ready. The front desk personnel who checked us in was also unsympathetic and clearly, did not believe in service with a smile. Having said that she did inform us that she would upgrade us to the club level with club facilities. We were then invited for the evening cocktails and was told that once our rooms were ready we would be informed. We waited for what seemed like an eternity and finally one of the rooms was ready. At around 9pm, we were informed that the 2nd room was ready but when we got to the room, the configuration was not what we requested for. To cut a long story short, we eventually got our room at 10pm. The stay for the rest of the weekend was pleasant. If the hotel can get their check-in procedure nailed, it would be a perfect hotel for a stay in Singapore. Location wise, it is great. The Sunday dim sum (yumcha) was fabulous. The hotel is slightly busy in the lobby but hey, we can't have it all....

Reviews.Title: “Nice business hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: JerDok
Reviews.Content: Stayed in hotel for 3 nights, it is located in Orchard road that is the most busy shopping street in Singapore. Room was very quiet as it was not facing the road. Nice and clean with all necessary facilities. Good buffet breakfast with a variety of foods.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Oldies”
Reviews.Author: gingermegs52
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for four nights we are 65 and 70 years old. I was impressed at the foyer it is beautiful, but my opinion changes when we got to our room. We had two single beds and the room was very squashy but clean. Staff were not in any hurry to be of assistance as we struggled with our bags. Found the a bit expensive. We would not stay there again in fact on our return trip we stayed at the Park Hotel Clark Quay which was brilliant

Reviews.Title: “OK for business or if you just want to SHOP!”
Reviews.Author: Mango212
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few nights on business, and it was fine for the purpose. In terms of visiting Singapore for leisure... unless you just want to hit the shops of Orchard Road, you might be better looking elsewhere, as the non-stop shopping/consumerism of Orchard can get a bit much every time you step outside the front door. However, it's still cheap to get taxis wherever else you want to go, or you can take a walk up the road to the Botanic Gardens for some peace & quiet. The buffet breakfast for the exec rooms had far less choice than would be expected for the size of hotel, and was a little disappointing. The pool area is fine if a bit characterless for cooling down after a day of humidity in SG.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect busines & shopping hotel but for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: Darek_Legnano
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel for 1 night... The new rooms are just fine nice design with modern stile... Bathroom is not perfect has got some bits and pieces that need attention unfortunately... Service is quite good I’ve been there at least 4 times... food acceptable overall. Its good location for business if you need to visit people around the central area is perfect the same for shopping just on the Orchard road... I want to make this point clear if you think that Singapore is great place to shop because off all the publicity you are right only for a variety of brands and shops but after that nothing else, is just dead expensive... everything you find in Singapore is just 20-30% more expensive than in Europe (Milan for example)... Also this hotel... But unfortunately this is Singapore... The weather is ok if you are inside the shopping mall after that Outside you find high humidity and rain coming and going plus heat... Have a nice time!

Reviews.Title: “good choice for business and travel”
Reviews.Author: thoschdo
Reviews.Content: since a couple of years I always stay at the Orchard Hotel when I am in Singapore. The staff is friendly and the rooms are very good. the pools is a good one and big enough gym, too. The breakfast is excellent, offering all kind of delicatesses round the globe. the location is central on the Orchard Road with plenty of shopping and dinner occasion in a short walking distance. That makes it quite convenient for discovering the spot scene of Singapore The Orchard is my best choice for staying in Singapore for business or with the family with value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Ants...”
Reviews.Author: Morikoro
Reviews.Content: 2011/Sep (3 niights) for business. (Japanese) - Found troop of ants There are two wings (buildings) in this hotel and the old one is awful. Sometime you can find ants on the table even in the toilet. (not sure in another wing) It is often the case with hotels in Sin but rarely in 4-5 star. - Chashier was very slow There are only 2 counters for checking in/ cheking out. Every thime you can see long Q. - Awful bed size and poor amenity Small bed and cups furnitured were dirty (with coffee stain) Toothbrush is on demand but taking 20 mins after ordering. Shampoo and rinse are no-branding products and felt poor for 5 star hotel amenity. -Price is no advantage or meri dsepite company rate Cost around SGD 300 including tax and breakfast. Expensive than most of travel agencies. - Goood point Breakfast is tasty although num of choices are standard-level. Good access to Orchard and easily can get taxi

Reviews.Title: “good setting”
Reviews.Author: HappyHornet4
Reviews.Content: Good settingt, top of Orchard road, Ideal for shoping, Rooms good and clean, Service very good. Check in and oiut very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location on Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: Keane79
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, i have stayed on a few occassions now and always a great experience. As a solo traveller when visiting singapore, this is a very safe hotel and right at the beginning of orchard road for shopping. The staff are helpful. Bit of a wait at reception on all occassions due to the volume of people. Room very clean and modern

Reviews.Title: “Top location head of Orchard, attractively remodeled, fair pricing”
Reviews.Author: Andy7P
Reviews.Content: The new "Claymore" wing is fully remodeled, room is attractive - light colors, hardwood floors and rug, nice desk area etc. Attractive, classy lobby areas and very good breakfast buffet. Nice pool if you need it. A few minor annoyances - seems like they need to up the efficiency of their procedures... Check-in was slow and confused. No details on breakfast or Internet charges were provided at check-in so had to check back, and had to spend time getting front office involved in checking my Expedia booking details. Internet requires a username and password that you have to call reception for - unnecessarily complicated, (and why not give it at checkin). These are not showstoppers and overall this is a good deal, and not a budget tourist place. It's a 3.5-4 star experience hotel, clean and sparkling in a great location and prices are fair.

Reviews.Title: “Very Smooth Stay at the Orchard Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amsner
Reviews.Content: We were making a visa run from Thailand and decided to make a short family holiday out of this trip. The hotel is very conveniently located- right on Orchard Road and a few steps from the Thai embassy, shopping, restaurants, etc. The pool was very nice and the hotel was stroller friendly- a must for us with our little one. Food was expensive at the hotel and in Singapore in general, so I would recommend eating out at the more reasonable restaurants near by. If you are there to shop, you can't go wrong with this hotel, which is a stones throw from many malls. We enjoyed the Singapore Zoo and the Lion King very much and were able to travel easily around using taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Lisa R
Reviews.Content: the first time we stayed at this hotel it was myself and my youngest son aged 12. the room was nice and it was very clean. So I booked our next two trips to Singapore and booked the orchard hotel at the same time. How very disappointed we were. The room we were given was below a three star standard and it was dirty. The reception very kindly changed our room, only she did not hesitate to mention that i had booked a superior room only and that was their superior room. I found that very odd because it did not look like any of the superior room photos i had seen and superior should not mean dirty! We chose to forgo our booking the next time I went to Singapore I chose a different hotel and it was lovely. It is my sons birthday in November and he really wants to stay at the orchard hotel because he only came the first time and loved it. I have booked to go back there due to the first time the room being clean and nice. However i do have very mixed feelings as i was so very disappointed the last time I was there in April. But in all fairness the reception staff were very nice and changed my room immediately. The area is great for shopping and its easy to get around as there are plenty of taxis and the MRT and buses are not far. You can easily get to the Bugis st markets and the zoo quite reasonably price wise. The breakfast at this hotel was lovely and I felt safe in the hotel. Its hard to rate as i was so very disappointed the last time i stayed there but the first time was good and my son and I were very happy.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars hotel, but worth 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Jeffon2011
Reviews.Content: I staied there for 18 days. Luxurious lobby with beautiful orchid and pleasant atmosphere. Kind waiters. Clean rooms. Good swimming pool. From my personal point of view, it is 5 stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore luxury”
Reviews.Author: Crazyhorse3
Reviews.Content: very busy hotel right in the heart of the shopping area of Orchard road. breakfast is excellent with fine dinning restaurant if you want it. personally, I think there are much better places to see and eat in the city. Pool area is very nice as is the health club and spa. rooms are recently refurbished hence the higher tarrifs but the comfort level is excellent. the bar area always has live entertainment and is a very pleasant start to the evening. My advice is to get out and about as its very safe, visit Clarke quay for some very good authentic food and pass the evening away people watching

Reviews.Title: “Decent 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: kermadek
Reviews.Content: 5 nights in Signature Club room: Decent conveniently located hotel but nothing to write home about, looks like it has been around for a while. Check in was slow. The bathroom was very small but everything was clean. The A/C was cold and quiet, and the shower was fine. Club Lounge with very limited number of seats with nothing stronger than beer on display. Tips to Club floor staff: learn to use a few basic greetings. I didn't find the hotel bad but I would probably not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to Brag About”
Reviews.Author: Amie912
Reviews.Content: This hotel was central, right on Orchard Rd; however it is next door to the Orchard Towers. The staff were friendly and the vibe in the main foyer is good. However the room was very small and the bathroom had mould in it. Our room looked out onto a retaining wall and a poorly maintained garden.

Reviews.Title: “A Five Star Experience”
Reviews.Author: Kershree
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of those hotels that really stand out in my mind, in all my years of travel. The hotel, welcome, check-in, restaurants and food, hospitality, rooms, entertainment, staff and all round service was nothing short of remarkable. The location was perfect, walking distance to the High Flyer and the mall was part of the hotel. Three floors at that. The kids were free to explore the hotel and mall with the assistance of the very accomodating staff. The rooms were extremely spacious, very well furnished, and very very clean. On our last day we had to check out and our flight was at 2:00am in the morning, the night manager accomodated us with our luggage and we were able to take a shower in their hospitality room. I cannot explain what a pleasant and rememberable holiday and stay it was. I will highly recommend this hotel anytime.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: jeanette k
Reviews.Content: Orchard Hotel – my special experience Once a year I am in Singapore with my hubby Peter to visit my family. I get excited because I miss my family and look forward to seeing them also get to stay at the Orchard Hotel! This year I am in Singapore to celebrate my mum’s 90th birthday. To me the Orchard Hotel is home away from home (Sydney). The location is fantastic – a great spot – so close to many of the wonderful shopping and eating areas - right in the centre of all the action. The hotel itself boasts of some wonderful restaurants serving local and international cuisine. The rooms are so clean and comfortable and the whole ambience is so elegant and stylish. But one thing that is so unique to Orchard is that it has that special ‘heart and soul’. I was so, so touched by the fantastic customer service in the hotel …everywhere I go, everywhere I turn, the staff are so kind, warm, caring and helpful. The little things they do so naturally. ..e.g. presenting a cake to my mum on her 90th birthday …my mother was so touched by this act of kindness. Orchard Hotel is so welcoming - I really miss Singapore very much. I have stayed at some beautiful hotels in New York,London, Paris but the warmth of a hotel like the Orchard is special. I don’t stop telling people about you. Jeanette Kearney Sydney, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: THEB-traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel for your next conference or convention. Very centric and well located, walking distance to shop, bars and restaurants. The service is incredible and the food in the restaurant is absolutely fantastic! Recomended!

Reviews.Title: “Will be back”
Reviews.Author: smileyMalta
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel near the end of last year spent two nights in one of the executive suites using their Executive Lounge since we booked early the cost was brilliant we will be cruising again next year and looking forward to book this hotel again our suite was 5 star all the staff were very kind and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but large fee for internet access”
Reviews.Author: Finendandy
Reviews.Content: A well located hotel at the start of Singapore's Orchard Road shopping district. It is a 400m walk to the nearest MRT station but a walk that has lots of hotels, shops and people to make it interesting. The room was well furnished and it felt like it was recently renovated. It was comfortable, clean and had all the necessary amenities to make it pleasant. The only downside during my stay was the charge for internet access. While wifi is available throughout the hotel, it comes at an exorbitant $28 per day (without taxes). There is a slight savings for the 3-day plan but it is shocking that in this day and age, it is even being charged at all in a hotel of this calibre.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with some unexpected hick-ups!”
Reviews.Author: Gorkus
Reviews.Content: This property is nice, very nice. Is it a classic Singapore Hotel: business people, tourist, rock stars, airline crews and some american contractors!! The Orchard hotel is located at the beginnig of Orchard Road, therefore location is perfect. Close to the hotel you have everything you can wish for: restaurants, high end shops and boutiques, Shopping Malls, Cinema Complexes even a KTV! Let's concentrate on the hotel experience: Check-in was smooth, quick and effective. The room was spacious, well furnished and well lit. One thing I do not understand is why hotels do not equip bed side tables with power outlets! We all carry phones that require charging at night!!! I used the Lobby restaurant buffet both for dinner and for breakfast. Breakfast was fine, plenty of choices, a cooking station and quite a selection. The problem (totally unexpected and unacceptable given the quality of the property; Orchard Hotel) arrived at dinner, at the cooking station: I wanted some fried Noodles and I asked the "chef" to please prepare me some. He points me in the direction of a hot station where (in fact) there were some Noodles. I asked if they were spicy and he confirmed that they were. When I said I could not tolerate spicy food and that I wanted NOT SPICY Noodles he kept pushing me towards the hot station (they were spicy Noodles!) I said I wanted NOT SPICY Noodles and he kept insisting on the spicy ones. I had to raise my voice and get the support from another very dissapointed guest and finally His Highness agreed to cook my Noodles. Needless to say he did not put a lot of effort into it and cooked a basic dish. I asked for chicken or shrimp and he waved me away. I honestly felt bad, very unconfortable and totally bothered. I was not expecting such a behaviour at the Orchard Hotel. I would go back to the Orchard Hotel because I am sure this problem I had happened because and only because, the chef that was at the dinner buffet when I got there was very unprofessional, lazy and obvisouly had a very bad day. Nevertheless, the Orchard Hotel should keep such employees controlled and monitored. Nowadays most customers you loose is because of small details. Overall a great property with some back sheep!

Reviews.Title: “Fab escape in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: MySweetEscapes
Reviews.Content: I got nothing much to say but simply fantastic! The rooms are spacious and clean! (Although the only downside for me is that there are not much international channels available to watch, mostly local channels only) I had a great time plunging in their huge and cozy swimming pool! The hotel staffs were all very nice & accommodating, always ready to welcome you with a genuine smile on their faces. The hotel is located right in the heart of Orchard Street, Singapore’s shopping borough and a place where you can easily grab a snack along the streets coffee shops & restaurants or get a bus or taxi should you need to go on a stroll around the city. In general, I would say that they represent value for money! But of course if you are on a tight budget you can get much cheaper hotel but the comfort and facilities that you get is not as guaranteed as the one’s like Orchard hotel has to offer. I would definitely recommend this hotel to all my friends or relatives.

Reviews.Title: “OK, probably will be a last resort for upcoming trips”
Reviews.Author: GastroAficionado
Reviews.Content: I originally booked a superior room (lowest rate) and the photos made it look worth it's rate, though photos of hotel rooms are seriously deceiving. I checked in and the hotel room was tiny, the ceilings were low, I felt claustrophobic so we upgraded to a superior room which was pretty spacious. The only problem we had about the room was that the closet door wouldn't slide shut (and the light inside the closet won't turn off--the closet is right next to the bed) but we called about it and it was fixed right away, so yeay! Room service food is OK, not fabulous, pricey, but good enough and worth it when you don't feel like walking a small distance to the center of Orchard road. Yes, a small distance, the Orchard Hotel is located at the far end of the Orchard Road shopping centres. Overall, service is good, superior room is tiny (don't expect to get what you see on the photos online), deluxe room is worth it and it only cost us about 32 SGD to upgrade from superior to deluxe (cheaper than booking the deluxe room online).
