Probably won't go back unless all my favorite hotels on Orchard are fully booked, nothing wrong with the hotel, just personal preference :)

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay: room, services, food and location”
Reviews.Author: EM_tricolor
Reviews.Content: I had a really good stay for almost a week. Space and clean room, very good breakfast and dinner buffet (not included), free internet, fitness center with 25 m swimming pool and excellent location at Orchard Road, near to the shopping malls. Also good: you can have a late check out by 6:00pm.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel ... a bit far from center”
Reviews.Author: Solotraveller888
Reviews.Content: stayed here during a convention so the price was quite high. booked this at the last minute so most of the hotel on orchard were fully booked. at usd around 150 a night . its good value but if higher i would stay somewhere else. the rooms are clean and room very nice. a bit far from ION CENTER, SHAW CENTER and the center of Orchard.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: watchhans25
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights and found nothing special about this hotel, except the good location. My room was located in the main building and in a pretty worn condition. I found some mold in the bathroom, perhaps still acceptable, but I would recommend some thorough cleaning. Stains on the armchair were clearly visible as well as many scratches on one wall of the room. The positive thing was a very helpful concierge. On one afternoon there was a long queue of customers at the front desk and only 2 check-in clerks on duty. I had to wait for almost 20 minutes. The check-in staff also made a stressed impression to me. I already stayed in many hotels in Singapore for vacation, but I can only judge this one as average.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you get a cheap deal”
Reviews.Author: newkstar
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night at the expense of my airline due to a missed connection. I appreciate that one night doesn't give full exposure to a hotel but I would not pay to stay here and could only recommend it if you get a really cheap deal. The rooms are quite small and tired, although with the exception of the carpet, clean. Internet was available at a charge. I have to confess that I could not get the tv to work on anything but local channels. I ordered room service as I arrived late but all the food delivered was cold and largely inedible. The pool area is large and because the lobby is not huge it actually has a bit of vitality unlike the sterile nature of many other Singaporean hotels. The hotel is also quite well located for Orchard Road shopping. In summary, hotels in Singapore are expensive but, nevertheless, I think there are many better choices available.

Reviews.Title: “If you Must Stay on Orchard Rd”
Reviews.Author: PennsylvaniaPaki
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here on business and hotel was OK but if you're not in to shopping it's not really convenient.Much more interesting to stay at a boutique hotel near one of the ethnic districts. The botanical garden is within walking distance and very interesting, you can also have a reasonable, delicious breakfast at the cafe by the welcome center. The hotel offered many buffets none of which were that good. Down Orchard Road there is a department store can't remember name but not that many dept stores in the area, but anyway you can sample all kinds of interesting local goodies while the local girls giggle at you. Kind of fun in a town I thought quite boring, no soul left. Too busy being modern.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcdonaggio
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the start of our honeymoon. The rooms, while a little small, provided everything we needed. We found the staff to be very helpful and they even sent up a cake to my room on my birthday. This was very much appreciated. The hotel is perfectly located within easy reach of all the local attractions. I would certainly stay here again if I returned to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Orchard Road shopping”
Reviews.Author: Twogirls_7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend at end of business trip. I spent weekend shopping and sightseeing and thsi hotel was a great base. The staff were very friendly and helpful, especially the bell boy. Room was clean and well furnished. Bed was comfortable. Breakfast was little disappointing but i was in rush anyway so that was not important to me.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy at all”
Reviews.Author: Chiefen72
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel the past 4 years, during my business trips to Singapore. I cannot count how many nights, but for sure more than 50 nights! And most of teh time in the Signature Club or teh Signature suites! I love teh design of the signature club and when it comes to the suites the Green rooms are the best. The bath rooms in teh suites are great. But years pass by without any upgrade and you note the wear and tear on the furnitures. Same goes for the TV system! You get 3 TV's in the room but only one has clear picture! And when it comes to choice of channels, well far below standards! The controls are all worn out and you just get frustruated to even bother! Location of this hotel is great, close to shopping and nightlife, the neighbouring tower can be disturbing for families to pass by though! The rooms are not very quite as the dooropening are far to high and sound slips through. Not that there are much traffic but avoid having your room close to cleaners lockers etc. I have most of the time been very pleased with the staff except my last two trips! The Signature club staff were new faces to me and I have not seen anything even close to rudness they showed me and my business partners time after time. First of all the breakfast; no attendance at all, food is finished quickly and you need to get the coffe yourself! Nobody bothers to even ask! We had a meeting 1 hour after the breakfast time was over, but none of the tables were cleaned, and when I asked somebody to wipe one table so me and my collegue could seat! The young mans (Mgr) face looks chocked at me stating yeah yeah! coming! After 15 minutes and another reminder he comes with a over wet towel and make one wipe where all the dirst ends up on our knees and walks away! The table was so wet so I had to wipe it off myself! Again the next and next breakfast so I ended up eating at the office instead! But the check out takes the price, where I had to reschedule and get back early morning! So I go to the reception for the signature club which was unmanned (06:45 AM) and knock on teh door to see if somebody would help me! At 06:55 the same rude young man opens the door and says we are preparing the breakfast, dont have time and shuts the door again!!!! So I head down to the reception below and guess what one person attending the reception and the signature special desk is unmanned! Finally at 07:15 I was checked out and left! I am sorry, but you have many kind people working at this hotel, but some can really ruin it totally. It is probably find who I am as I have stayed latest at 1701 and the earlier 1606! I will fly back to Singapore next week again, but for the first time for a very long time I will not stay at Orchard hotel. Enough is enough!

Reviews.Title: “We'd recommend the Orchard 100%!”
Reviews.Author: SteveRhon
Reviews.Content: This hotel was brilliant! Apart from the great location, the staff went out of their way to assist wherever they could, including giving us a free upgrade when our room was not ready for us to move in to - love it! The meals in their resturants were fine as were the gym and pool. The only slight problem we had was to do with switching the lights off at the central control panel, however that was soon rectified by a staff member. Highly recommend The Orchard!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here twice...Loved it twice :)”
Reviews.Author: Nuigurumi
Reviews.Content: We first stayed here in July, 2010. During our first stay, everything was excellent. The hotel has a good location, service and is more affordable compared to other hotels on Orchard Road. Hence, this summer we planned to come back again. We booked 2 deluxe rooms on for June 16-19 3 weeks ahead of time. Yet, when we arrived, we had to wait for 40 mins to check in because the hotel was quite busy and our rooms were not ready. By the time we finished checking in, we were only able to get 1 room and had to wait for the other one until late afternoon. I had a thought of not coming back to this hotel again, but the friendly staff and great customer service here changed my mind. In addition, our rooms were upgraded from Deluxe to Executive Club room on the 17th floor and we were offered free buffet as well. I appreciate the hotel's hospitality, especially its great effort in providing the best experience for the guests and I definitely will recommend this hotel to friends and families! ^___^

Reviews.Title: “Decent room and great location. What can you ask more?”
Reviews.Author: Kamal_KL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orchard Hotel on 8-10July. The check-in was smooth and fast. The room was very clean. Can improve with air ventilation on the smoking floor (was abit stuffy on the corridor & lift area). I am not too sure how old is the hotel but it seems to be quite new to me and everything seem to be in working condition. The location of the hotel is considerably good. Although the hotel is located at the tip of Orchard Road, you can actually reach all the shopping mall / food outlet in few minutes by foot. Hard Rock Cafe, Tony Roma's, Modesto’s, California Kitchen, etc is just outside of the hotel, roughly about 5minutes walk. You will find 7-eleven next of the hotel. Generally, the staffs that we met during our stay (front desk, concierge, f&b staff) were friendly and courteous. We actually had breakfast (buffet) at the coffeehouse for both days. On one of the day, the coffee house was full hence they have actually opened up a temporary breakfast area (i suppose) on the 1st floor. Although the range of food is slightly limited, we were happy that we didn’t have to wait at the coffeehouse. There were sufficient foods to fill us up before we head out for the day. Getting a cab is very easy at any time of the day, especially with the help of the staff at the lobby. Overall, I was happy with the hotel, room and services. Would definitely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: chrstphrwarwick
Reviews.Content: hotel was in a good location ,no double room available,air con not great,

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff - we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: travel_with_kids041
Reviews.Content: We were in Singapore mainly for business but with a small amount of R&R thrown in and had booked 5 nights at the Orchard because I had stayed there before. We were offered an upgrade to a Club room but unfortunately there wasn't one available on our first night and we reluctantly were checked into a Smoking room. Not ideal but true to the reception staff's word we were moved into a Club room by 12 noon the following day. The room was nice but the extra benefits of the Executive Club Lounge, free internet and daily laundry allowance were what made it really good. All the staff we dealt with were extremely friendly and welcoming and made it a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very busy, understaffed”
Reviews.Author: davidhartman
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately our stay started with our rooms not being ready when we arrived at 22h15 after a very long day travelling, and after having waited in line for more than 20 minutes to be checked in as reception was extremely busy. The reception staff were apologetic and arranged for us to have a free meal at the buffet whilst we waited for our rooms which was a nice gesture but the buffet was tired and limp with a few left over choices, having obviously been out for hours. The reception also arranged for us to have a late check out on the day of our departure; again, a nice gesture but as we were there on business did not offer much in the way of making up for the delay in getting to our rooms. The rooms were small but clean; unfortunately my room periodically had a very bad drain smell. The breakfast buffet was a scrum: far too many people trying to get to the food and the atmosphere was horrible - noisy with tables crowded close together. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money - Hotel Orchard”
Reviews.Author: Sandeep B
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel located on Orchard Road a vibrant place of singapore. connectivity to other parts of Singapore is excellent. rooms are fine. Good service. food is though ok types. Staff is helpful and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “not as it looks”
Reviews.Author: flowerbomb84
Reviews.Content: this was just ok, all money has been spent on the fabulous foyer,and a few things in the room like (headboard), but was overly disapointed when we saw our room, the carpet looks original in the bedrooms, shower over the bath ., looked tired and the pool and putting green were not that great, our view was a tired, putting green with the false lawn all curled up etc, rooms were quite small too. HARD BEDS AND FLAT PILLOWS. wouldnt stay here again at all. NOT LIKE THE PHOTOS AT ALL

Reviews.Title: “perfect business hotel”
Reviews.Author: VIBHOR_11
Reviews.Content: ideal location to explore the city. not much to boast in terms of amenities but rooms are good service is great. it is at orchard street so u are already there!! if u are visiting as a tourist or for work this is the place for u.

Reviews.Title: “More effort needed on service”
Reviews.Author: adrianandrewlim
Reviews.Content: We had booked and confirmed our hotel rooms through our Singapore counterpart. The bookings were confirmed and I called from Malaysia to ensure we had 3 non-smoking rooms and 1 smoking room 6 hours before arrival (as we were arriving in the evening after 7pm). To our surprise and dismay, 2 rooms were available for us. The other 2 was in the process of being cleaned. This was at 730pm. Of course we were angry/dismayed/etc etc. The staff did their best and upgraded us for 2 rooms but it didnt give a good impression to us. At 830pm, the rooms were still not available. At that time, we had to go out for dinner. So my colleagues only managed to get their rooms at 10pm (after coming back from dinner). Either the hotel was sooooo overbooked, or something went wrong in the process I can say the front desk staff did their best to manage the situation. At the end of our stay, we had managed to get a very late checkout (at 5pm) due to our late flight. Good decision making by the staff - as we will still consider Orchard Hotel in the future. Hopefully the room availability issue will be settled in the coming months You need to call and reconfirm your room preference (smoking or non-smoking), so that you will not be disappointed. Adrian (Rooms - 1346,0543,1454,0746) 27jun - 29jun

Reviews.Title: “I love the SUITE at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: IndigoTravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed from June 23-26, 2011 which is a peak season in Singapore. We only booked for a Superior room but were upgraded to a SUITE at the Signature Club of the Hotel. I must say that the room was very very comfortable. Lighting and curtains may be controlled automatically. There was a walk-in closet that leads to a big bathroom - lots of space to move around in. There's a shower area, water closet ad bath tub with TV. The facilities were also ok - used the gym. Staff were friendly and accommodating. It's centrally located and a short walking distance to ION orchard and Paragon Mall. It's a bit pricey but if you have the extra cash to spend, this is a good experience. A must-try for those who want a bit of luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: JonasP
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent and rooms are OK, but service is terrible. Checking took more than 30 min for me. My friend had to wait in line 45 min only to be told there was no room despite a confirmed reservation. After another 2 hours wait he was finally given a room. Since he had to wait we had to cancel our planned dinner. We were compensated with a free buffet meal, but obviously the food was no longer fresh after being on display for many hours. Price was high even with company negotiated rate, so I would definitely look for another option next time in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: SWLN
Reviews.Content: The hotel at the right place...in the heart of Singapore...the best shopping place...food is tasty...but not many varieties for vegetarians...great staff...good friendly people..nice hospitality...nice rooms...on the whole nice place for family & business....they even gave us a good suggestions to spend our couple of free hours...

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: colmatt
Reviews.Content: Hotel in good location on Orchard Road and short enjoyable walk to Orchard MRT station. Breakfast good though could do with a little more variety maybe change a couple of items some days. Rooms good size comfortable and very clean. Staff friendly and very professional at all times. Had dinner in the chinese restaurant food and service very good standard and thought price okay as well. Overall we really enjoyed our stay and had no problems would stay there again. E-mailed them before going requesting a non smoking room with a view and had room over looking swimming pool which was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: n3aal
Reviews.Content: The rooms were good, however everything else about this hotel is average at best. The location was poor because of all the nightclubs close by, the hotel is old but maintained well. Don't even think of taking a smoking room if you're a non-smoker, as the whole floor smells like an ashtray.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: SWSHouston
Reviews.Content: This is a good place to stay. good rooms, good location (almost everything in walking distance). I like it...

Reviews.Title: “If on a shopping spree... this is the place”
Reviews.Author: Sarandeep
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is at the beginning of the Orchard road. If you are into shopping... this is the pace to be in. The room was comfortable and the washroom amenities were good.The view from the room is also good if you take the upper floors. The lower floors offer no view. The room service is prompt and the food quality is better than average unless you are trying to compare it with Michelin rated restaurants. The Italian restaurant in the hotel is highly recommended. There is a hard rock Cafe at a walking distance if you are one of the rockers... but the music was not at all rocking. There are many fine dining options available. All in all a value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here twice, disappointed twice”
Reviews.Author: mercuryfalling
Reviews.Content: I made reservation and confirmed but when I arrived, there was no room available. The second time, I made reservation thru travel agent, after 30 minutes then the receptionist was able to confirm my reservation but the room was not ready for one hour. NO MORE ORCHARD HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “Solid four star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: FeltonS
Reviews.Content: I spent three very comfortable nights here for a conference held at the Shangri-la up the road. The Orchard was the overflow hotel, and though it wasn't quite up to Shangri-la standards, it's a fine four-star that fulfilled its function admirably. Rooms are clean, bed are soft and - and this is important - the bedding is very, very nice. I was on the club floor, so I can't speak for what happens elsewhere in the hotel, I was quite impressed with what was offered to me. The breakfast on the club level, and downstairs, was plentiful and more than adequate - right up to the standards one would expect at other hotels of similar standards in Singapore. My only complaint, and it's an important one to me, is that service on the front desk is painfully, almost comically slow. Check-in and check-out took much longer than it should have, and I blame that on an inexplicably slow staff up there. But this is a good hotel, with a good location, and there's no reason to hesitate to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff, Courteous & Friendly, Highly Recommend staying here”
Reviews.Author: missyhiggins02
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and were checked in (after a reasonable wait time, it is a busy hotel afterall). We were told that the room we were to be placed in was near where the renovations were being done, so there may be intermittent noise... on arriving in room, was a bit too noisy for us, so we asked to be moved to a quieter room. Management moved us with no hassles at all to a lovely Executive Room at NO Extra cost, this was amazing. If you do stay here, it is well worth the extra cost to upgrade to An Executive Room, as you get so many additional extras, such as, use of the Executive Lounge, this includes, free Buffet Breakfast, happy hour , afternoon tea, free highspeed Internet usage, use of the Lounge until airport transfer , real coffee, etc etc… The staff In the Executive Lounge were absolutely amazing, they were so friendly and nothing was Too much trouble for them. The Breakfast Buffet is amazing and we enjoyed it every day, such huge variety. The evening meal Buffet was a big hit too, amazing, fresh Crab, Prawns, Fresh Sushi made right in front of us and every conceivable type of food you could want, and the Desserts ...... Wow, the Portugese Egg Custard was to die for ............. Will Definitely be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Alan17
Reviews.Content: The location on orchard road is too good, as this is the main shopping area of Singapore. Breakfast buffet had ample choices. The swimming pool is quite big, but jacuzzi is not there. The staff is quite courteous but waiting time at reception was too long, may be becoz of holiday rush. Rooms are small in size.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, renovated room, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: gornfishin63
Reviews.Content: travelled with our young son and we enjoyed the pool and really appreciated the hospitality room and play room on the last day as our flight was evening time. There were renovations going on but didn't bother us, and our room was one of the renovated ones which was fine too. Everything worked in the room and the lady room attendant was very friendly, more so than the front desk who were a bit average in their manner. Breakfast was good in the executive lounge, but we preferred the coffee shop breakfast for the second day. Good variety and taste. Always annoyed that some hotel still charge for internet. This day and age it is not a luxury anymore! Room cost everywhere in Singapore is always too expensive, but all in all a pleasant stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: starjdg
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for our stay in Singapore. Service was good! Breakfast buffet was included with the reservation... it was good. Front desk and bell service was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Unfeeling”
Reviews.Author: Subasko
Reviews.Content: Deliberately scheduled my flight so I arrive after 2 pm (which is the standard check in time) arrived past 2 pm- was advised room was not ready and Front desk gave me a drink voucher and asked to wait 30 mins, and to personally give my key.. close to an hour room was not ready yet.. Front desk staff did not also get back to me re room.. asked to speak to manager but got a smirk from another front desk agent..was finally given a wash up room and ended up being late for my conference.. Next day asked to speak to Manager again but still unavailable. gave up already at this point. definitely not worth the rate I paid for...

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: syed2011
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel from Singapore Hotel Reservations counter. The price we got was very good. I would advise any body going to singapore to book through this agent to get a good price. in case you want to extend your stay just phone the agent and he will be glad to offer your extension at the same price. We have stayed at many hotels over the years, often luxury ones with impeccable details and fantastic designs. Price-wise Orchard Hotel is on par with these better-class hotels. The room I had was spacious and pretty, the breakfast was good. Orchard Hotel is a place you would definitely come back to and recommend to your friends. Thank you very much for making my stay so pleasant!!!

Reviews.Title: “An Old Charm”
Reviews.Author: budgy26
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Orchard Hotel. As many of other hotels in the area- it is a little bit older; however it has the comfortable charm, friendly services, and perfect location. Furthermore the Executive Club provides choice of breakfast at the club or regular lobby level and Tea/evening drinks with tasty local snacks. It has a personal touch. Unfortunately during our stay- the hotel has undergone some renovation, and loud noises permeated to our floor were beyond description. I happened to catch a Flu and really wanted to have an afternoon nap-- but thevery loud bangs and drills made it impossible. It is very unfortunate taht the hotel should sell these rooms affected by the noises to Conference participants whereas the conference had been planneda year ahead or so. Breakfast at the lobby adequate with western, and Asian food- however; with this level of hotel- one would expect a little bit more varieties and quality and attention to details- such as labels of Chinese dishes remain the same every morning while the food inside was different. The egg station chef was not that patience when one requesting an extra minute frying. The fruit remains similar for three consecutive mornings. Mr Schmidt, surely you don't need to cut the budget that drastic that lower your standard. Your hotel and staff are wonderful, your location is close to bus stop where we can catch public , Sia Hops, and other Singapore tourist buses, Taxis almost always available, you are within walking distance to Shaw,Lucky Plaza, Ion and other buildings. We love staying here but please improve your quality. And by the way- we love the old style of the Executive Lounge with its warm old Chinese charm -- the new style is too simplistics ?? makes me feel like waiting at a dentist's waiting room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: G H G
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews on this site regarding this hotel we were expecting a tired hotel..on arrival we were checked in by a freindly and helpful Russian girl. Our superior spacious room located in a quiet area, very clean and very comfortable, the travel agent we booked our holiday with arranged this hotel. We were both very happy with the room and public areas. We did not eat or drink in the hotel as it seemed too expensive especially wine/beer!! we opted to eat/drink locally, Orchard Road having plenty of options! Shame that hotels charge too much for food and drink.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Room Experience Ever!”
Reviews.Author: misterclancy
Reviews.Content: Let me begin with stating that I travel 1/3 of the year, and in dozens of hotels during this time. The rooms in this hotel were terrible. I booked a "superior" room, only to be given a musty smelling "standard" room full of worn and dirty furniture. After I complained, I was "upgraded" to the room I was expecting. Aesthetically, the "superior" room was fine. However, my issue was with the bathroom door design. The bathroom has a glass door. Across from it is a large mirror. At night, the light from the bathroom fully illuminates the entire room. I'm a light sleeper, and the bright light constantly woke me up when it was being used. I asked for a better room, but was denied as I was "already" upgraded, unless I was willing to pay another S$125 per night! Instead, the hotel stapled a black sheet over the toilet door for the remaing 4 days I stayed there. On the 2nd to last day, I noticed hundreds of tiny ants all over the window ledge. I called to have them removed, but no one came. After 1 hour I left. Upon my return later that day, there were still dozens of ants running around. The hotel doesn't seem to care, so I just stayed the night, and checked out early. I could never recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Crappy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BENLEE123
Reviews.Content: I stayed just one night in this hotel due to the fact that my company had a function in the hotel that night and it was pre-arranged. In retrospect, I regret not choosing a better hotel nearby. The rate is expensive, even when we had negotiated a package rate. Otherwise, it's totally not worth it to pay the rates indicated in the hotel website. The bad impression starts right from the time we arrived at the hotel. No door men were present and guests arriving in have to help themselves with the luggage. On entry, a long queue was formed at the check-in desk and the long waiting left me fuming. Despite the queue, only two staff were available to assist on the check-in. What? The others having tea-break? I took 20 mins to wait for my turn and another 10 mins for the reception staff to check us in, despite already having our bookings in record. The bad impression continue into the room. The so called Deluxe room is shoe-box size. Standard furniture and basically standard 3-star hotel decor. The bathroom light gave out a buzzing sound every time it is switched on. There are visible stains in the bathtub. The hotel must be practicing cost cutting because it doesn't even provide dental kit in the bathroom. Why must I waste time to call for this simple and very basic amenity? Breakfast is included but all the sub-standard stuff and when glasses and food frequently running out. Check out thankfully was faster but that's because I can't wait to depart from this crappy hotel. By the way, there is also a long queue to wait for taxi in the morning. And about service, what service? The whole stay is like checking into a dormitory, queue for check-in, queue for breakfast, queue for taxi. The staff are just indifferent and make no effort whatsoever. Perhaps they are just doing their job according to what they are paid and nothing more. Overall, the hotel location is good since it's in Orchard Road but that's the only redeeming attribute. For the rates charged and the standard of the room, one can do much better, even in Orchard Road area. So in conclusion, good location, crappy hotel. Won't be back, even if it's for free.

Reviews.Title: “Decent 4* property in heart of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Professor07
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Orchard hotel for two days in beg of the Feb. It was nice hotel with a 2 resturant. The rooms are clean and quite. The customer service is nice but I didn't had great experience when I arrived. I arrived couple of hours early and I have requested them on phone that I would be coming early please give a room so that I can sleep for some time. They made me wait for 2.5 hours before alloted a room .......... probably there were none available. The advantage: It is bang on orchard road in the middle of hussel bussel. Nothing is far from Orcahard hotel. I may recommend this hotel for travelers who wish to stay in Singapore for couple of nights. If you are going for a long holiday, try out a more nicer property away from the crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Location and service”
Reviews.Author: jeff68Berlin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Club Rooms on the 15th floor. Service was excellent.We had use of the 18th floor for breakfast & throughout the day.The location is perfect, walking distance from the botanic garden and very close to ion shopping centre. There is a public bus leaving just in front of the hotel, that takes you directly to the Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Looks much better than it is”
Reviews.Author: pienol
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks good but is not. It took the desk nearly 20 minutes to check me in (after 13 hours of flight, one's tolerance threshold is way below that). My room smelled of mould; the air-conditioning system was very noisy and ineffective, leaving the room either cold or warm, but always humid (my sport gears never completely dried for the entire stay). The shower tap did not work well. The bed was of a level of comfort you would expect in a two star hotel. The food in the main lobby-level restaurant is vastly overpriced (including breakfast at more than SGD 30) and though it is decent, it is certainly not outstanding. It was my second stay here, the first being in November 2008 -- nothing has changed for the better. (I stayed here again because the company that invites me put me there.) Though the area is Singapore's "shopping district" -- which is what it says on the can, except maybe for the many prostitutes who are on display everywhere around as soon as it is dark -- there is a nice "Asian food court" in a basement around the corner where locals dine on very good food for 2 or 3 SGD.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings.”
Reviews.Author: Ellemay
Reviews.Content: We brought the Wotif Mystery Price deal over the internet which ended up being the Orchard Hotel located in Orhard Road. The deal also included breakfast, free broadband & a laundry service. We were only staying overnight so we only wanted a reasonably priced hotel in a good location which the Orchard Hotel is perfectly located for shopping & entertainment just minutes from the major shopping malls, restaurants & Central Business district. Check-in – we arrived around 9pm so we didn’t experience any problems with our check in. Room – Our room 1615 was your typical hotel size room with a king size bed & a small couch & coffee table. The room was decorated in a heavy tone which made the room appear dark. A large TV, mini bar were also supplied. Bathroom – a large dark marble bathroom with a walk-in shower & separate bath. The bathroom was very spacious with a good makeup mirror. Dinner – We arrived late & were hungry so we eat at Hua Ting Restaurant which served Chinese cuisine. The food was totally overpriced & we thought to be very average compared to other restaurants in Singapore we have tried. Breakfast – Was included in our deal – it was sufficient but nothing to rave about. Overall – We had a comfortable night stay & thought the staff to be efficient & friendly. The hotel is reasonably priced compared to some other hotels in Singapore. It’s located in prime spot just minutes to everything. However, having stayed at numerous other hotels in Singapore I do prefer others.

Reviews.Title: “Incompetent and lousy service”
Reviews.Author: KULDOSM
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 rooms for 2 nights. Holiday with family with a 4 year old child and elderly. Booked and guaranteed 2 double bed rooms. Interconnecting on request. Checked in at 5pm, and was told that no interconnecting available, best is next to each other, which is fine. Went up the room, both rooms given are twin bedded !. That was really disappointing and it proved that the Front Office Assistant didn;t bother to look into the details of the booking, which is the element that sets a hotel apart from the norm! I went down to ask for what I paid for, and I was told to wait for 45 minutes as no double bedded rooms are available ! it is not acceptable and it is not an industry standard for a GUARANTEED booking to be denied, especially when we check in way beyond the stipulated checked in time.I asked them what was their procedure for room blocking,and the staff looked blank ! Without even showing any initiative to solve the simple complaint, the front office staff asked if i would like to speak to the manager, which I gladly replied YES. To cut the story short, I wasted an hour at the lobby and we went out for our appointment without the chance to freshen up !. Came back at 10pm, asked if the room change was ready, and we were given an upgrade to the clubfloor, which was a nice gesture. However, during the entire stay and as a hotelier myself, there is a serious lack of initiative and courtesy from the front desk staff, both lobby and clubfloor. I asked to replenish the bath gel, they replenished the moisturiser instead ( they should have the initiative to see that it was the bath gel container thats empty, while the moisturiser bottle is untouched!) At the front desk, the Front Desk Assistant who checked me in never smiled. And when I came back to the reception to lodge a complaint, he saw me and he whispered something to his colleague, right in front of me, which was very rude. He should have the courtesy to ask if anything is wrong with my room. He doesn;t understand what it means by TO OWN THE PROBLEM. I chose to have breakfast at the coffee house, and I requested to have a look at the buffet before deciding to dine there. One of the lady supervisors bumped into me and asked if I would like to pay with cash or credit card !!. I dont expect the staff to know every guests, but have the courtesy to ask for room numbers first ! Besides the location of the hotel, I see no reasons to return. And there are plenty of hotels nearby and across.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Stay!”
Reviews.Author: 06_PJ
Reviews.Content: The only upside staying at this hotel was the location!! I would rate this hotel as a 2 star, as the room had a moldy smell, very noisy & the bathroom was not clean.. The buffet breakfast wasnt great either, very limited... Overall i would not recommend this hotel to anyone!! The quality just wasnt there!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AmitDawn
Reviews.Content: Almost bang on Orchard Road, you dont have to wonder what to do and where to go after a long day's work. The rooms are nice but seemed a bit too crowded. Large wordrobes were a big help. The breakfast spread is huge. Can be a good destination for leisure stay as well

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk People Need Training”
Reviews.Author: bettylopez10
Reviews.Content: On the average the hotel is comfortable, food in the dinnner buffet is average and a bit pricey. I stayed for 2 weeks and when I decided to extend they didnt even accomodate my request for a bit of extension to check out late since I was working the whole day. The fact is that I was transferring to another room and the front desk people didnt even offer to transfer my things to my new room. They wanted me to check out physically and transfer my things to the new room. There was no courtesy given to me being a long staying guests. They should train their front desk people to think on their feet .When I got angry, the front desk girl just didnt say anything. In their dining hall room too, when u leave your table to get additional food in the buffet, they just take away your unfinished food plates. Theres evidently lack of training among its staff and employees. Internet is expensive and not free. Its best to reserve online with travel sites than reserve with the hotel, its very expensive (S$400) compared to S$200 online.

Reviews.Title: “Looking for a reasonable stay in Singapore with no car access? Try here.”
Reviews.Author: Pura88
Reviews.Content: This hotel is recommended for everybody, from the first-time travelers to veteran travelers in Singapore. The hotel is located at Orchard Road which is the "main street" for all the shops, malls, various restaurants. It is a nice 10 minute-walk to department store such as Takashimaya, ION, etc, so if you have no access with transportation, I would highly recommend this place. The hotel is bit worn out, hence the price for this hotel is probably the most reasonable compared to other "high-end" hotels on Orchard Road. The room I stayed in was cozy, not too big but not too small where you cannot move around. The amenities weren't that great -- mediocre shampoo/conditioner/body shampoo. Oh and yes, bring your own toothbrush/shaving kits as there weren't any -- and we weren't going to pay for the service (tip) to bring them up to our room. We ran out of hot water in the evening but with the hot and humid weather of Singapore, this wasn't an issue in the morning :) Morning buffet was good in terms of selections (Asian, Western, and some mixes) - but we had to wait a long time for our cup of coffee to be served, and this, mind you, was the case for all three days we stayed... But if you are patient and not in a hurry (like us), that wasn't a big issue. Concierge and bell service people were all so nice - helpful, kind and also friendly! The only regret we have is that we didn't even know that there was a shopping arcade right next to the hotel until the day we were leaving! Yes, they even have Tony Roma's! So if you stay at this hotel, be sure to check it out, including the famous Chinese Restaurant, "Hua Ting Restaurant" which conveniently located inside this hotel (we also didn't get to go - so definitely next time!). Oh one more thing! They do charge a lot for internet access in the room -- though you get a little discount if you sign up to use internet for a few days...

Reviews.Title: “Only for the location ... not for the service!!!”
Reviews.Author: sbish1
Reviews.Content: We have been to Singapore on many occasions and on this occasion we only had a one night stop-over so we wanted to make sure we were right in the heart of the action and this hotel is certainly one of the best located as everything is within walking distance. Location is about where the positives end. We arrived at the 2.00 allocated check in time and had to wait about 25 minutes to get attended. We then did all the check-in only to be told that our room was not ready, it would be around an hour wait. I asked the check-in staff what time check in was and she replied it was 2.00pm. To which I then asked why our room wasnt ready. All I got a blank look of "I dont care" along with being told there is no room available at all in all of the hotel. I ended up asking for the manager who was extremely good and gave us an upgrade to allow us to check in immediately. The "upgraded" room made us wonder what the room we had booked was like as it was very ordinary in terms of size and decor and the terrible mattress. Another issue was that every time we needed to get attended at recption, the wait was at least 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Top Location”
Reviews.Author: Rodi14
Reviews.Content: Loved this Hotel it was right in the middle of Shopping district. Rooms were very nice very comfortable, clean, staff were nice. Didnt have breakfast as we went for Ritz Sunday Champagne Brunch which were absoluetly amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for a short break”
Reviews.Author: sch986
Reviews.Content: Brillian valus for money, not far from the subway for easy access around singapore

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: chaos1785
Reviews.Content: I went to Singapore for a business trip from 6 to 8 December 2010. Since our company booked and paid for the hotel, I cannot comment on the cost/price. When I was younger and used to travel to Singapore for sports competitions, we would also stay at this hotel so I already knew what to expect when I was told that Orchard Hotel would be where we would be staying. Location: The location is great because it is right on Orchard Road. Extra plus for me since our regional office is right across the street so no hassle in having to take a cab/MRT in the morning for our meeting. It is next to Orchard Towers though, which is famous for you-know-what, but I didn't have a problem walking to the hotel from Scott's Road at 3am. In general though, Singapore is a pretty safe city so not much to worry about there. Rooms: My room was very clean and very quiet. Didn't have much of a view though. I can't remember what the name of the wing of the hotel was called but it's not on the Orchard Road side. The bathroom was nice and clean (I'm really picky and OC when it comes to this). It had a window from the shower that looked into the room, which is great for honeymooners I guess? There's a shade you can pull down though so no need to worry! Shower was really nice - you had your regular shower head coming off the wall then another rain-type shower. Water pressure was extremely strong so no problem there and the hot water was great because I love taking hot showers! The amenities are the usual - shampoo, conditioner, soap, shower cap, toothbrush, toothpaste, etc. Complimentary water (not sure if this is daily or just upon arrival). Not sure about the mini bar either since I didn't take anything from it. Food: Didn't get to try the breakfast but I don't remember anything bad from when I used to stay at Orchard Hotel when I was a kid. Didn't order room service either so I can't comment. Your on Orchard Road though so there are a lot of places to go and check out instead of holing yourself up in the hotel. Check-in/Check-out: No problems checking and checking out. We arrived in SG around 9am and got to the hotel around 10 and we were checked in and brought to our rooms right away. Flight out of SG wasn't til 8pm - tried to get a late check out but they were fully booked so didn't allow for it. They did have a holding room for our luggage which was great so we could still go out before heading to the airport. Overall, I would say this hotel is pretty good. Not a Ritz Carlton or a Four Seasons but it's good enough for me in terms of cleanliness and I had zero problems during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: TashaC14
Reviews.Content: My husband has stayed in Orchard Hotel before, but when we went there together in July 2010, we were in for a very nice surprise at the hotel. We booked a double superior room, and when we got there, it was a twin room but they pushed the beds together. We asked if we could get a double room instead and in no time the front desk manager came to our room and took us to a new room. To our surprise, it was an executive room which was spacious, complete with a living room, automatic window blinds and curtains, a very nice Bose sound system, 3 LCD TV's (including one that enables you to watch TV while relaxing in the bathtub!), a walk-in closet, a rain shower bathroom plus bathtub and separate toilet which was very elegant! We were so happy and we enjoyed our 2 nights completely! We also went to the bar across the reception area and they make yummy calamari! The location of the hotel itself is great as it was close to orchard and taxi's are readily available right in front of the hotel lobby. There's also a direct access from the hotel to a plaza where you can find Subway, an Irish pub, some other eateries and little shops. The breakfast buffet was reasonably varied and the taste was not bad at all. Thank you, Orchard Hotel, for providing us with your nice accommodation, it felt like a third honeymoon for us!

Reviews.Title: “On The Strip”
Reviews.Author: billthoo
Reviews.Content: Although it's on Orchard Road, it's not really amidst the shopping action. That shouldn't worry too many people, and it is only a short walk past the Thai embassy to Scott's Road, the MRT, Wheelock Place and ION shopping malls. The porters seemed to be there really to direct traffic only - not very keen to grab your case from the taxi. The check-in queue was a little chaotic, but the check-in itself was pleasant and easy (I didn't realise you could check-in at the club lounge if you book a club room). The club room was large, clean, and reasonably appointed. There was a small window only, but the view was a construction site, so nothing was missed! Breakfast was disappointing, and you are much better off seeking all the wonderful, wonderful food outside. The club lounge is great if you ever find yourself waiting for the cleaning service to finish with your room. The Nespresso machine makes the best coffee in Singapore... The gymn is also well appointed, and the pool deck looked very pleasant. A bit of a surprise at night was the group of girls on the corner of Claymore Road - and No, I didn't want a good time... Overall this was a reasonable hotel for the price on Orchard Road, but get your breakfast elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location. Typical Asian hotel”
Reviews.Author: Seajasper81
Reviews.Content: As per usual the Asian hotels are fantastic value for money. Top class rooms. Restaurant was expensive. Shops attached to the hotel were rarely open. Next to Orchard Towers ("interesting nightlife"). However being at the end of Orchard Road and across from Hardrock Cafe and a stones throw away from ION Mall you couldnt ask for more. Staff not very well informed on getting around the city or to other parts (ie Sentosa, Zoo etc) however a shuttle bus does pick up around the corner to go to the Zoo. Sentosa also a short taxi ride away. Singapore is much more expensive than other Asian cities but well worth a visit - once.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: fritzFlorida
Reviews.Content: This hotel was modern and clean. The restaurant provided buffet breakfast every morning. The location is great just a short walk to the large shopping district on Orchard Rd. The hotel has the look and feel of a business travelers hotel. Hotel pick up from the airport was great. Our driver met us at the airport with a sign and drove us in a comfortable town car to the hotel. They made transfer easy to and from the hotel and airport. Disappointed they charged to use the business center to check email.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: fibaroobi3
Reviews.Content: This was the final hotel on our way home from Europe to Australia and it was a disappointment. On the way over, we had stayed at the Concorde Hotel, which was in a similar price bracket, which we loved. The room at the Orchard Hotel, however, looked tired and run down and a bit depressing. I was travelling with my elderly parents, the three of us in one room. It was disappointing that the rollaway had not been brought in, so we had to wait for housekeeping to bring one up and prepare it- just a bit annoying when arriving late at night and eager to sleep. Also attention to detail seem to be missing. For example, one robe was left for us, water bottles, slippers and cups were left for two. The telephone did not seem to work at all. When we asked at the front desk for more robes, none came. On a positive note, the receptionist was nice when I requested a late checkout and arranged this without any hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and Elegant”
Reviews.Author: akadifferent
Reviews.Content: As i stepped into this hotel i was greeted with this huge structure in the center of the lobby with a clock on top of it, also a beautiful restaurant located beside the lobby and you must already be getting a sense of the huge lobby area of the Orchard Hotel. Located right in the heart of the famous Orchard Street ( from which it also derives its name), the Orchard Hotel boasts of a shopping arcade along with all the top notch facilities international travelers would expect for leisure and indulgence like the usual swimming pool , gym with trainers, a mini golf putt to name a few. The food was exemplary, plus the manager was very sweet to offer alternatives for complete Indian vegetarian options. The reception desk was even kind enough to help us book our movie tickets for Inception which we so wanted to see.

Reviews.Title: “WORST BED I'VE ENCOUNTERED IN YEARS”
Reviews.Author: Spainontheair
Reviews.Content: I have just checked in (literally 2 hours ago) and I am EXTREMELY DISSAPOINTED with the Hotel, I will recommend my company to use a different one from now on. - Took 30 minutes to check in. I am coming from Europe so I was hoping to get some sleep before lunch. - Dated room, has not been renovated in a LONG time, you can even see some drink spills on the walls. - An old spring matress is not what you expect when you pay +$200/night plus taxes. - $20/day for the internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience and service - Awesome Signature Club”
Reviews.Author: CAS03
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard and chose the Executive Club. However due to very high occupancy we got bumped up to a bigger room in their Signature club. This was really something different. Having read some of the previous reviews, I simply cannot agree, the service was simply awesome. The girls in the club lounge were really looking after us, even though my young son was probably a bit out of place with all those business travelers. Decor of the rooms is superb too, although not a kid proof decor, but then it was not meant to be. Food in the lounge was excellent to and also the selection for the afternoon and evening cocktails. Honestly, having stayed with Hilton and Marriott in the same area previously, this club was not only comparable, but much better ( and not only for price) . Other areas were fine too, with a huge pool area a kids play room and gym (needs some touch up). All in all, we have not come across anyone who wasn't nice, although smiling is not as evident as in say Thailand or even Bali, but definitely better than my experience in Hong Kong. Anyways, I'll have to go back to Singapore for business soon and will write again.

Reviews.Title: “I feel homesick. Totally sub-standard and not suitable for business”
Reviews.Author: Panic_in_Detroit
Reviews.Content: In addition to upfrontly ringing me out of my dreams just 8 hours after check-in, the room feels like an unconformtable concrete hall, the bathroom is so tiny I cannot do aynthing without bumping there and there. The sewer is noisy, the little water dripping out of the shower takes forever to get warm. Furniture defintely needs an overhaul. As other said before: The staff hardly ever smilies and further was quite helpless. Well rooms were clean, TV is ok and the breakfast was acceptable (though you have to wait and wait for your coffee) but I will definitely never come back to this hotel. Compared to what you get the hotel rate is cheeky to say the least. How can this waiting hall style place get more than 2 stars? Well at least there was no one around doing a business trip - these guys know why.

Reviews.Title: “Orchard Could Do with a Makeover”
Reviews.Author: E Garvey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I with two friends stayed at the Orchard Hotel, Singapore at the end of a cruise. The hotel is located at the top (or Bottom?) of Orchard Road, but anywhere in Singapore is easy to get to. The hotel is quite comfortable, good rooms, expensive meals and adequate breakfast. I found small ants in the bathroom which I reported to reception, don't know if anything was done about it.

Reviews.Title: “Truly wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: PeterHawk
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a weekend away from home to celebrate my birthday. I booked the club room online and had a great offer. It includes access to the lounge with a great spread of breakfast and we even had free drinks in the evening. The staff was most welcoming and made us all feel really at home. There are lots of things to do around and shopping is within easy reach. One evening we had my celebration dinner in their famous chinese restaurant Hua Ting and it was really remarkable

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Orchard”
Reviews.Author: crotats
Reviews.Content: From arrival to departure all was fantastic, all staff very helpful and friendly. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Worst room I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: pbcNY
Reviews.Content: AVOID the Orchard Hotel, Singapore. It presents itelf as "upscale," but the very small "deluxe" rooms (not the cheapest on offer) are sadly needing renovation: very dirty carpets, old, uncomfortable furniture, lamps what you would expect in a college dorm room. Lighting is terrible--no reading lights so one must read with overhead lights shining in your eyes. The bathroom had a shower door that wouldn't close and the bathroom door itself was glass so the light had to shine in a sleeping partner's face. It was also sliding, making it noisy in the night. No place to sit or read and relax. Beds hard with thin covers. Aircon had two settings only: on and cold and off and hot. The public areas are OK and the staff friendly. But the hotel is understaffed, especially in housekeeping area. We often had to wait until 3 PM to get our room made up. Buffet breakfast mediocre and expensive. I've stayed in much nicer Singapore hotels at a similar price. The Orchard is NOT a 5 or even a 4-star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY AT THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Carapelli
Reviews.Content: We have just returned back from a holiday in Singapore wherein we were booked and staying at the Orchard Hotel from the 2nd to the 5th of October. I am writing this to describe one of the most horrendous stays we have ever had at a five star hotel in our entire lives. We had come for the Chinese Golden Week holidays AND my own birthday. We walked into the hotel upon which we were told the hotel was overbooked, and the room we had booked was not available. We had booked a Superior Smoking Queen Room in the new wing. We were then told we would be "upgraded" to a Deluxe room in the old wing and so waited accordingly. After an hour the room still wasn't ready until we had to stand at the front desk for another 20 minutes until it was. We then were taken to our room which not only had filthy carpets but also had a stench from the bathroom. We asked for the room to be changed which then took another 30 minutes! We then went out to take care of a little shopping before meeting our friends for dinner and upon coming back we moved the sheets on the bed and found a large BLOOD stain on the bed and the covers! This was 100% from the previous woman who had stayed in the room and it was during "that time of the month" for her obviously. We complained about this and we were simply threatened by the staff that we would be downgraded, upon which I yelled at the staff telling them we just wanted the room we booked in the first place which the hotel couldn't provide because it was overbooked. This whole process took about 45 minutes and at this point a new room was still not ready and in this time our dinner plans had to be cancelled and we were forced to eat FAST FOOD because all other restaurants had their kitchen's closed and we could only meet our friends for a short 1 hour instead of the several that we had planned. We were forced to leave the hotel to come back at 2 AM to change rooms in the middle of the morning! All we heard from staff was "sorry and the manager has more important guests to attend to". This was absolutely ridiculous. They finally were able to give us a superior room in the new wing but a NON-SMOKING room which is not what we booked. Finally we were approached by the Assistant Manager from House Keeping and offered a plate of fruit for our troubles! This is how a five star hotel treats a guest staying during China's golden week in the hotel and who is paying an average of 220 SGD per night?? After talking to what we were told was the "Duty Manager" who was actually some assistant he simply told us that they didn't care about us, and that they were authorized to only give us a free breakfast as compensation when the people at the checkin desk already knew that we did not want breakfast as my wife and I prefer to eat later in the day. We were then approached on the 4th (My Birthday) and asked whether we had in fact smoked in the non-smoking room wherein we truthfully told the manager that we had as we had booked a smoking room and the hotel couldn't provide for us. He then in a threatening tone told us there would be a 100 SGD extra charge per night but because he was a nice guy he wouldn't charge us for it. Really? I came to Singapore to stay in a 5 star hotel for my birthday and holiday to be threatened by some random Asian assistant? This whole time we were not able to see the Front Office Manager which we demanded to speak to because apparently we were not important enough for his time. On the final day, the front office manager finally actually came into work and after seeing all the different things his staff had done was obviously very shooken up as he should have been considering the ridiculous service that was being provided. He was extremely apologetic but this is just several hours before we were checking out and obviously he had spoken to his staff sharply about their behavior as they seem to at least have a little respect for the guests that day. The manager then proceeded to offer us a 20 SGD taxi transport to the airport, which actually costs the hotel practically nothing in petrol. We are very strongly considering contacting the Singapore Ministry of Health, any other government organization involved in inspecting hotel facilities for cleanliness, the straits times, the China Daily, and various other chinese tourism agencies, telling them about everything that we have experienced. I know for a fact that the blood on the bed was in fact a very serious health violation according to Singapore law under which the hotel will be investigated and shut down temporarily until the situation is solved. The staff at the Orchard Hotel is the most unprofessional and unfriendly workers at a five star hotel that I have ever seen. We have stayed at the M hotel in Singapore which is also run by the Millennium group and it was a delight. My wife and I generally travel at least once a month to destinations worldwide and always stay at five star hotels. Please also note the hotel is half full of prostitutes with their customers which the front office manager acknowledged on the final day. STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Great package price!!”
Reviews.Author: wandering-soprano
Reviews.Content: Had stayed there for a week in November 2009. I took advantage of the package price they were offering, and that made this hotel a very good value. Free internet access, free laundry up to several items per day. I wish I had more time for myself so that I could try their famous Chinese restaurants. This may not be the best hotel in the neighborhood, but I was happy with what they offered. Marie

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sammy0585
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night whilst on business. Rooms great, excellent standard and facilities. Free internet via cables. Not wifi. Flat screen telly, large choice of channels. In room tea and coffee. Mini bar. Bathroom with bath and separate shower. Restaurant downstairs in lobby area serving all you can eat buffet during lunch and dinner. Good quality and large selection. Mostly asian dishes, but great amount of fresh seafood. Ala Carte also available, but didnt try this. Hotel is in great location. Close to "western pubs" such as muddy murphys. This is singapore though, so nothing is particularly far away! Has a pool, although i didnt use it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for shopping!”
Reviews.Author: HampshireSeasider
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, well appointed. Lovely lobby with huge clock showing 4 different faces of times around the world. Very good sized room with very comfy twin beds and large bathroom . High tech lighting system took us a bit of working out! This was a superior room. Also good sized swimming pool. Excellent buffet breakfast, what a spread of all sorts including Asian. Good location,for shopping but taxis waved up from a waiting stand by doormen so no need to wait and everywhere is "12 dollars or less" which for 2 of us worked out at £3 each per journey, cheaper and easier than the MRT! We stayed here for 4 nights on a break to split up the journey to Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnandRo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Millennium Orchard Hotel on a number of occasions this year and have been very impressed with the service and quality of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Auld_ReckieEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Second visit to this hotel . Efficient, pleasant enough staff if slightly impersonal, through given the amount of guests hardly surprising. Hotel has seen better days though is still ok and rooms are fine, decent buffet breakfast and if you want a swim a big size pool for a hotel in this price bracket. The main attribute for the Orchard is of course its location.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, but not the best”
Reviews.Author: rajivk11
Reviews.Content: This is a clean, relatively old hotel located just off one end of Orchard road (one of the best locations in the city). The location is pretty good, however Orchard road is a very long road to walk an some of the other hotels Hilton, Marriot etc. are more towards the center. One must book early to get a good deal. I got a Leisure for longer deal (room only, minimum 3 nights stay required) and got a 20% off the best available rate. Taxis are easily available at all times at the hotel porch, so travelling became convinient. If you fancy breakfast at the hotel, book it as a package otherwise it will turn out to be a lot more expensive. But frankly, its not that great. Explore Orchard road a little and you will find very nice cafe's offering great value breakfast. Some of the staff especially the bell boys, concierge is quite courteous. But a couple of the receptionists are exactly the opposite. They are the only reason why I wouldn't recommend this hotel to someone who expects good service.

Reviews.Title: “We could have stole a lot of nice things, but we didn't.”
Reviews.Author: Andrew_Pethick
Reviews.Content: We booked a signature club room for a night for a getaway (we were in Singapore staying with family members for a family event). We found our stay very enjoyable. It took 5 minutes to walk out to the main strip from our room. We initially lined up at reception in the main lobby room and waited close to 30 minutes to be served. We were third in line as well. When another staff member approached us at that point and helped us with our booking. It turned out that check in for signature club members is located elsewhere upstairs so we were shown up to the club lounge. A very friendly staff member organised our check in and told us we could sit in the lounge and help ourselves to the drinks and snacks available whilst she did this. This check in was very efficient (as was the check out when we left). We pitied the people who had standard rooms and had to brave the downstairs front counter. We were very pleased with the standard of the room. It was new and the furnishings and decorations were tasteful and of good quality. One of us noted with delight that the decorative pillows on the bed were silk as was the backdrop behind the bed. The main room and bathroom were very clean. The size of the room is not too squishy for two people but would be too crowded for three. The view was not something you'd want to stare at long, just a construction site. As per other views from any other hotel along orchard road, which is probably why it has a really small window. The room came with a king size bed which was very soft and comfortable (so were the pillows). There was also an evening turn down service. There was a couch and coffee table, a flat screen TV, desk with stationery set, free broadband Internet connection for laptops. The bathroom was most appreciated by us as it came with a separate bath and shower and the toilet was partitioned by a door. The shower came with a rain shower function which is now a feature I'd like in the home of my future. Water pressure was good. The bathtub was roomy and came with bath salts. It also came with a cushion so that you can sit back comfortably in the tub whilst you watch TV in the bathroom (yes, there was another TV, this one in the bathroom). We also liked that all the lights in the main room and bathroom were able to be dimmed.The main room had BOSE speakers that were meant to be able to play mp3s but no cable was supplied (but we didn't ask for one as this was not of importance to us). Room service was average. We ordered a club sandwich which was nice but was a little small for the price at $25 SGD, which is quite expensive for the price of food in Singapore! However we were pleased to note that room service was available 24hours. It took half an hour to come. We also had initially placed orders for brownies but the kitchen had run out. The purchase of the type of room we had allowed us access to the signature lounge, which was beautifully decorated and well maintained. It was also lovely that whenever we went there it was never overcrowded. Throughout the day we were able to help ourselves to small cakes and snacks, soft drinks, bottled water or coffee (a very good coffee maker was available). These were all free. The lounge also included free broadband internet access (one computer only) Canapés were served at night which were of lovely quality and wine was also available (however we cannot comment on the quality of the wine they had on offer as neither of us drink). We had breakfast in the lounge as this was included with the room. This was a standard buffet, with eggs cooked any way you like upon request.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel with so so Service”
Reviews.Author: W0ng_M
Reviews.Content: Stay in this hotel for 2nights recently in the Superior Room. The room size are average and the furniture was not so new anyhow. The aircon was so cold even i adjust it to highest temperature. The check in took quite a long time even though there was not many people. The front desk staff also rarely smile. During the night while i was waiting a taxi at the entrance of the hotel,i saw a person with wheel chair outside the entrance trying to get up the stairs into the lobby. However, after waited for a long time, there was no hotel staff come to help the handicapped person. At last, i offer my help to the person in the wheel chair into the hotel lobby. Poor service by the hotel staff. The only good thing for this hotel is the breakfast is good and lot of variety were served. Overall, i fell i can get a better hotel in Singapore with this price.Not value for money!

Reviews.Title: “CENTRALLY LOCATED AND A DECENT AMBIENCE”
Reviews.Author: saroshparakh
Reviews.Content: Located Centrally in the Shopping District of Orchard Road , the Orchard Hotel offers a decent mix of a Good location, decent food and ambience and functional rooms with a clean room and toilets.The Service Quality could be better though considering its rated as a 5 Star Hotel!During the Shopping Festival between May and July the Hotel gets pretty packed and its advisable to book your rooms well in advance to get good rates.

Reviews.Title: “All in one,business,travel and sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: sumone2nv
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers everything for your business needs and to your leisure trip. It is ideally located near one of the shopping centres in Singapore. It has a large nuymber of rooms and it is almost 15-16 stoires high.I stayed on the 11 floor and the view is magnificient.The breakfast is very expansive ,almost everything is available. It is one of the most luxurious hotels and the price is a little high but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the bellhops!”
Reviews.Author: fvariava
Reviews.Content: My luggage didnt come up for 40 minutes, and when I went to complain, the bell hops told me to take it up myself! Hardly the sort of thing you expect at a luxury hotel. The view from the rooms is not great, but the location is decent. The concierge was helpful and got us bookings to Universal Studios at Sentosa. Dont expect too much from the hotel and you should be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: artemisworks
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location tucked away at one end of Orchard Rd, Singapore's busiest shopping street. It is only a 10-15 min walk from there to the main shopping centres and an MRT station is just around the corner, making it convenient for public transport. There are no complaints really, it is everything you'd expect from an Asian hotel in this class - the rooms were clean, well decorated and freshly refurbished. The breakfast spread was excellent. One little niggle is that there was no free wifi internet available.

Reviews.Title: “4 and a half stars”
Reviews.Author: ltsao01
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had booked Orchard hotel through a travel package with Asia Luxe. It was the lower tiered hotel, but since it had decent reviews compared to the others, we decided to stay here. Centrally located, about 5 minute walk (3 long city blocks) to the Orchard MRT stop, this hotel exceded our expectations. Check in was easy. Our hotel was in the newer section. The room was perfectly air conditioned, neither too hot or too cold. The bed was more firm, but comfortable. We could not here the crying child from inside our room (though we could here him in the hallway). The room and bathroom were clean. Good water pressure with 2 different settings for the shower/tub. Mini fridge, free bottled water, hair dryer, toilettries were included. The workout room was decent with several cardio and weight machines. Pool seemed to be a decent size but we did not use it. Buffet breakfast - included with our booking - was great and pretty much had a little of everything for everyone (American, Chinese, Indian). Check out was easy as well. Pros: Great breakfast, good workout room, location, comfortable room/bed. Cons: No free internet (was quite expensive, but can't remember the price), view was not so pretty from our room, slightly on the smaller side

Reviews.Title: “Clean, solid & reliable. Efficient staff. Check net connection rates though”
Reviews.Author: Alexander028
Reviews.Content: Been here three times on business trips. Solid and sober rather than flash-opulent or dripping with breathtaking design. The well-trained staff are colour-coded for reception, meals & porterage. Everything works, but if something does not they are onto it asap. Well located for the endless Orchard Road shops. If a business traveller, take a screen break from your laptop and walk towards Tanglin Mall (a sort of Brit/Aussie bolt-hole) or to the Botanic Gardens in 15 minutes. Even the standard ‘superior’ rooms are well equipped. The 'de-lux' double rooms are larger but have the same facilities: big widescreen TV and bronze-tile bathroom. In the refurbished standard rooms there’s a bizarre transparent round window between the bathroom/toilet and the bedroom and although there is a blind for this window it’s a very odd bit of design. Internet connection for these rooms is an extra cost - very high. It’s included in suites. Orchard Cafe menu is international (with burgers) but also a sprinkle of Asian favourites and the cooking is good and the service attentive. Breakfast buffet at $28 seems expensive but has so much to offer you could skip lunch. (For $8 basic eggs/toast/coffee try Rockys, just out the door and turn left). The pool area is quiet and relaxing although it’s a city hotel so the view is just more high-rise concrete. The hotel banquet area gets a lot of weddings, so the locals must know something. The only real drawback is that there are no opening room windows. Even with the heat and humidity I think European visitors would like to open a window maybe once a day for a while.

Reviews.Title: “First class, friendly people”
Reviews.Author: Richieleeds
Reviews.Content: Singapore was very busy so we took the only rooms available which turned out to be on on the business floor. This gave access to the business lounge. This lounge is run by a delightful team of girls who make the whole experience worth the additional charge. Thanks Daisy,June,Sarah and the remaining stars in the lounge. The buffet dinner was also a highlight after a long day's work.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel & well located”
Reviews.Author: shaileeshah
Reviews.Content: its a nice hotel with very small rooms but very modern and clean. the shopping malls are located in the walking distance. it has subway in its premises. breakfast spread is awesome with indian veg food in it.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: nottyandnice
Reviews.Content: Rooms are tiny, bathrooms tinier. Clean but not Singapore clean. Asked for a plate , they actually brought only a plate and no cutlery, should have specified each item individually. Room service was like an hour, served cold food. Mini bar understocked and over priced for this calibre of hotel. Didnt try the restaurants but must say the buffet looked appetising, and good variety, but then that is a common factor in most hotels in Singapore..Food is almost always good everywhere...ok for convenient location and budget conscious...

Reviews.Title: “really 5 star experience”
Reviews.Author: alias_irisabhi
Reviews.Content: 5 out of 5 stars User Rating Check Rates Orchard Hotel Singapore: Orchard Hotel Singapore,The best hotel for me. I really" recommend you to stay here,you'll get your best experience in this hotel.Their service was really" great at all its WOW ! ! !! ! ! ! 1 1)They serve abalone in breakfast,what a lux food ! I love the breakfast in Orchard hotel Singapore,they served us with very good service . 2) They've executive class for them who stay at executive club room its such a great lounge for relax,you'll get wine,soft drinks,breakfast,lunch ,they're good at all ! 3)Great Location,located at delfi orchard which just 10 minutes walking to MRt station. 4)There's a tony romas restaurant behind the hotel.!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, clean rooms, no free internet”
Reviews.Author: MSBNorway
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel (being stuck in Singapore due to the ash cloud in Europe). We got this at 199 singapore dollars from wotif.com (wot deal). The rooms were clean and the bed very comfy. The hotel had a gym and a pool which was great, and the location was at the end of Orchard road - so close to shopping. When we checked in we could take advantage of the internet deal and the breakfast deal - both quite expensive (20 dollars per day for internet! - These days I expect this to be included in the hotel room price) and breakdfast was 20-26 dollars per person - however you could go down the street and get a coffee and scrambled eggs for 5 dollars so we declined the offer. Good value for money and we would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service,Rooms,Food etc. Had a ball there.”
Reviews.Author: Nayeem79
Reviews.Content: I got a honey moon Suit in the hotel..THough it looks busy @ the reception but they never make u wait...Its a place to stay as its located in cetral singapore and u get access to every thign from there..even for a stroll in the night...

Reviews.Title: “not 5* quality, but 5* prices”
Reviews.Author: kiwi500
Reviews.Content: decor on accommodation floor tired, dated and in need of a good clean at the very minimum. I would rate this as a poor 4 star, rather than a 5 star. Best thing was the swimming pool and the concierge. No free internet, $28/hr!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: tankerman1
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Orchard Hotel twice, both for 1 day/night. The staff at the entrance & foyer, are top notch. Nothing is too much trouble, and they are more than happy to accommodate your every request. The foyer itself, is centre pieced with a fascinating clock and marbled floors. The lifts are fast, and above, they are in very good condition. I have lost count of the hotels I have visited with nice foyers, but when you get into the lift, buttons are hanging off and the lift is grotty. Not at the orchard! Everything is gleaming clean.
