The only complaint I have, is the size of the room. It was a little bit small, and the toilet has a huge round window that looks right out to the bedroom. Just as well I was alone!!!!!!! That aside, the content of the room was all very good, clean and well presented.

Reviews.Title: “Really good, but let down by service”
Reviews.Author: FormulaF3
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Hotel is really good. It's the best one of the 3 hotels I've stayed in in Singapore. It has a great location - on Orchard Road, the main street in Singapore with more than 30 malls. It has good rooms, with 2 separate beds as an option for a family of 4/5, with music players in the Executive rooms. Some are a bit small though. I have to say they are also very quiet. The restaurants are very good, especially the ones in the adjoining Galleria and shopping arcade. Breakfast has a huge variety BUT be warned that you are going to be in for a long wait in a queue. The breakfast cafe is small and there are LOTS of people staying here. Come by 7:45 or 8:00 and there won't be much of a queue though. The staff. They are really good, polite, kind, knowledgeable. Hats of to them, really. The front desk service is good though a bit slow. They have answers to all questions that a tourist may ask. They upgraded us from a regular room to an Executive Club room free of cost! They also speak very good English so there's no hassle there. Possibly everything up to now has pointed in a good direction. But the room service DOES NOT. It is SLOOOW. We had asked for some bathroom amenities and we waited and waited. We called them repeatedly and they kept saying 'It's coming'. We finally decided to forget about it and go out somewhere. We were in the lobby when somebody said that they were bringing the stuff. Even food takes a really long time to come. The bathrooms are very nicely designed, with nice lighting and black tiles. The hotel also has a fitness centre looking out onto the swimming pool. It is good enough but a bit small and not the best. The pool on the other hand is superb; it is huge - mark my word, huge - and is 3.5 ft deep so it's okay for children. There is a nice little waterfall where the water falls into the pool. If I had to change 1 thing it would surely be the service; the rest, as you would have read, is good. If I travel to Singapore again, then Orchard Hotel would surely have a customer in the from of me...!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: rafalution_2009
Reviews.Content: Location: Decent enough if you are into shopping. Located at the start of Orchard Road. To reach Ion Shopping Mall, it may take you a 10 minute stroll. Room: The room feels a bit dated - at least 10 years old. A wee bit run down with some apparent lack of maintenance (or the lack of budget for it). And when we arrived at our room, my wife was pretty disgusted at the stains in the bathtub. If that wasn't bad enough, she discovered that the room door didn't have a security latch, there were awful looking stains on the phone and the table next to the bed. Ok, no one messes around with my wife when it comes to this sort of "hygene" and "safety" issues. She made a complain and the hotel promptly (within 10 minutes) send the bell boy over with new key cards for the new room. BTW, the bell boy was one pleasant bloke and it kind of made it up for this inconvenience. Service: was within expectations. Overall, I would recommend this hotel ONLY for the following reasons:- (1) Its slightly cheaper than the other hotels located in the better part of Orchard Road. (2) If you don't mind paying more for a nicer hotel but the hotel rooms have been booked solid, (3) You are curious about this hotel and would like to try it as an alternative. (4) it has a decent looking lobby with a mini clock tower at the centre. Now, that's pretty cool until you suspect that the time in the clock may be a bit off.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for both shops and Botanic Gardens”
Reviews.Author: FSHK
Reviews.Content: I am toying between a 3 and a 4 for this one but have marked them down. Although I have only stayed here a couple of times, both times it was in the suites on the executive floor, which have great decor in the bedroom and sitting room, whilst the executive floor service is very personal and attentive. What I don't like are the bathrooms - very dark as it is all black marble and an odd layout which means the loo has a glass door and is directly opposite the shower - not ideal if you and your other half like a bit of bathroom privacy! Plus they are also quite badly lit - difficult to put your make up on! On both nights I was actually woken up by the hideous smell coming from the drains - not sewage, but DRAINS. We asked for someone to look at it after the first night but it was still pretty niffy. The problem is that this is quite an old building so the drains for the bathroom are quite open underneath the flooring. Basically when you let the plug out of the basin or bath, you then hear it all dribbling away under the shower drain. Kind of annoying. But maybe, ironically, this is just the suites? The breakfast restaurant is a bit of a bunfight but the food is pretty good. Location is a good balance for tourists, between the Botanic Gardens and Orchard Road. But hmmmm....if I was making the decision myself...(my Other Half arranged this one), I'd probably try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located Average hotel with Star Tag”
Reviews.Author: DreamingaboutTravel
Reviews.Content: check in took almost 2 hrs. no proper facility to take care of guest waiting for room allotment. staffs were not courteous. bit argumentative. more interetested in their work than customer's problems & needs. Room size were ok but very noisy. room propagates sound from alleys. recommended for its location. Located in main business road of singapore and one can reach to bus, metro are within 5 min walk & taxis respond within minutes of waiting. breakfast was good & never tried for lunch & dinner. But whether this hotel qualifies to be a star hotel, no way. this stands as an average hotel among 3 star facility

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location....value for money”
Reviews.Author: GOPG
Reviews.Content: Pat on my travel agents back for having got us to stay at the Orchard Hotel in Singapore while on our family trip this Feb.... The price for which we got this hotel is amazing and the location on Orchard Road along with the ambiance was superb....we were right there in the centre of the city amongst all the action... everything seemed so closeby....the rooms in the hotel were very neat and clean and the warm hospitality of the staff was a cherry on the cake...

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: girliegirl123
Reviews.Content: Any questions please email me louisemhulme@yahoo.co.uk My partner and I stayed here for 4 night before we flew to Australia. The second we pulled up outside the hotel we knew had made the right choice, our bags were taken form us while we checked in, we given a breakfast deal whilst we checked in, breakfast everyday for £7.50, it was the most delicious breakfast ever loads of choice to suit every taste. When we checked into the room we was suprised not as small as we thought it was goning to be, fantastic views, a lovely bathroom which had a cute little blind to pull down other wise there is no privacy!!!!!!!!!!, a safe and a good size wardrobe with ample space. The hotel does have a lobby bar, but we did not use this. The hotel has a shoping mail attached to it, which has a subway attached it plus a few resturants. The pool was fantastic, half an olympic size pool and gym with lockers, sun beds and a bar which serves drinks and snacks. The locatation of the hotel is outstanding right on orchard road, with shops bars and resturants literally on your door step, it has a planet hollywood and starbukcs 2 mins away. All in all we would not stay anywhere else in singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with excellent facilities”
Reviews.Author: sweettravellerIndia
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Hotel Singapore is located on the most happening Orchard Road in Singapore. The Hotel truly gives a world class feeling from the moment one enters the hotel lobby. The rooms are well made, very spacious with all the necessary amenities made available. The hotel offers buffet breakfast with a huge variety of options to choose from. The view from the rooms are very good and the service provided is also par excellence. Everything is easily accessible from the hotel. the Metro station is also just a few minutes walk from the hotel and the staff is also very courteous. The washrooms are also very clean and spacious and the toiletries provided is also very good. Would definitely recommend anyone planning to book this hotel to go ahead without any doubts and second thoughts.!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, really good.”
Reviews.Author: Vagabond_World
Reviews.Content: I would say the hotel was really good in practically every aspect. It is a bit expensive, though comparativley you are getting your value for money. It has a good vibe to it, the lobby is a nice place to be. The only black point would be that at the Intermezzo bar they did not know how to serve a Vodka Martini, it took about three tries and they still did not get it right. The breakfast was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: MrLuv2Travel
Reviews.Content: Was in in Singapore for some meetings and a dinner function at this hotel, and thought it may be convenient to stay here since I found a very good rate on agoda.com. Yes, the hotel has been around for some time now, and the interior is aging a bit, but it's still a nice, comfortable, and very convenient (location wise). Best of all, it's not too busy and crowded like most of the other more expensive hotels deeper into the main part of Orchard Road. Nevertheless, I was very satisified as I could sleep in peace on a nice and comfortable bed. Yes, the standard rooms are a bit small, but not as bad as some pigeon hole rooms I've stayed at other nearby hotels. The only complaint I may have is that even though you get two small complimentary bottles of water, the larger bottles are a bit of a rip off as they cost $16 for two medium sized ones. Not really a problem though as there are markets and 7-11s where you can buy them for $2 for a large bottle. The gym was small to medium in size, but well equipped and pleasant to work out in. The pool is pleasant, but most of the deck chairs are usually taken whether the sun's out or not. Great to be able to just sit by the pool and relax by ordering snacks and drinks at the poolside bar. My rate didn't come with breakfast or internet, but I was offered the two for an extra $30 per night, which isn't too bad a deal, so I took it. The breakfast buffet was well worth it. Nice spread of different varieties, usually fresh as the turn over is high, and of very good quality. There must be something good about this cafe as it always seems crowded at breakfast time, lunch time, tea time, and dinner time. I'd actually been going to the Chinese restaurant at this Hotel (Hua Ting) for many years now as it has the reputation of being one of the best in Singapore, for regular meals and dim sum. They've run out of room the actual restaurant itself and has now expanded out into the common are outside the restaurant. However, I'm not sure if they can cope with the volume as service (although excellent) was a bit slow. I enjoyed the lobby lounge even though there was no longer a live band there, as I was told their contract had run out. Nevertheless, nice ambiance to sit there and chat with friends over a drink and snacks, or just watch "interesting" people walking through the lobby. Oh yea, there are no longer massage therapy rooms at the fitness center, so it's all done in your room now. If you're uncomfortable about letting strangers in your room, then there are plenty of other massage joints in town.....depending on the type of massage you're looking for..... *wink* *wink* :) If you're looking for a good regular massage, then it's best you ask the concierge or receptionists to direct you. Otherwise, you may get something more than what you're expecting ;) I'm not a bar hopping type person, but there are plenty near by that are quite popular hot spots.....and pick up joints. aka Orchard Towers. All in all, a surprisingly pleasant stay. I will definitely stay here again provided I can get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but room is quite basic and its civility not service”
Reviews.Author: mgwch
Reviews.Content: Booked a deal through Wotif. Hotel is in a good location but that is the only positive I can think of. The room was small, worn at the edges. Bathroom was even smaller and there were strands of long hair that did not belong to me despite the room just being cleaned. The staff are civil, its not service. At check in, I asked a member of staff basic questions which she could not answer. She proceeded to ask the front office manager presumably who granted a response but made no attempt to look at me or acknowledge me despite being inches away. The next mroning, an early departure meant I was down very early. Reception was empty. Duty person checked me out and that was it. I had to ask for help with taxis to which he turned on a light and then said you need to wait. He was not rude or anything but all in all, given their supposed 5 star rating, this was quite a gruff response. I would not recommend this hotel unless you can secure a really big discount. Have had much better elsewhere. There seems to be a problem with the 4 star / low end 5 star category in Singapore. It seems you either splurge and get the best or its budget and no frills with little in between.

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit”
Reviews.Author: colin-leeds
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at this hotel and was not dissapointed . We were located in a different wing which seemed more roomier , the service and cleaniness of the room is above standard .Also appreciatet being offered an extension of vacating the room due to a late flight with out asking . The location for shopping on Orchard Road is ideal but if prefer the the city life and tourist spots you will require a taxi but taxis are cheap in this city .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for 1st visit to Singapore”
Reviews.Author: RockyDarwin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I own a business and do not get away often but with cheap flights to SIngapore we headed over for a long weekend. Orchard Hotel was booked via internet from a recommendation of a friend and it was great. Easy access to shopping and dining. Catch a bus from right out the front. My only comment was about room service that we ordered when we arrived - pizza was like a melted cheese sandwich and cold so we didn't do that again but service was friendly when we neded something so would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TimmyR37
Reviews.Content: Facilities are wonderful especially if you go for an upgraded room - be sure to know what "++" after the room rate means though, or you will get a fright. Will definitely use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Biajera
Reviews.Content: This was the second time in this Hotel. Located in Orchard Roadm this hotel is great place since it is along Singapore's Shopping Place. It is also the end hotel in Orchard Road and along side Condominiums maing it a quiete spot. The Hotel is bigger than other Hotels I have stayed in and I love the bathroom it is a voyeur's dream, it might be shock to some since the wall dividing the room and the bathroom and the bedroom is glass - so you can be viewed while taking a bath. Fine for people who are comfortable with thier bodies, for ones who are not, just close the shade and have your sexy silhouette show. The room seems to be newly refurbished, clean with new ammenities and for Frank Muller aficionados, this is the hotel for you. Although my sister had a bad experience, she was staying in her room and just watching TV all of a sudden her door opened, since she was unable to close the send bolt lock. I seemed the returning guest who stayed in the same room day before still has the key. Anyway, the guest had a mix up with the front desk and the front desk failed to say the guest's new room number. Just a mishap, but a little funny But for me my stay was - great great great!!! But my sister definitely has a different story.

Reviews.Title: “Great location nice experience”
Reviews.Author: UKVisitor
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights prior to flying on to Australia, the room was perfectly adequate size wise as we did not spend much time in it except to sleep. We arrived after an overnight flight from the UKk at 9 am and of course the rooms were not ready (Delux rooms - but we did not expect them to be) but we went for a walk and a coffee and came back and they were ready at 11 30. The room was very clean the only slight problem was the bathroom door was very difficult to slide across. Also there was no walk in shower you had to step into the bath which may be a problem for less mobile people. The breakfast was included in our rate and was extensive and we never experienced a queue (at about 9.30 most days). Excellent location at the top end of Orchard road. Yes, there are ladies of the night about after dark but they did not trouble us. We only used the pool once and could not get a sunbed or a chair. Singapore is quite an experience shopping, eating ,drinking but take plenty of money it is not cheap. Do try the Fish spa across the road ,that is something else.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed Over 30 Days”
Reviews.Author: Brunswick1977
Reviews.Content: We were recommended the Orchard Hotel from a business colleague and Singaporean resident. The primary purpose of our stay was business-related. For majority of the time I was placed in a room that looked like the one pictured as their "Deluxe Room," but with Executive Club access. I had the Red-colored "Deluxe Room." It was tight on space, but adequate for one person on a long stay. It may be too small for a couple who plan on staying longer. The bathroom is tiled black and a little dark, but I think it's because some of the lights were burnt out. Of this room, the shower was the best feature. Towards the end of my stay, my spouse joined me in Singapore and we were moved to the "Signature Deluxe Club," also with Executive Club access. We had the Green-colored" room as currently pictured on the hotel's website. Together we stayed in the "Signature Deluxe Club" for a little over a week. Had we not moved from the "Deluxe Room," it would have been difficult to keep the peace. The "Signature Deluxe Club" was perhaps twice the size of the "Deluxe Room" and included a larger bathroom with a soaking tub, a seating area and simply more space to place luggage and to walk. Our room was directly below the Executive Club area and noise seemed to travel very easily. Without trying hard, we heard a lot of walking around going on upstairs which made it difficult for us to sleep in. Having stayed only in the Executive Club, we unanimously recommend it. The service in the Club is outstanding. It made the stay from good to great. They helped me navigate around the city and even recommended a top notch floral shop. I wanted to pickup some flowers for my wife when I met her at the airport. The breakfast selection is smaller than the one downstairs, but the service sets it apart. We preferred the smaller selection in the Club. We had breakfast around 7:00AM, so we did not encounter many crowds. The small snacks throughout the day and cocktail hour were a nice touch. You may encounter more crowds during cocktail hour. There is one laptop and access to a printer in the Executive Club, as many patron are primarily on business. Our stay included internet access and two (2) pieces of dry cleaning service per day. With that said, when you stay at the Orchard Hotel, we recommend you stay in the Executive Club levels. The service downstairs is good, but not the same as that in the Executive Club. The front desk is helpful, but face many more guests so the personal handling is like most other hotels of this caliber. The breakfast buffet downstairs is hectic, loud and fast-paced. We wouldn't say it's necessarily a great deal, as there are other breakfast joints down the street for half the cost. The breakfast buffet downstairs is convenient. The bell service is a little slow, but we didn't problems getting a cab. The fitness club is older, but okay. We did not use the pool or the mini golf area. The mall connected to the hotel is quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but room rather smaller than expected”
Reviews.Author: w4terside Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Service very good especially concierge who helped with internet check in. Good advice that we should take taxi to Changi airport rather than use airport shuttle bus as after rush hour it works out cheaper (even with two passengers) and much more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, functional, GREAt location!”
Reviews.Author: RealTravelPro
Reviews.Content: I frequently stay at the Orchard Hotel in Singapore, typically for two to four days at a time. I never had anything to complain about except for the slow internet connection in the business center and the rather high costs for internet in the room. The staff is always friendly and the facilities (pool, gym) are great. The rooms are clean, modern, and functional, in a few years they will certainly need an overhaul but are good for now. The hotel has a great turnaround on corporate customers. Location is key with this hotel, it is in reach of many attractions: the shopping mile, the public transportation system, and restaurants. One thing that might be disturbing to some is the Orchard Tower party scene located across the street. During night and early morning time one cannot overlook the "business" that is going on there on the streets. Although I have never personally been harassed, I know of some colleagues who don't exactly appreciate the "red light district" atmosphere in front of the shopping building. I would always stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Large but comfortable hotel - convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Pazzee
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for three nights in October 2009. Check-in and service generally is efficient and friendly. Rooms are comfortable and high-standard. Breakfast buffet is varied but busy! One person serving coffee means caffiene addicts may have to wait.... find the "coffee cupboard" just by the doors to the kitchen and serve yourself! Business facilities are standard and service on the conference floors is good. Buffet lunch is as varied as breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: vinnie2k
Reviews.Content: A bit pricey after taxes but location is good and breakfast buffet is awesome. Rooms are clean and spacey. Service is great.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kerridwen82
Reviews.Content: Hotel situated next to Hard Rock Café and Starbucks. At the end of Orchard Road, in the street there are some "street's wimen"but did not have any problem, as Singapore is a very safety place! When going out there is not any night life except for a night with "street 's wimen", neither a bar to drink somenthink after 11.00 pm. Internet was not free and very expensive. Hotel was good, not excellent, but good.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay again”
Reviews.Author: noelyboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orchard for the umpteenth time for a week in Sept and not disappointed. Due to number of stays both business and leisure now automatically upgraded. Booked an executive stay and received a suite. Not the most spacious in the world but great for Singapore and executive lounge excellent service and quiet as usual. Fell into trap of being there the Thursday and Friday during F1 so prices doubled but guess that is the same throughout F1 days where all hotels take advantage. Suite clean and well appointed. Great to have a proper sitting area and TV over the bath. Staff could not have been more helpful. One day at pool sunbeds were all occupied and that is only complaint as no standby available. Only had to wait fifteen minutes as visitors are pretty transitory. Worth the slight expense of taking the executive option and would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite Chinese-themed rooms - if that's your cup of tea”
Reviews.Author: suitdude30
Reviews.Content: I booked 5 nights at an Executive Club room at the Claymore Wing of the Orchard Hotel Singapore, and upon arrival, was less than impressed by the grubby carpets in the corridor and in the room. Please, Orchard management, the carpets are UNACCEPTABLE and should be replaced immediately. It created a very negative first impression. The decor was bland, and was actually depressing, with no splashes of colour whatsoever. The bathroom was very dated. After 2 nights, I was so unhappy with my room that I asked for, and was shown a room on the Signature Club floor (i.e. the equivalent Executive Club floor, but in the Orchard Wing; the hotel's 600-odd rooms are distributed over 2 wings). What a revelation! The Signature Club rooms are exquisitely done by a famous French designer, Jacques Grange, in a very tasteful Chinese theme, but with all the comforts and technology expected of a 5-star hotel, even though the Orchard is rated 4-star. The drapes are electric, with a superb Bose Wave radio/CD player, and large plasma TV. Bathrooms are done in black granite, with an LCD television recessed into the wall in front of the bath. It was like I was in an entirely different hotel, not just a different wing! I immediately arranged to be moved to a Signature Club room, and thoroughly enjoyed the rest of my stay. The standard rooms (i.e. non-Signature Club) of the Orchard Wing) are still better than those of the Claymore Wing, but it is undoubtedly worth paying extra for the Signature Club. In all my travels, nowhere have I seen such beautifully-decorated rooms, and the pictures on the hotel's website do not do them justice. The breakfast buffet in both the Executive Club and Signature Club lounges are identical, with cold and hot items, and a dedicated chef for a la carte eggs, up to international standards. I was happy with the large outdoor pool, as well as the gym, whose range of equipment was better than many 5-star hotels. For a 4-star hotel, the Orchard isn't cheap, but I would recommend paying a little more for the Signature Club, whose benefits include (apart from breakfast and all-day refreshments in the Club lounge) in-room Internet access and laundry/dry-cleaning of 2 items daily, as well as unlimited consumption of the mini-bar drinks (but not snacks), whose range is admittedly limited. The Orchard is situated at the Orange Grove Road end of Orchard Road, which means a 10-minute walk to the main part of Orchard Road with the department stores. If you enjoy heat and humidity, then this can be pleasant, but it wasn't exactly fun for me. The lobby is large, and is perpetually busy, not just because the Orchard is a large hotel (and it is, with over 600 rooms), but the main restaurant occupies a part of the lobby, and its patrons create a lot of noise, which makes for a nice "buzz". I am undecided as to whether I would stay at the Orchard again. On the one hand, I was so enchanted by the Signature Club rooms that I would return to this hotel, but on the other hand, the relatively long walk to the shops makes me look for an alternative closer to the department stores.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but small room size”
Reviews.Author: Puaykin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife and 3 year old kid for one night on 20th September 2009. I had requested for a king sized bed, but what I got was only a quen size. Though, my early checkin request was granted and I was given free early checkin since I was with a kid. Room is well done up and quite modern , but is of a very small size. The breakfast is a good, huge spread, but the restaurant tends to get very busy by 8 am. Even the hotel lobby is always crowded with people. The hotel is located right at the start of Orchard Road. Just a few steps outside the hotel gives you access to a plethora of restaurants and shopping malls. Very recommended for a stay in Singapore city if below 200 Singapore dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roo30
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard Hotel for a week and we enjoyed our stay there. We were on bed and breakfast basis and the breakfast was lovely with a huge variety of food. Our room was very spacious with a very big LCD TV and a big desk also. We had tea and coffee making facilities in the room and also a safe, an iron with ironing board, and a refrigerator. Ou room was always cleaned by the time we got back to the hotel and the staff were all very friendly. Room Service was available 24 hours a day which was ideal when we got in late a few times from coming back from a few bars. The hotel is very big and has a shopping mall on one of the floors. There are several ATM machines about a minutes walk from the hotel, and there are several internet cafe's along Orchard Road also. The Business Centre at Orchard Hotel charged a lot for using the internet so went to one of the cafe's for internet usage. The nearest train station is about 5-8 minutes walk. The train is good for travelling around Singapore and is also very cheap. We did some tours which we booked upon our arrival with one of the local companies which was located in the shopping mall of Orchard Hotel. The hotel also has a swimming pool which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Hugely expensive and no breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Drargonstone
Reviews.Content: Wouldn't go there again. The place was crawling with porters and glitz. the rooms were clean, small but sufficient. There were tea making facilities in the room however I was shocked to hear that breakfast was not included in the price. I am sure we could have found somewhere for half the price that would have catered to our needs. Escort/Prostitution services seemed to be prevalent and that left a rather nasty taste in the mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly inconvenient location, nice decor”
Reviews.Author: cabaretstar
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms on the 16th floor (Club room) but some inconsistencies amongst our group of 7 people as to the standards. Different room sizes and decor meant some in the group were disappointed, and others very well pleased. My room was lovely, decorated in pale green with silk embroidered panels and a sitting area. The TV was at an awkward angle to the lounge and TV, but it's a small complaint. Free soft drink mini-bar was great. Bathroom had a deep bath and separate shower, and a flat screen TV for that crucial time when you want to watch TV whilst bathing.. Room service hideously over priced and luckily unnecessary due to the number of restaurants and cafes nearby. I mention the location as inconvenient simply because it is at one end of Orchard Rd and for those not use to the heat and humidity of Singapore the walk to the main drag of malls (Siam Paragon, Wisma) can be a bit long. Pool is great to cool down, but the pool side service could definitely be improved, as could the breakfast offer in the Club lounge and the computer access in same ( a laptop and tiny printer do not cut it for business travellers). The Business Centre on the Ground Floor is not very much better. Service was excellent but it did take over 30 minutes to get my room key, and laundry that was due back before 2pm returned at 5pm (on the day I was leaving) so I recommend you tell them you need things faster than you actually do! All up, not a bad hotel, and good value but some facets let the team down.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Standard Rooms”
Reviews.Author: stockholmerinsydney
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location if you are in Singapore for the first time and want to primarily explore Orhard Road Shopping. The rooms have been refurbished what feeld like 1-2 years ago and are slightly worn - but only slightly. We had one problem - we had to ask multiple times for an hypo-allergenic pillow and doona. The staff appeared to have real difficulty in understanding what we needed and in the end we got more down pillows - not hypoallergenic.. A small glitch in an otherwise good overnight stay. On our return two night trip we chose to stay at another hotel for a little bit more luxury...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location. Great Staff. Would go again”
Reviews.Author: ali2542
Reviews.Content: We recently travelled to Singapore for a family wedding. The staff at the Orchard treated with nothing less than the utmost respect and gave every attention to detail. We stayed in the deluxe rooms and they were very spacious enough even with an extra roll-away bed. Would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad for such rates”
Reviews.Author: ontonzz
Reviews.Content: We booked through booking.com and the rates was good with breakfst is inclusive. Since we arrived early, the fronkdesk staff has allowed us to check-in at 12pm. The hotel is located at the end of Orchard Road and walking to Orchard MRT is around 10-15minutes..It may be less than that if you don't have to carry your kids...The breakfast was good and they do served pork, so for Muslim travellers, you may need to know this. The only bad experience we had during our stay was that upon our return to the hotel after a long day trip, our room was not cleaned eventhough we've put the sign to request for the service. Therefore, we've to call the housekeeping but eventually no one came. So we have to personally look for the cleaner to get them clean our room. What a waste of time, and since we were too tired, it really pissed us. Other than that, the overall stay was just OK.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Tourist/Business Hotel with good facilities and in good location.”
Reviews.Author: PhilNorthHertsUK
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded free of charge on arrival to a superior room. Good standard of facilities and very helpful staff. Excellent bed and bathroom. Super buffet breakfast catering for all tastes i.e. Asian, Indian and Western (International) which kept us going until the evening. One downside was using the internet in the business centre was too expensive so we went elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Surprise ...”
Reviews.Author: _de_last_one
Reviews.Content: Been quite a few years since I had stayed here and I have to say, I was pretty happy with my stay. There is no need to go into details for room quality as I am adding some photos for your own decision. The hotel had updated a couple of years ago and these photos are for a deluxe room (I was staying with my kids aged 5 & 7). The pool is nice without anyone else around. There is a fun chess game (ground) if you are interested. The gym is of a normal size (but I am not keen on working out in a gym without windows). The lobby cafe is very popular with the lunch crowd, always packed with people. I will stay here again esp. 'coz of the location (convenient to Orchard MRT as well as variety for shopping and dining in the immediate area). Note : forgot to mention, the room does look nice and comfortable but dont expect 5* quality (e.g. the wall decor comes off the wall easily)

Reviews.Title: “we felt very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: SydneyTrip05
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice hotel. We enjoyed our room and didn´t want to leave. We had our own doorbell. It was clean so we didn´t have a problem to be barefoot. The breakfast-buffet was so good, that I was stuffed.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel. Good location”
Reviews.Author: emsy85
Reviews.Content: This hotel was okay and the location is okay for shopping and was good for my business trip. There's much better hotels in Singapore and it certainly wouldn't make me specifically choose this hotel to stay in if I was visiting Singapore for any other reason other than business and proximity to office.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay....”
Reviews.Author: ThilinaPerera
Reviews.Content: I only stayed for a one night, but it was great! Night life is just next door! Check in was very fast and staff were very friendly too. Gym was good, and the pool. Good food too. But no late check outs, due to 100% occupancy!! I even offer to pay for an extra night.... No luck....! ------ Thilina Perera from New Zealand.

Reviews.Title: “location is excellent”
Reviews.Author: holidaycrazyIndia
Reviews.Content: very good location.... as the bus stop is just outside. it has its own small arcade of shops. a 'subway' there and also money exchange if you do not want to use the hotel, as one can get a better exchange rate from the shop in the arcade.my kids loved the hotel. the reception- lobby is grand with a live singer in the bar in the evenings.i paid about s$170 per night without breakfast, which i think was good value for money.good room and amenities were great. the concierge service is very helpful. could not use the swimming pool as it shut early and after a day of sightseeing one would like to relax by the pool. all in all a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lobby Hangout”
Reviews.Author: Absan
Reviews.Content: Its a nice Hotel, Great Location, Helping staff, The shopping gallery is worth visit, Nightlife is just next building. Food quality is also good.

Reviews.Title: “good, but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: japina65
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd time staying in this hotel, and the longest one as well. My previous stays had been business-related and were very brief (overnight stay for transit in Singapore) so the hotel did not give any lasting impression, but good enough for me to decide to choose this hotel for a 5-day holiday with my partner. It was a nice touch that I got a 'welcome back' card from the hotel manager and was upgraded to the Executive Club floor - however as I only paid for a Deluxe Room I didn't get to enjoy all the Execute Club benefits, which turned me off a bit. The room they also gave me was smaller than what I was expecting - the last room they gave me was bigger and I was a solo traveler then! I was a bit disappointed but the room was still clean and comfortable, although a bit outdated. The buffet breakfast is good and offers a wide selection of Western and Asian dishes. One advantage for me also is that the hotel is in a quieter area of Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Li_Li
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the heart of the shopping district of Singapore. We only stayed here one night as a stopover and it was absolutely fine. Reception told us that they put us in a high floor with a view of the city, but the only view we got was of some construction! The room was as expected and bathroom looked to be recently renovated. We were satisfied with our short stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Christmas Holiday Location”
Reviews.Author: gamevets
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent Christmas in Singapore and was the first time for either one of us to be away from our family. We chose the Orchard Hotel from a friend's recommendation and were not disappointed. We enjoyed being on Orchard Road and experiencing a warm Christmas celebration with fake snow!! The hotel lobby is classy and spacious and was decorated elaborately for Christmas. The staff were very professional and friendly. We ate breakfast each morning at the hotel's breakfast buffet as it was inlcuded in our room price. The buffet offered a wide variety of western and local favourites. Most days this was not a problem, but one morning the main dining area was too busy so they had additional seating on the upper level with it's own tiny buffet. The food choices on the upper level were not as elaborate and only had the "main" items from the buffet down below. The staff frowned upon getting food from downstairs and carrying it upstairs. I do think this was only a problem due to the busy holiday season, nonetheless it was a minor problem. We reserved a table in the dining room for the Christmas buffet which offered many different selections of meats, cheeses, salads, potatoes, desserts, etc. The price was reasonable for the wide selection that was offered. The room we stayed in was quite spacious and very clean. We may have been upgraded upon arrival, but was not made aware of this if we were. There is chargeable internet in the room. You can charge per day or per hour ( I think). I would choose the per hour option if I were to stay there again. When you charge per day you actually get 24 hours of time, it's not really "per day". So I was charged two days, but only used a few hours of time. The concierge was helpful in getting taxis, stamps, and keeping our bags after we checked out, but still had the day to spend in Singapore. However, to learn about tours and sight seeing in Singapore, they send you to an outside vendor that is located within the mall directly attached to the hotel. The hotel is a short 5 minute walk to the subway and is very convenient for taxis as it is on the less busy end of orchard road, but still very convenient to all orchard road shopping. Overall, I was very pleased with the hotel and will stay here again if I get the chance to.

Reviews.Title: “decent enough if you're not spending much time in the hotel”
Reviews.Author: svhgirl
Reviews.Content: we stayed here during March 09 and overall were very underwhelmed by this hotel. Whatever you do, do not believe what the hotel website tells you, since its seriously out of date. The hotel is now non smoking, even though you can book a smoking room online. All rooms do not have laptop safes either, despite it being advertised as such. When we complained we were then told that we didnt get a laptop safe because we were 'upgraded' which was funny since we paid for a deluxe room and thats what we were supposedly upgraded too! There is no jacuzzi as stated on the website either. The hotel is VERY expensive for any additional extras - SG$16 for 2 bottles of water being one that really surprised me, and the service is very impersonal and slow. We asked for a spoon to be bought to our room, and this took 45 minutes. The 'IT' butler is simply room controls by your bed, which would be great if all the lights turned off there, but many of the room lamps are not connected to it. The rooms are fine and clean enough, ultimately if we had got the hotel described on the website we would have been happy, but since false expectations were created we were not. This combined with the stereotypical big hotel style service (no interest in the guest just in making money) left us feeling that we would have been better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointed stay”
Reviews.Author: Vafirish
Reviews.Content: Check-in reception was slow and the most outrageous thing was the fact that there there were not many guests going through check-in. My check-in was handled by a guy (I have decided to make him anonymous here)who seemed pleasant at first until he asked me when will I be checkin-out. I believe informing me of the check-out time(like other hotels I have visited) would have sufficed. What make matters worse is the fact that I did not get a double bed room but a twin bed room - I indicated in my booking form that I am going to be staying on my own so why can't they have booked a double room for me. Very upset! Great location-wise but if you are expecting service this is a let-down

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: edwiri
Reviews.Content: Apart from it's prime location this hotel has nothing to write home about. It's way too expensive compared to the value it provides. I wonder how it could fetch its 5 star rating. The room we stayed in was so small I almost felt that I stayed in a Hotel 81 chain, not a 5 star one. Check in was not so smooth and on breakfast we had to wait a long time to be served coffee or tea because it was under-staffed. I saw several guests grumbling over the same issue over breakfast. On our first day, I came back to the room after lunch time to find my room was uncleaned. Then, when I had my nap somebody just popped in to clean the room. What a nasty surprise you wouldn't expect from a 5 star hotel. You can find better value for money elsewhere than to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the central location”
Reviews.Author: rdr
Reviews.Content: This is a large and very busy hotel. It is ideally situated for the shops and transport links in Orchard Road. The buffet breakfast offered a very good selection, that catered for western and asian tastes. The staff were extremely helpful, and if I go back to Singapore, I will certainly consider using this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “lovely upgrade”
Reviews.Author: alewisman
Reviews.Content: Arrivng in late evening, the hotel was very busy and we got upgraded to a suite....they checked all other options first..but finally and grudgingly gave us the keys..... The suites are fantastic.......fantiastic....tv at the end of the huge bath..enticed my first hotel bath in many many years..the rain shower was heavenly....... Finally in Singapore got some value for money....but overall SIngapore seems to gauge how much you have in ur pocket when u arrive and leave you with 50 cents when you leave.... Living in KL am shocked by the difference in price ....but little if any in quality, in fact prefer Kl or indeed Bangkok., both have character and far more fun place to visit..........and 1/3 of the cost, maybe 1/4.......

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: World_Saunterer
Reviews.Content: We found our room to be quite clean and comfortable with air conditioning that worked particularly well. I loved the strong hot shower and extremely comfortable bed with down comforter. Unfortunately, our room was located next to the elevator and was noisy beginning early morning. Make sure you request a room away from the elevator. This hotel is located at the end of Orchard Road, and a relatively short walk to the Orchard MRT station and the shopping malls. If you have little luggage you can take the train to and from the airport for just a few S$. A cab will cost about S$25 and take about the same amount of time -- 40 minutes door to door. (The MRT is an unbelievably cheap and convenient way to get around the island and extremely easy to use.) I have two complaints about this hotel. First, their business center internet charges are S$15 for 30 minutes which is laughably ridiculous considering we found a nearby internet café that charged S$3 per hour. In addition, there a small mini-mall just across the street that is absolutely teaming with hookers overflowing onto the street after dark. I did not expect them in this neighborhood (right next to Valentino no less) and taking an evening walk was like running a gauntlet. For this reason, I would not take kids to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “luxuriously Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: S_Nanda
Reviews.Content: Singapore was the last destination for our 7 day trip to malaysia and singapore. The city' charm already made us quite enthusiastic for the visit. Orchard road being the heart of the mesmerising town was our perfect choice for the stay. Our agents made our bookings in Orchard Hotel. Hotels location gives it a premium advantage ,as situated just next to the orchard road one can really explore the markets and showrooms within a walking distance. Within close by vicinity one can find restaurents like starbucks coffee, sub way and other big stores which not only provide you with basic requirements but other clothing brands also. There was also one very good indian restaurent which was probably run by Bombay offee House. Even the metro station is quite close by so one can opt to travel to places like china town and mustafa from there . Talking about the hotel aminities the interiors and room was really good. Room TV had video on demand facility.Also as we went close to Christmas eve hotel lobby was really a beautiful view. Food was also good and hotel also accomodates -TAJ restaurent on one of its floor. Overall the experience was excellent .

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds & pillows”
Reviews.Author: IntanWan
Reviews.Content: Was in Spore for conference in Marriot Hotel. Since Marriot was way out of my entitlement, we managed to book rooms in this hotel. Highly recommended for business travellers. We got a great deal at S$198++ with bfast, for it's location (heart of shopping area in Orchard Road). Great pillows and bed...love the flat plasma TV on the wall..i spent most of my free time in the room. One thing though....the hot shower is not strong enough. You need to turn on the cold tap to get strong shower, which by then the shower is not hot anymore... Bfast range is great...i put on thcik slab of nutella on my bread every morning..:) Great service too. One afternoon I wanted to ask for check-out extension. When I reach the front desk, all staff were entertaining clients. Then suddenly a gentleman (I think it was the FO Manager) greeted me from the back and ask if I was being entertained yet. Asked him abt the late check-out, and he said I need to pay extra night. But when he found out abt my late flight, he suggested me to check-out in the afternoon, left my luggage at the concierge and once i need to freshen-up, just inform the Front Desk and they shall lead to the Courtesy Room (i think that was the name) where I can change and freshen up without any extra charges. Isnt that great?? Fortunately, I managed to change my flight to earlier schedule and didnt get to experience the Courtesy Room..:( Overall, it was great stay...and sure will be back again..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: markh
Reviews.Content: other than taking forever to check in I really liked this hotel. Hotel is right off of orchard rd. Hard Rock Cafe is across the street along with orchard towers for your nightlife where the bars stay open intil atleast 3:00am.

Reviews.Title: “Not really recommendable”
Reviews.Author: AMG007
Reviews.Content: Worst Check In experience ever - took them more than half an hour for a simple check in process - not once, but with many people I spoke to. Completely incompetent concierge. Rooms ok, but very thin walls; forget sleeping if one of the neighbours takes a shower. Breakfast is not in a breakfast room, it is in a part of the lobby - exteremely loud and uncomfortable. There must be other and better 4 and 5 star hotels around Orchard Rd. Avoid this one.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: patmikeLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Just back from this hotel -stayed here on our way to and from Oz.We cant find any fault with the hotel excellent service and lovely clean room,excellent base at the top of Orchard road for shopping but also for non shoppers like ourselves.We found the pool area very relaxing after a long day sightseeing.We stayed on a room only basis but found a lovely cafe a 2 min walk from hotel for breakfast -reasonably priced called The Rocky Master.We ate at the Newton Hawker centre and really enjoyed the food and the atmosphere.We loved Singapore and would recommend a visit to Sentosa island

Reviews.Title: “business hotel”
Reviews.Author: dusty2dusty
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Orchard hotel for eight nights. Room very nice. Clean and comfortable, with good pool and fitness suite.The hotel location is good. Situated at the top of Orchard road, and not to for from the MRT. The main flaw with the hotel is that it lacks atmosphere. It main customers seem to be business people staying for one or two nights. Not a typical holiday hotel. Would recommend this hotel for a couple of nights only. Not suitable for children.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast a disgrace!”
Reviews.Author: Adelaide66
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Singapore overnight on way to Phuket. We had to pay much more than the usual rate as it was Grand Prix time but this did not include breakfast. The breakfast was suppose to be $20 each but we were charged $28. Everything was stone cold - the eggs, bacon and tea and coffee - I do not mean luke warm but freezing. The rooms were nice and the hotel wasin a good location. The rooms were also very clean. The staff did not go out of their way.

Reviews.Title: “My all time favourite hotel”
Reviews.Author: SurreyGirl63
Reviews.Content: Easily the best hotel I have stayed in. I stayed here in March 2006 during my stopover on my return journey from New Zealand, spending nearly 3 days in the balmy 33ºC of Singapore before returning to a cold (4ºC), wet London. My room was lovely, well designed, with a spacious marble lined ensuite. The hotel is huge and the vast lobby of the hotel hosted live music in the evening. I arrived at 9.00pm in the evening and by the time I had sorted myself out the hotel restaurant was closed (more about the restaurant below). Hungry, at 1.00am I ventured downstairs to the reception to find out what kind of food was available through room service or locally. I was asked if a dish of fried rice was acceptable, brilliant I thought, not the usual fare of congealed potato wedges and dips. Less than 15 minutes later a steaming plate of food arrived with not just fried rice, but chicken, singapore noodles, spring rolls and other goodies. The service at the hotel was the best I have ever experienced. The Orchard's restaurant offered an à la carte or buffet selection, both of which were of the highest standard. I was in my element at breakfast time with a wide selection of breakfast fare, a choice of eggs (scrambled, poached, boiled, fried or omeletted to order). I chose to return to the hotel for most of my meals during my short stay in Singapore, as the food was so good. The hotel is situated close to the shopping area on Orchard Road, where you can visit the designer shops, or buy electronic goods and jewllery for far less than you would in the UK. In the shopping mall behind the hotel I found a good tailor who was able to make a dress and suit for me in just over a day and at a reasonable price. I would highly recommend the Orchard Hotel to anyone staying in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: VAM00sax
Reviews.Content: This hotel has very mixed reviews but my wife and I were only staying for 3 nights (15th – 17th June 2008) so I thought it worth a risk and I was glad we did. It is a very good hotel in a good area well served by bus and MRT (underground train). The public areas: reception, bar, lounge, restaurant, gym, pool are well kept. Take a free apple from the front desk each morning! All the staff we encountered were extremely friendly and helpful. The bedroom was clean and comfortable. Our 13th floor room overlooked the main road with the Hard Rock Cafe just across the road and other skyscrapers all around. The bath, shower and toilet were spotlessly clean. The towels were “Daz white” soft and fluffy. The flatscreen TV was nice (Philips model... I would have expected JVC, Sony, Samsung, etc). Breakfast is very expensive, we got stung the first day but ate out from then on, there’s an abundance of places to eat on Orchard Road. The mini bar prices are off the scale – you’ve been warned! At night the adults are out to “play” but we were not interested and as such the ladies at work never interfered with our evenings; besides this was all comfortably enough away and not bang on the Orchard’s door step. In summary I would recommend The Orchard Hotel for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “losing its shine !”
Reviews.Author: 2TravellersAustralia
Reviews.Content: I have stayed @ the Orchard Hotel on several occasions in the past whilst visiting or passing through Singapore and have found it to be very good, not excellent but very good. However, on my last stay they seem to have dropped the ball. I stayed in an Executive room in the Ochard Wing which is the room grade I normally choose but based on my last stay, I think I'll explore other accommodation options. Firstly, the room tariff has increased to SIN$400 per night + 10% service fee + 7% GST. I think the Orchard is becoming a little expensive. Secondly, the executive checkout wasn't functioning (so I was told) when I tried to check out and I was told to go downstairs to the main desk. This didn't worry me unduly but one of the things I like about the Executive Club is that you don't have to wait in line to checkin or checkout. After waiting for 10 minutes to reach the front of the queue, I was told by the staff member that I could have checked out upstairs. When I stated that the staff member upstairs told me to come to the main checkout because of a problem, he didn't look very impressed and neither was I. Lastly, on each occasion that I've previously stayed @ the Orchard, I've sometimes tipped for excellent service and sometimes not if I thought it wasn't warranted. This last visit was the first time that I've seen staff on 2 seperate occasions obviously stand there waiting for a tip and not being at all backward about it. On a previous visit I had asked about the service charge on the room and had been told that tipping was not necessary as the service charge covered this aspect, and besides "this is Singapore and it's not considered to be polite". If you consider that the service charge on my room was SIN$40 per night, that's a lot of tipping value that's supposed to be distributed amongst the hotel staff. I like the Orchard but they need to pull their socks up in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Three strikes, so they are O-U-T”
Reviews.Author: JohninNYC
Reviews.Content: I had booked through one of the online Asian booking services, and stayed for three nights in early June 2008. The carpeting in the room was filthy: stained with many splotch marks, and general unsightly. The furniture in the room was so antiquated it is what I remember from my childhood 50 years ago: stained wooden beds, night tables, and desks painted over at least nine different times down through the years. The buffet for breakfast was merely adequate. Coffee and tea were self-service, so there were large numbers of persons always walking about the dining room with cups of hot beverage. No waitress/waiter service, no carafes; one simply had to get up and walk over to the hot beverage dispenser with one's cup. This is truly an accident waiting to happen. There is a fast food outlet off the lobby (Swenson's American style coffee shop). The hotel doors leading into the fast food outlet are always open, so the odor of the fried food always permeates the hotel lobby. What a smelly situation.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christos M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Orchard hotel just for a night and obviously I cant have a complete opinion about it. Despite of that I can make some comments. Unfortunately I didnt ate or used any facilities that the hotel may have but I loved the location and the room. Conveniently located at the end of Orchard road and ideal for shopping and with a great room this hotel was just perfect for me. I shall use it again to my next visit to this wonderfull city.

Reviews.Title: “Worth It!”
Reviews.Author: femaleTurista
Reviews.Content: this is my 2nd time in singapore in less than a year. we then stayed in Golden Landmark hotel but this time we treated ourselves to a higher class hotel. we enjoyed our stay in OH. the only problem we encountered was upon checking in we have to wait for an hour coz the rooms are still being made. no worries since we arrived lunch time so we decided to tour the hotel and found ourselves several restos in the orchard shopping arcade (which is like a mini mall within the hotel) for our lunch. we then proceeded to the orchard wing (orchard wing has elevators separate from the claymore wing which is on the other side). we later found out the rooms have different looks and amenities. even if our rooms were both standard one room has: 32" wall mounted LCD tv, see through toilets with separate shower/bathtub, more storage for luggages, pool view, 4ft high mirrors. the other room we had: 21" LCD tv, no separate shower/bathtub. but then again, no worries for us. the hotel is around 10 minutes walking distance from the orchard mrt. but we didn't mind coz along the way you'll pass by several shopping malls, 7-eleven, grocery/convenience stores, money changers, pharmacies, restos, etc. if you want a hotel really near the orchard mrt you better stay at the more expensive Marriott Hotel which is literally just across the mrt station. we toured the city most of the time by mrt (so better buy that EZ card) coz it's faster/cheaper and at times we use taxi cabs. the hotel is just walking distance to the shopping malls along orchard road. contrary to what the other guests have mentioned, the staff were friendly and helpful. they have wide selection of foods for breakfast buffet but during our 4-day stay there the buffet menu spread was never changed. i will definitely stay here again if i come back to singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Over Priced”
Reviews.Author: LukChang
Reviews.Content: Clean & tidy, I stayed on the executive level, pool is good. Not worth paying the extra to upgrade to executive floor for the few benefits. 1) Free cocktails between 6-8pm, but is all waitress service, 1 girl serving & the service is slow. Food is buffet type, and is nothing special. 2) Laundry to the value of S$18, however by the time u have put your T shirt & socks in you are over the level. expensive if you stay more than a few days. Handy for the shopping on Orchard Road & Orchard towers 2 mins away The room needed a bit of maintenance, knobs missing off the cupboards, sink cracked etc, not what u expect from a hotel of this calibre

Reviews.Title: “Pretentious”
Reviews.Author: RLMUK
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for (what was meant to be) our one night stop over en route to Thailand. Initial impressions are good, the lobby and reception area were nice and lively. Reception was cold and could not be described as friendly or welcoming. The rooms are nice and large and very well appointed. our room had very high ceilings which added to the feeling of size. We had no complaints with the room and found it quite comfortable. The location of the hotel is good for shopping and sightseeing tours. I had some visa troubles trying to travel to Thailand so we had to stay in Singapore one more night. After travelling from the airport back to the city centre to the airline offices and back to the Orchard hotel, we were notably hot and sweaty and tired. we did not have a reservation, however as we asked if they had availability she took a looked at us disapprovingly then in the system, had a quiet word with her colleage and told us that they were sold out. We later checked and there were rooms available online that night. I am very unimpressed with their arrogance and lack of customer service skills. I have stayed in hotels much nicer than this and have never been treated in this manner... very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Superior suites good”
Reviews.Author: hippychick1965
Reviews.Content: We originally had a superior room booked for 6 days however these rooms have a quirky little feature of a large porthole between the bed and the bathroom, ok if you are travelling alone or if you want to watch your companion on the loo (not my cup of tea but hey each to their own). We upgraded to one of the new wing rooms which was great had a hugely impressive bathroom and incorporated breakfast evening cocktails and snacks the cost of the upgrade was £230. The hotel was easy walking to the big malls on Orchard Rd. Word of warning we left a cash deposit of £150 as security even though we had paid in full as we didnt wish to give our card details this was not offered back on checkout and had to be asked for. would i return? No but thats because i would never choose to return to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: hcychan
Reviews.Content: Location: Good location, located on one end of Orchard Rd, a 5-10 min walk from the MRT station. Service: Average, not impressed. From check-in to check-out, I don't think I saw one smile from the front desk staff and barely heard any Hello's or Good Morning's. Bell staff were the friendliest and always offered to help when concierge were busy. Housekeeping barely speak English but always friendly. Rooms: At first, we were placed in the Orchard Wing. room was a bit small, bathroom sink space was small, and shower was open with no curtains or door, but i loved the rainshower. amenities are decent. Beds in Orchard wing were small and our safe did not work, even after we asked Housekeeping to come and fix it while we were out. The second day there, we tried taking a short nap but the corridor was extremely noisy with the staff door opening and banging shut at least once every 15 minutes. So we complained to front desk and they upgraded us to a Superior room in another wing. This room was more spacious, bathroom was a lot bigger and there was a bath and separate shower staff. We stayed in room 750 with a view of the pool. beds were bigger, but my mattress was uncomfortable and i could feel the springs on my back! at least the safe worked and closet was bigger. Facilities: We used the gym and swimming pool everyday. fitness center can be quite crowded with guests and their personal trainers. swimming pool size was very decent and it never got too crowded, but i think the pool needs to be cleaned as i saw some green algae growing in cracks on the side. Food: We had breakfast every morning for S$20 (special hotel rate). good breakfast buffet with fresh fruit, Swiss yogurt, pastries, congee, eggs, sausages, etc. Singapore Overall: We spent 4 nights in Singapore and did pretty much everything that one tourist could possibly do. Weather was quite warm and humid. Visited Little India (nothing to see), Chinatown (loved Ann Siang/Erskine roads and The Scarlett Hotel with the rooftop restaurant), City Hall areas, hotel hopping, Singapore Art Gallery (neat colonial-style building), Sentosa (nothing to do and barges disrupt the view!), Orchard Rd (some great malls like Takashimaya, Wisma Atria, The Heeren), Tanglin Rd (nice new St Regis hotel and some neat shops in Tanglin Centre), food courts and Lau Pa Sat (great food!), Clarke Quay... Overall, not too much to do but great food, good shopping, and good transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel after reception”
Reviews.Author: BlackpoolWillow
Reviews.Content: We booked two nights at the Orchard as a stopover en route to Australia. Specific requests were made for an early check in as we arrived at 07:00am following a 12 hour flight. The receptionist simply was not interested in this and advised us that a three hour delay was the best they could offer. There was no duty manager available to assist and despite repeated requests there was no way past this lady. We did eventually get a room at 09:30 despite a considerable number of people checking out whilst we waited. Surely Orchard management must be aware that the Orchard is widely used for stopovers and they must be more accommodating. After the initial problems we had no further cause to complain, the room was fine and very clean however watch out getting out of the shower as the bath side is considerably higher than normal and slipped getting out of the shower. The included buffet breakfast was excellent and the location convenient to shops and restaurants, the Hard Rock cafe is just across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sean_e78
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a perfect location if visiting Singapore for a short time. I have stayed here a number of time on business and found it to be very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “What you'd expect from a large hotel”
Reviews.Author: AMc02
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Orchard on return journey from NZ/Aus. Had two nights on the way out and one night on the return. Hotel is large and very busy, business travellers, airline crew, delayed flight passengers and many stopovers. Staff were friendly and the rooms were clean and well maintained. We were travelling with 3 children which the hotel couldn't really cater for. We had two rooms one double and one double with extra bed, on both visits we had to request the extra bed on arrival as it wasn't already set up. A little frustrating as we arrived late with jet lag and the kids were desperate to get to bed. It also meant that we had to split the family up, one adult in one room with a child and one adult with the other two in a different room. The food at the hotel was ok. Buffet style and what you'd expect from a large hotel - nothing special but plenty of alternative places to eat down the road. Location is good, right at the top of Orchard Road so if you enjoy shopping malls, you'll be in heaven! A couple of things which did impress us, my husband left a jacket at the hotel on our way out and 5 weeks later it was waiting at reception for him on our return trip. The pool was quiet and plenty of loungers and towels. Drinks very expensive though. A hospitality room and childrens playroom (very basic) were available for use after checkout but you had to share facilities with everyone else waiting for late flights. Overall, not a bad place to stay for a night or two but wouldn't recommend for anything more than business or 'stopover' accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AAYL
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Singapore where we stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Some of the staff are friendly, some not as much. The rooms are big enough for what we needed. We were in there to see the city and not stay in the room all day. Location wise, it's a bit further from the main attractions of the city (Orchard Road shopping strip, China Town, Little India and the Harbour). Don't get me wrong, the public transit system is pretty easy to use and it's about a 5 minute walk to the MRT (their local subway system). About the rooms, a bit on the tired side. The carpets need replacing badly! The hotel claims to be a smoke free hotel but I think it was a smoking hotel before. No matter how much they steam clean the smell of smoke is still around. We had to ask them to leave an airpurifier in our room for the duration of our stay. Aside from that, our room had a large bed, safe, mini frig, kettle for making tea or coffee. iron and ironing board and a really cool window between the bathroom and bedroom area. Don't worry, there is a screen you and pull down for privacy. They also have an outdoor pool (pretty good size), a fitness room, a mini golf area and a kid's play room. The hotel is fair for the price you pay. If you are booking this hotel, make sure you get a really good deal (compare prices throught the Internet or with your travel agent first). DO NOT pay the rack rate because it is NOT worth the money. Upon check in we heard another customer request a room and the hotel quoted them more than twice the price as what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: rubydogUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on route to Australia, booked 1 twin and 1 triple room but on booking in was told there were only twin rooms available and we would have to have extra bed in one room 3 single beds in a not very big twin room! so was not too happy about this but no apology from staff just "take it or leave it " attitude. The pool was OK but don't buy a drink from the pool bar, the prices are very expensive as is the bar next to reception. The buffet breakfast was good with all tastes catered for but had to wait for some things to be cooked. Our breakfast was included in room rate don't think I would have paid extra for it as was quite expensive. Think I would try a different hotel when next in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: hotCanada
Reviews.Content: We just came back from spending 3 nights at the Orchard Hotel in Singapore. This was a great hotel with an excellent location - right on Orchard Road. Check-in was fast and easy. We hadnt gotten breakfast included in our rate but it was no problem b/c we ate at this little cafe facing Orchard Road called Rocky Mountain or something like that. They served an american breakfast for about US$7. A nice way to start the day! The Orchard Hotel has nice, clean rooms, and good bathrooms. There's a flat screen tv in the room too! The only thing I'd criticize is that the beds are too hard. We knew this from all the reviews we had read anyway. I think anymore than 3 nights and we would've been uncomfortable but 3 nights on a hard bed was fine. The location is really great at this hotel - a quick walk to the visitor centre, across the street from CPK and Starbucks etc.. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting Singapore. Cant comment on the food and other amenities as we didnt really try anything. The concierge service was nice though and helped us out with a luggage pick up. Great place to stay in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: frankaUK
Reviews.Content: We stopped in Singapore for one night en route to Australia. The Orchard Hotel is well located, and the rooms were comfortable enough. However, we arrived at 8:30 pm and the room was not ready until 9:30. Room service was slow, even after reaching them (the direct phone line didn't work).

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, very impersonal”
Reviews.Author: PRogersDublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights enroute to Thailand. Check in process was incredibly slow and after about 20 mins managed to get to talk to someone, who spoke about three words during the process. We were upgraded to an executive room on the top floor free of charge which meant that we ended up with a room that was huge and had our breakfast on the same floor as were were staying. The staff on that floor were friendly and helpful, but would not have liked to pay the extra for the service. Ate in the hotels acclaimed Chinese restaurant on Christmas night and although not expensive the menu is certainly not to Western tastes, the food however was good and the service was prompt and curtious. I would stay here again but would be hunting for a good deal

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: jean_wong
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is ok, but a little far from the MRT after a full day of walking. The room and bathroom is very small. The quality of the breakfast is atrocious - there are much better breakfast places outside the hotel. Overall a very average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “dont stay at the orchard hotel”
Reviews.Author: muascott
Reviews.Content: I work for an international shipping company. I have been staying at the Orchard Hotel Singapore for around three months now. This has given me enough time to evaluate the hotel and may I say that it is the worst hotel that I have ever had the displeasure of staying at. Please allow me to give an example, on 31st dec 07 at around 530pm I received a phone call in my room from the guest relations officer, informing that I had to relocate rooms because they claimed they were doing "rectification" on that floor, keep in mind this is new years eve. Disappointed I moved to another room on another floor. I went down to reception and spoke to the guest relations officer who ensured me that the rooms were undergoing "rectification" and that nobody would be staying in the room that I once occupied. So it was to my surprise when I called the room from my newly appointed "smaller" room and to my surprise there was somebody staying in there. The guest relations officer blatantly lied to me. The gymnasium is poor in relation to some of the equipment. The treadmills require servicing only one of them gets upto the speed that you select. the decor in the rooms looks tired, fixtures in the rooms need repair. Fire exits are blocked on occasion by room service trolleys or boxes and the doors that should provide you with a somke free escape are rotten at the bottom. The thermostats in the rooms that I have stayed in dont work. When I checked in they reserved 1000 dollars on my credit card without my knowledge. Overall A poor hotel with tired staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: annomonus
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a perfect location. We only stayed in Singapore for 2 nights so this hotels location was ideal for everything. Right at the top of Orchard road and perfect for shopping !!!!! The rooms were great and hotel staff very helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: Smaske1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the orchard for 3 nights on our way through to Australia and found the hotel fine for the price we paid. Food in the hotel is pricey but there is plenty of places a taxi ride away. The room we had was a little small for the extra bed for our son, you should check what size room has been allocated. There is an outdoor pool that was a little chilly when overcast but I am sure in the sunshine it would be lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Akator
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the Orchard Hotel en-route back to London from Brisbane. Situated at the quieter end of Orchard Road, the main shopping street in Singapore, the hotel is well equipped with professional and courteous staff. The rooms are a good size, modern and well appointed. There are three restaurants, two bars, a well equipped gym and large pool. Check-in was painless and the luggage was speedily delivered to the room. Good breakfast buffet. A good 4* hotel, which I would be happy to use again.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: HappyAussie_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night as a stop over at the end of our trip. So all we needed was a good place to rest as we had seen Singapore before. We paid a little more for the room (not the basic room) and was well worth it as we were treating ourselves. The room was quite well fitted our with modern styling, flat screen tv, relatively spacious. The bed was wonderful with a soft matress & pillows. Being a big hotel - reception was busy both when we checked in and out. But this wasn't a major problem. The location is quite convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Tam Carr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night on our way home from a S E Asia holiday and although I was familiar with the hotel I had not actually stayed previously. We were not disappointed and had booked a Club Room to take advantage of the lounge in the evening. Check-in very painless and found the room to be very comfortable. All the usual facilities but no idea which direction we looked out to as I didn't recognise anywhere. Club Lounge was excellent with lots of snack items and freeflow wine and beer from 6 - 8pm. The lounge was also used for breakfast in the morning and the spread was very nice indeed. Freshly cooked eggs available and all the other items from a buffet style display. We would definitely recommend the hotel for a stopover as the location could not be better. At the end of Orchard Road (the main shopping street in Singapore) and access from the hotel directly into a small mall.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but only 3 - 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Woodai
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on for 5 days. A group of us were in Singapore for a week-long training course and our company picked this hotel for us. I've stayed in other hotels in Singapore (ie., Shangri-la, Ritz-Carlton, Fullerton) so compared to these 3 hotels I felt that the Orchard Hotel was just so so.
