The room was clean but service was not great. The concierge forgot to call a taxi for us one morning even though I had requested a taxi the night before. The same thing happened to someone else in the group, so a word of advice... if you're staying here next time call your own taxi! The breakfast buffet was average, nothing spectacular and I had to flag down waitstaff to get me some coffee. The location was right on Orchard Road, within a 5 minute walk to Wisma Atria. I guess if you're in Singapore to do lots of shopping this hotel is ok.

Reviews.Title: “"Above Average"”
Reviews.Author: Divabiz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here only for 1 night, coming from Australia on a stopover to the UK & we were happy with the stay! Probably wouldn't go back again - it was above average but only a typical business stop-over hotel. I didn't find much atmosphere there, it was just all robotic, there wasn't much human heart in the hotel but well worth the stay. It was central, clean & friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Look forward to returning”
Reviews.Author: AlfWestSussex
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews were dreading our overnight stay to and from Australia. We needn't have worried; the hotel, staff, room and food were excellent! Don't know what people are harping on about re the breakfast buffet, it was fit for a king and a bargain price. We look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: rebeccalouisa
Reviews.Content: I have been to this hotel a few times now and would not hesitate in returning. I stayed at the hotel with the Singapore Stopover, before travelling on to Australia. Also stayed on the return journey. This is a wonderful hotel situated at the top of the famous shopping street, Orchard Road. Excellent location. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. There are bell-boys who take your luggage to your room. The rooms are very nice at the hotel, especially the en suites. Each room has a large TV which had a few decent channels on, including news and music channels. The buffet food is fantastic at the Orchard Cafe, there is always a wide selection of foods and it is of very high quality. They also offer A La Carte, which is also delicious. The room service is very good too. The hotel has a swimming pool, fully-equiped gym, sauna, potting green, giant chess set and a dart board. The swimming pool is idyllic with a gorgeous cascading waterfall. There is also a small slide for young children. The hotel boasts an adjoining shopping arcade where there are jewellery, wine, tailor and souvenir shops as well as hairdressers and beauty salons. The hairdressers are well worth a visit! At Christmas time the lobby is decorated brilliantly and looks very impressive. Worth visiting at this time!

Reviews.Title: “a classy resort”
Reviews.Author: Zwitter
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was well situated at the top of Orchard road, a busy shopping street near the heart of the city. My family and I met with a greeting from a member of staff who swiftly relieved us of our luggage. The hotel had a beautiful reception area and whilst the reception staff were very helpful the check-in desk was one of the slowest I have ever observed. My family and I waited in queue for some time and for anyone suffering jetlag any wait becomes a considerable one. We were greeted warmly at the front desk only to be told that the rooms we had booked were not ready but we were able to leave our cases with the hotel whilst we explored the city for the next few hours. Returning to the hotel at about two in the afternoon we found that only one of the two rooms we had booked had been made available. It was not until 7pm that the second room was ready. The second room however lacked the extra bed we had requested for the extra family member and it was another few hours before a third bed could be supplied. Despite the disorganization with getting the rooms, I must confess that the standard of the rooms was generally excellent. The linen was clean and the room was stylishly furnished. They were well stocked with bath robes, slippers and bathroom toiletries. On the whole the accommodation was extremely comfortable. The only aspect to the rooms make up that I can reflect upon with less than praise was that one of the glasses left in the bathroom was dirty with an obvious orange residue. Perhaps this was overlooked in the hurry of getting the room finally ready. The Orchard Hotel has an indoor swimming pool and gym for its guests. The pool facilities even included a mini waterslide which the kids enjoyed enormously. Overall the Orchard Hotel is certainly agreeable. From arrival to departure it is a stylish and classy resort with an air of cosmopolitan charm. Though tailored more to the average business traveler, anyone heading to Singapore and seeking accommodation ought to consider a stay at the orchard hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What you expect... little else...”
Reviews.Author: Grumpy01
Reviews.Content: Okay, I had to stay in Singapore at the Orchard Hotelfor a few weeks while on layover. It was fine at first, but it would have been better with a kitchenette. Not wanting to spend a lot of money on dining out all the time, but also not crazy about fast food, it was hard to eat health in the room. The hotel has a pool and a men's spa includes with the room rate. We had to bargain a bit to get the breakfast included with the room rate. There's plenty to do fairly close. Lots of shopping, bars, and coffee shops. There's a tour desk set up in the back of the hotel on the 1st floor. The MRT subway is only about a 5 minute walk and from there you can pretty much get to anywhere on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but watch out”
Reviews.Author: Fly_the_world
Reviews.Content: The Orchard hotel is beautiful with very attentive staff. The daily buffets are a feast. Entertainment is good. My only warning is to watch out for deceptive add ons. I was encouraged when checking in to accept a $60/day executive upgrade. This was to include free soft drinks from the mini-bar and daily laundry up to $18/day. Also, access to the Executive lounge. Well when checking out I had been charged for drinking canned green tea from the mini bar and for cleaning services. It was explained that green tea was not considered a soft drink. And all of the daily laundry charges added on were because dry cleaning was not considered a laundry service even though it was under the $18/day allowance. Needless to say I was not pleased since at no time was there any mention that dry cleaning was excluded from the package or I would be charged $6 additional for each can of tea. So overall it was a nice hotel with very misleading promotions.

Reviews.Title: “excellente !!!”
Reviews.Author: HugH72
Reviews.Content: I was just in singapore for a few days for a business trip as well as sidestepping to jb in malaysia and stayed at the orchard hotel. though the hotel is at the end of the orchard road it wasn't such a drag to walk for 7 minutes to the nearest metro station and 5 minutes to the nearest bus station. along the orchard road is the shopping haven for up trend market labels. but for bargain hunters is not that difficult either for the metro station is just 7 minutes walk from the hotel. the hotel itself is superb in furnishing and style. i like especially the bathroom with a rounded see-through glass to the bedroom so you can watch tv while in the tub or just plain tease someone in the bedroom while bathing. lol!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK for Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: oowan
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here because company had a conference in the hotel. Room we had in Orchid Wing was only 3 star, heard there were better rooms. Wouldn't stay here if it were a personal holiday, but we like to stay at 5 star hotels. Not up to standards of Hyatt or Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Central”
Reviews.Author: lockyHanoi
Reviews.Content: The agent recommended this place, and on arrival despite the lack of welcoming staff and doors being opened for you, the lobby looked the part. The biggest choker was breakfast. S$20 each for a poor quality, limited choice buffet. We went to Negara next door for the same price at higher quality. Location: If you like shopping & prostitutes, no problem! As soon as dusk arrived, it was Hooker central outside.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pompeyman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a 3 night stopover going to Australia and 1 night coming back. We had two very pleasant stays, with a warm welcome each time. The rooms were clean and well equipped, although the room on the first stay (13th floor) was bigger than on the second stay (6th) for the same price. Carpets in both rooms were a bit shabby and there was a slight musty smell that you might expect in a high humidity environment. All staff were very helpful. We didn't eat in the main hotel restaurant as it was a bit expensive and found places to eat elsewhere. There is a Subway and a western/Indonesian cafe within the hotel building, where we had a meal that was rather disappointing. There was a small, quiet shopping arcade here, including a tailor where I had a suit made to measure (in 2 days if you want), at an excellent price and very well made. All things considered we would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Place”
Reviews.Author: etheridge
Reviews.Content: As our brochure stated the Orchard Hotel, "offers cosmopolitan elegance and comfort in a great location." I agree! We stayed for four nights, but wished we had longer! Great hotel, rooms very modern, comfortable with a touch of luxury and a very good sized TV. (great value for money) Though we didn’t have time to watch TV, too much to see and do in Singapore! This hotel is in a great location, at the top of Orchard Road. This hotel has a beautiful reception area and the reception staff are very helpful. Though beware if you are checking in really early, (before 12noon) you may be given a key to a small courtesy room - you may also find that you are sharing this room with other early arrivals! Ok for a quick freshen up, but not good if you have got jet-lag and need to sleep! However I would definitely recommend this hotel and we hope to back one day!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: KaKwok
Reviews.Content: As Honeymooners, this in hindsight wasn't our best choice but it is still quite a nice stay. It's under going reno right now but we didn't notice it. It's got a very nice foyer, great facilities (gym, pool, hospitality room for late check outs, kids room and putting course), good breakfast buffet (with daily Vegetarian option, great for us) and very good staff. The only downer for us is that, as Honeymooners, there wasn't much and the room was on the small side. Having said that, the room was nice and cleaner, with a cut bathroom to boot. It's good stay for families (especially if you have kids) however I think it's probably best as a hotel for business travellers. Still we enjoyed our stay there. Ka.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: catherine07
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during a stopver on the way back from Australia in Feb 2006. I found the hotel to be very clean and tidy and the staff were very welcoming. I was travelling with another female friend and we felt very safe in Singapore, and in this hotel. We were treated so well, we booked onto a morning sightseeing tour (arranged through the hotel) which I hightly recommend if you want to see some of the famous sights of Singapore in a few hours. Staff were always so helpful when getting taxi's and needing any assistance at all. The rooms were modern, very clean and well looked after. The location is great, situated inside a small shopping mall - you walk straight out and onto Orchard Road. The only slight disappointment was the breakfast, we thought we'd try it one morning (as we had paid for room only). It was quite expensive and not particularly worth the money!! All in all though, a fab hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pedestrian, at best...”
Reviews.Author: Alex959
Reviews.Content: I'd been to Singapore before in 1994, but stayed in the Oriental. That hotel was very good, but geographically, a bit out of it. The agent recommended this place, and on arrival despite the lack of welcoming staff and doors being opened for you, the lobby looked the part. It is attached to the hotel shopping arcade, which like so many in over-subscribed Singapore is a run-down ghost town. The room: Refurbished in contemporary theme, but with chunks knocked out of the woodwork and a dirty carpet. Kind of an Ikea vibe going on and unfortunately quality of fittings to match... We were told it was recently refurbished, but it looked rather hammered. Only supplied 2 bath towels & no hand towels. Our room loooked over 2 building sites and the refurb of the pool area. Pool: Shabby. Ancient loungers, ice cold water and looking onto the side of a building, hence little sun. They did however, site the 'putting green' overlooking Orchard Road, which was bathed in sunshine. Go figure... The biggest choker was breakfast. £12 each for a poor quality, limited choice buffet, in an ambience of cheesy plastic marine life. How they can charge 10% service charge on a serve yourself breakfast is beyond me. Location: If you like shopping & prostitutes, no problem! As soon as dusk arrived, it was Hooker central outside. Both my Wife and Daughter felt anxious coming towards the hotel after shopping, being looked up and down by some very dubious characters. In conclusion, we would definately not recommend, or stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent All-rounder”
Reviews.Author: Ginger19
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and had complimentary brekkie! The hotel is situated in the CBD and as soon as you leave the hotel, its the shopping strip. The hotel is also close to all tourist attractions. The room was very clean and comfortable and had a plasma tv. I requested a Queen+ bed but got 2 king-single beds instead, but the service, location and quality made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in every way”
Reviews.Author: IzzyJ
Reviews.Content: I can honestly say this is the best hotel experience I have ever had. Nothing was too much trouble. When we arrived, I was upset 'cos there was a blocked drain smell in the bathroom - we were moved to a new room within 10 minutes of 'complaining'. From then on everything was great. The rooms are very nicely decorated and furnished, the buffet breakfast is enormous, and we spent late nights in the pool and playing outdoor chess. The location is fab, we walked everywhere at any time of day or night. Approaching Christmas is a really good time to visit this hotel, they had built a real gingerbread house in the foyer and decorated it with frosting and sweets. It was so creative. I'm saving up to go back as soon as we can!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hinmi
Reviews.Content: This is a very busy hotel in a prime location for visiting Singapore. I stayed here before and this time is the 2nd, each time on business trip. The rooms are small but up to date and comfortable. The reception desk does an efficient job. In my case, the check in took forever...but as I learned later because the lady who checked me in secured me a non-smoking room with a king size bed instead of 2 Queens. All i all a very neice hotel. It is walking distance to the prime shops of Orchard Road and some nice bars and restaurants. The breakfast buffet is very nice (especially the coffee).

Reviews.Title: “Orchard was OK”
Reviews.Author: sjskt3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orchard Hotel for 2 weeks in Feb. while on a buisness project. The hotel is located right at the end of bustling Orchard Rd. near most of the expensive designer shops and malls. I arrived very early in the morning and had no difficulties checking in and getting to my room. The hotel is divided into 2 wings with one being a little older than the other. I was in the older wing, but thought the room was very tasteful and modern. The rooms are a bit on the small side by American standards, but are still nice. I found the bathroom especially interesting as there is large round window between the bath/shower and the living area of the room. The only complaints about the room are that you can not adjust the temperature even though there is a thermostat in each room. They keep the air conditioning in the rooms set very cold! The other issue was that the carpet in the room was very dirty and didn't look like it had been cleaned in years. There is a very nice buffet for breakfast with lots of food selections to suit people of all tastes. There is a restaurant in the hotel, but I did not ever eat at it. Room service is offered 24hrs a day and has a pretty good selection, although I never found the food to be that good. There is also a lounge area in the lobby with live music everynight except Sunday. The same group sings there everynight, and although they try, they just aren't very good. The hotel will be going to all non-smoking rooms by March 2007, but smoking is allowed in the lounge area. There is an outdoor pool on the 4th floor which is very nice and some of the rooms in both wings overlook it. You are also able to get Tiger or Corona beer around the pool if you can find the wait staff. They tend to disappear from the pool area during the day. The hotel is connected to a shopping center that has mostly food shops. There is a Subway and Tony Roma's restaurant as well as a money exchange booth that keep good hours. At night, right accross the street there are prostitutes that pick up men in the bars in the shopping center next to the hotel. I went out a few times in the evening as a lone female and never felt threatened, but it was somewhat unfavorable to see next to the hotel. The area is very safe and there are always people out walking around. Overall the hotel sees a lot of business travelers and seems to be busy all the time. I don't know that I would stay here again if I ever came back to Singapore for holiday, but the hotel was ok by me.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not great for lone female travellers”
Reviews.Author: SiobhanP
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine at check in but I was told they did not have a double bed just a single. This struck me later as odd. I did not realise the heat and immediately walked towards the shops to buy a dress for my business meetings the next day. As you turn to head down orchard there were a lot of Benches with men on them and I thought I heard a few comments. It struck me as off as I was told it was very female friendly and safe for women here. I returned and decided to have a drink in the lobby arounf 9pm with a magazine and my book. Very frosty reception from the waitress and felt like i was being watched by a table of men beside me who were not singaporean. My colleague the next day told me that after 10pm Prostitutes sit on the Benches outside and get picked up in a cab from the hotel. An Aussie lady I met on the way to the airport told me she had a drink the night before and a group of men were pointing at her. Did they think we were working gals??? She also had two singles and somone above her kept making noise all night. Maybe the double are for "other customers". Travelling for business alone I will not be staying here again. On the other side the hotel was VERY clean but the food was average. Breakfast was the better meal I had here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Hima
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orchard Hotel for four days and on the whole had a good experience. The hotel is right at the end of Orchard Road and therefore it is in a great location as you can simply walk down the long strip and ensure that you have not missed anything! The hotel is particularly popular with people on business and I encountered a lot of people who were staying at the hotel for business purposes. The pool area is on the third floor although with the hotel's prime location you may struggle to find the time to use the pool! The rooms although fairly small, are modern and newly renovated. There is a coffee shop in the lobby with a lovely bakary attached. The Hotel also has it's own little parade of shops attached although I would advise you not to exchange your currency in the currency exchange shop attached to the hotel as the rate is not as good as it is outside. There is a nearby convienience store which offers a better rate of exchange. There is also a Subway, an Irish Pub and restaurant attached to the little shopping mall to the hotel. On the whole I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a comfortable and centrally located hotel which is reasonably priced compared to some of the more well known chain of hotels situated on Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: qwertyHound
Reviews.Content: As soon as I had arrived at Orchard Hotel, I felt unwelcome. We stayed at the Orchard Hotel for a total of two nights, three days. We chose this hotel because of its central location, and because it was hosting a conference we were attending in Singapore. We booked a room online with the triple B package. We were given a Superior Deluxe room with Internet access. It turned out the room had wireless broadband access, which was a plus. We drove into Singapore in a rented Malaysian car. As we drove into the front drive to drop off our luggage, we were completely ignored by the doorman. We stood and waited for five minutes until we were able to flag someone down to help us. In front was a van of European tourists, who were immediately attended to. As it was Christmas season, the check-in desk was understandably busy. However, the check-in desk was understaffed and disorganized. There was no sense of queue, and we had to fend for our place in line. Our room appeared hastily cleaned, and the floors were unvacuumed. The room was quite noisy at night. The breakfast spread was large, though once again, the service was questionable. Although we had booked for two people, the hotel made a mistake in the number of breakfasts allotted to our room (i.e. one breakfast for two people). The server was disagreeable, and didn't even think to give us the benefit of the doubt. She went to find the manager, and then halfway there, she realized she had made a mistake and quickly led us to a table beside the kitchen. Upon requesting to be seated in a quieter location, she snapped back and said that all the tables were full, though in reality, the entire cafe was probably half full. The final straw came at check-out, when I went to ask the concierge for driving directions back to Malaysia. Behind me were three young girls from Thailand, and I felt that the concierge was more interested in picking up these girls than helping me with my directions. Upon asking for the directions, the concierge then went on to say that "he didn't know." And when asked if he had a map, he said that the hotel didn't have any, when in fact the previous day they had given me a map. Afterwards, I overheard the concierge attempting to pick up these girls, asking them for their name cards and phone numbers. I was disgusted. When I brought up the issue with front desk, they quickly found someone else to give directions, and indeed, they did have a map. The customer service at Orchard Hotel is spotty, and at the very best, second rate. It appeared to me that customer service was conditional on your appearance, and secondly, your country of origin. Coming from Malaysia, I felt that we were treated less favourably than if I had waved around my Canadian passport (which I didn't). I am extremely dissapointed with Orchard Hotel, and I don't think I would ever stay there again. I do not recommend this hotel if staying in Singapore. I believe one can get much better service, and much better quality of accomodation for less.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Orchard”
Reviews.Author: maddmax
Reviews.Content: The Orchard was booked for us by a local government ministry. It was excellent. Great location, and the service was outstanding. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Vixenbird
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Orchard Hotel for 3 nights. The best thing about this hotel is the location, right on the Orchard Road. Rooms were average and bathrooms were a bit a the small side. Nice breafast buffet every morning..

Reviews.Title: “Singature Club Rooms are Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: QantasFlyer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Orchard Hotel twice. Once in September 2006 for 12 nights, the other in October 2006 for 5 nights. In the first stay, I stayed in a 'Signature Club Deluxe' Room in the Orchard Wing. These rooms are very well decorated (though almost to the point of almost being over the top). The bathroom is great (including a TV over the separate bath), and the bedroom has a couch and LCD TV. In addition, the room has many conveniences including push button lighting and automatic curtains. All in all it was a pleasant stay, though I must say that colleagues who stayed in the 'ordinary' rooms were not as impressed with hotel. While I didn't see their rooms I suspect there is large degree of difference between their Signature rooms and their standard rooms. For the second stay, I was upgraded to a suite, which was comparable to the Signature Club Deluxe room, though with a separate bedroom from living room, a walk-in closet (first I have seen in a hotel) and much larger windows. All in all, the Signature Club Rooms are very nice and you are unlikely to be disappointed. However the hotel does have room for improvement…My critiques are: -In both rooms there were problems with the 'Do Not Disturb' button (one wouldn't turn off, the other would turn off randomly). -In one stay the hotel room regularly lost power one day (this may have been a one-day occurrence) -In room movie options are very limited and TV picture quality is quite low (despite having an LCD TV’s) -The decor may not be to everyone’s liking -Location is great (on Orchard Road) though at an end of the street that is known for prostitution in the evenings which may make some visitors uneasy

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: kylied
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop on our round the world honeymoon and we found this hotel to be great. It is in a very good location near shops, a short walk to the train and Mac Donalds! The rooms are not huge but we had a comfortable bed, very clean bathroom and huge tv on the wall. The hotel also has a very impressive lobby and lounge which had live entertainment each night. The staff very friendly and helpful I would reccommend this hotel to anyone wanting something a little nice on their holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Spliff
Reviews.Content: This hotel is OK and provides decent accomodation. The pool area has a bar but doesn't provide any snacks or meals. Reasonable access for getting around Singapore. Staff OK but not particularly helpful. We had asked for connecting rooms as we have 3 children but had problems on arrival and initially were offered rooms not even next to each other. We ended up with rooms next to each other but not connecting but it took a lot of discussion to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LivinTheExpatLife
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a four day trip in September 2006. The staff were unfriendly when we checked in, which was a disappointment given how luxurious the lobby is. The person who helped us was new and in training, however she failed to smile or look at us while searching for our reservation. When she couldn't find the reservation, the person she called over to help her also did not smile or look at us, and they spoke only to each other (and not in English, which was a little frustrating since I kept asking what the problem was). Fortunately, this seemed to be a fluke because all other staff members were more than friendly during our stay. We were in a standard room, which was clean, beautiful, and nicely furnished (with the exception of the bed). The beds are very hard, which made for a bad night's sleep after walking around all day touring the city. The rooms are quite small, but we were hardly there so it did not make a difference. The mini bar is nicely stocked, but expensive of course. The breakfast buffet included in the room price was large with a variety of foods to choose from. We ate breakfast there every morning and usually were not hungry for lunch. We did not try any of the other restaurants in the hotel as there is a wide selection of restaurants in the area. The location of the hotel is great! It is only a short walk to a metro station, which we found to be the easiest way to get around. Taxis are cheap (and clean and safe) as well, and the hotel is well known so it was not difficult to find a taxi driver who knew their way to it. I would not recommend booking any tours at the desk in the lobby. We were disappointed when we booked a Night Safari tour only to find we'd paid a lot more just to have a bus take us there. We could have saved about 30-40 singapore dollars if we had taken a taxi or the metro. We also did a city tour which was fun for the river boat ride part of it, but the tour mostly took us to places we had already found on our own, so again it was not worth the money. Take a taxi and ask what places they recommend seeing, or buy a travel guide and take the metro around instead. Our overall experience at the hotel was pleasurable and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, w/ wonderful Exec Lounge”
Reviews.Author: Leebot
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in Singapore and this hotel was a pleasure. Yes the rooms are on the small side, but ours was attractively furnished and decorated with an Asian theme, very clean and comfortable, and most importantly -- quiet! We were in the Executive Suites though, so I can't describe the regular rooms. One of the best parts is the Executive Lounge on the top floor. It is well-staffed and the friendly attendants are helpful without being obtrusive. There is a selection of newspapers for the taking. The buffet is glorious, with all kinds of wonderful pastries, fruits, meats and smoked salmon, yogurt, cereal and even a short-order cook standing by to make your eggs however you like. One can also partake of Asian dishes here too. We ate far too much for breakfast, and in the afternoon a snack buffet is set out, and in the evening, more hors d'oueveres and snacks. The hotel itself is full of fun shops and restaurants. There is even a tailor, and one should get some custom-made clothes when visiting Singapore. There is also a pool and fitness center but we did not have a chance to visit as we were too busy sightseeing. There was also a tour coordinator located in the lobby who booked us on a sightseeing expedition to the nocturnal zoo -- transportation included and made everything so easy. My one complaint is that an open lounge area is located in the hotel lobby, with smoking permitted, so the entire lobby and adjoining cafe smells of cigarette smoke which is a real bugaboo with me; consequently we didn't spend any time there at all.

Reviews.Title: “First class service”
Reviews.Author: Erik2
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night as part of Singapore Airlines Stopover Program, with my wife, son, daughter in law and 2 grandchildren. Very friendly staff let us keep the rooms until 4 pm because of late departure for Europe. Nice Pool and excellent food. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ritchard
Reviews.Content: Once you get through the airport loungesque check in [i.e. chaotic], the hotel is of a good standard. Rooms are modern, bathrooms are marble and no signs of disrepair. Room service is good. No wifi but ethernet internet connections. Location is good for shopping, but if you want to head to Raffles and Chinatown - its a bit of a trek by foot. For those who use the gym - its impressive in comparison to other hotel gyms. Overall - its good value for money. I travel for a living and stay in 4-5* hotels around the globe and this is above average.
